description: Alyssa Quillan Colbert, a daughter of Angela Johnson Colbert and Virgis W. Colbert of Singer Island, Fla., was married June 4 to Gregory Paige Barrett, a son of Gail D. Barrett and Dr. Warrick L. Barrett, both of Indianapolis. The Rev. Ellen P. Tatreau, an American Baptist minister, performed the ceremony at the Old Whaling Church in Edgartown, Mass., on Marthas Vineyard.

title: Overtime Goal Gives San Jose Sharks Life in Stanley Cup Finals
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  It took an extra 12 minutes 18 seconds of overtime and a nifty goal by the rookie Joonas Donskoi, but home ice turned out to be exactly what the San Jose Sharks needed Saturday night as they came from behind for a 3-2 victory over the Pittsburgh Penguins in Game 3 of the Stanley Cup finals.

title: Corrections: June 5, 2016
description: NEW YORK

title: Kathryn Farley, Richard Lipton
description: Kathryn Tracy Farley and Richard Jay Lipton were married June 4 at the Catholic Shrine of the Immaculate Conception in Atlanta. Msgr. Henry Grancz performed the ceremony.

title: Your Weekend Briefing: Muhammad Ali, Golden State Warriors, Paris
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: Extending Estrogen Suppressor May Aid Breast Cancer Patients, Study Says
description: CHICAGO  Women with early-stage breast cancer could benefit from taking an estrogen-suppressing drug for 10 years rather than the standard five, researchers reported here on Sunday, citing the results of a new study.

title: Cuomo to Halt State Business With Groups That Back Boycott of Israel
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York ordered agencies under his control on Sunday to divest themselves of companies and organizations aligned with a Palestinian-backed boycott movement against Israel.

title: Wife of Bangladesh Policeman Who Went After Islamist Militants Is Killed
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  Three attackers fatally shot and stabbed the wife of a police superintendent in southern Bangladesh on Sunday morning, the police said, the latest in a series of killings in which Islamist militants are the primary suspects.

title: Taliban Claim Killing of 7 in Afghan Province, Including New Attorney General
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The newly appointed attorney general of Logar Province, just one hour into his job, was among seven people killed on Sunday when two Taliban insurgents attacked as his inauguration ceremony was ending, Afghan government officials said.

title: Whats on TV Sunday
description: Feed the Beast stars David Schwimmer in his first role as a series regular since Friends. The Miss USA pageant moves to Fox, without Donald J. Trump. And Kanye West and Death Cab for Cutie perform at the Governors Ball.

title: Muhammad Ali Shaped My Life
description: When I was 15 years old some kid at my school asked me what I felt about the draft and Vietnam. He wanted to know if I expected to go to war and if I was happy about that possibility. I told him that I had no intention of fighting the Vietnamese, first, and most importantly, because I have no desire to be killed or maimed and secondly, because I feel no hatred toward or fear of the Vietnamese people. These are the words I used and even at the time I wondered where they had come from.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking seven days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: He Worked for Bronx Tenants, Until His Past Caught Up
description: The building superintendents name was Vincent Bostick, and he was good with his hands, reliable and quick on snowy days to get outside with a shovel.

title: Muhammad Ali, American Legend
description: To the Editor:

title: Could a Muslim Judge Be Neutral to Donald Trump? He Doesnt Think So
description: Donald J. Trump, who said last week that a judges Mexican heritage should disqualify him from a lawsuit against Mr. Trump, expressed doubt on Sunday that a Muslim judge could remain neutral in the case, comments that are unlikely to ease concerns among his fellow Republicans who fear his controversial remarks could hurt the party in November.

title: Novak Djokovic Beats Andy Murray to Claim Elusive French Open Title
description: PARIS  When the French Open was finished, the sun finally came out, which seemed a most inappropriate punctuation mark for the cold and clammy tournament that had just ended.

title: Ideas on Reconciling Critics of the Presidential Primary Process
description: Its rare that President Obama and Reince Priebus, the Republican National Committee chairman, agree. In recent weeks, they both have said that the presidential nominating process is not rigged.

title: Governors Ball Music Festival Cancels Final Day Because of Weather
description: Performances at the outdoor music festival Governors Ball, including one by Kanye West, were canceled on Sunday because of severe weather.

title: UnREAL Returns on Lifetime With a Provocative Twist
description: Last summer brought us a pair of cable dramas about psychologically troubled antiheroes who gained access to the levers of mighty and vaguely sinister institutions: the global financial network and a hit reality show.

title: How Mossack Fonseca Helped Clients Skirt or Break U.S. Tax Laws With Offshore Accounts
description: How the Panama-based law firm set up offshore corporations, foundations and bank accounts for wealthy clients.

title: William Ponsoldt and Mossack Fonseca
description: The family of William R. Ponsoldt of Florida was one of Mossack Fonseca's most important clients in the United States. Here is a look at the firm's work, and the legal issues raised. Family members declined repeated requests for comment.

title: Harald Joachim von Der Goltz and Mossack Fonseca
description: Harald Joachim von der Goltz has been been a longtime client of Mossack Fonseca. The following documents illustrate how Mossack Fonseca established accounts using Mr. von der Goltz's Guatemalan nationality and passport.

title: Marianna Olszewski and Mossack Fonseca
description: Marianna Olszewski wanted to shift $1 million from an account in Guernsey to a new overseas account. In these documents, the law firm Mossack Fonseca offers to find a "natural person nominee" in a "tax-convenient" jurisdiction to stand in as the owner of the account.

title: Panama Papers Show How Rich United States Clients Hid Millions Abroad
description: Over the years, William R. Ponsoldt had earned tens of millions of dollars building a string of successful companies. He had renovated apartment buildings in the New York City area. Bred Arabian horses. Run a yacht club in the Bahamas, a rock quarry in Michigan, an auto-parts company in Canada, even a multibillion-dollar hedge fund.

title: U.S. to Press China to Curb Industrial Output
description: BEIJING  The Obama administration plans to use annual talks with leaders in Beijing to push for cuts in excess Chinese industrial output, which has inundated foreign markets with discounted steel, aluminum and other products, Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew said in Beijing on Sunday ahead of the meeting.

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows Is Latest Sequel to Struggle at Box Office
description: A meaty set of ninja turtles turned in thin results at the weekend box office, increasing the pressure on a struggling Paramount Pictures to find new hits.

title: 1941: Germans Raid Egypt
description: LONDON  Germany has begun her direct offensive against Egypt and the Suez Canal. That was the interpretation in well informed quarters tonight [June 5] of the Nazi raid last night on Alexandria, Great Britains main naval base in the eastern Mediterranean. More than one hundred persons were killed and hundreds of others were wounded. One of Fuehrer Adolf Hitlers first objectives, following the capture of Crete, would be to render untenable the British naval headquarters in Egypt, cripple the Royal Navy and leave Germany in control of the eastern Mediterranean, informed circles at London declared. The more the Nazis could disorganize the British fleets positions in those waters the easier a sea invasion of Cyprus and Syria would become, it was pointed out. It was believed here that last nights attack on Alexandria was the forerunner of increasingly heavy bombing raids on that port. The Nazi planes, operating, it is believed from airports in Greece and the Dodecanese Islands, poured tons of high explosives and incendiary bombs on Alexandria, according to a communiqu issued by the Egyptian Ministry of the Interior. Many buildings were destroyed in the ninety-minute raid.  New York Herald Tribune, June 6, 1941

title: Watchdog That Shepherded Panama Papers Now Constrained by Finances
description: WASHINGTON  As news outlets round the world continued to publish revelations from the Panama Papers, the nonprofit organization that coordinated the project was preparing to move out of its offices here in an effort to cut costs.

title: Amid Clashing Styles and Unstatisfying Results, Argentina Tries to Put Best Foot Forward
description: BUENOS AIRES  For fans of Argentinas national soccer team, the enduring images of recent tournaments are painful. Lionel Messi staring impotently at the World Cup trophy on his way to collecting a second-place medal in 2014. Gonzalo Higuan sending a penalty kick skyward as Chile won last years Copa Amrica final. Roberto Ayala turning a cross into his own net in yet another lost Copa final in 2007.

title: 1916: British Victory At Jutland
description: LONDON Little by little the story of last weeks battle in the North Sea is being pieced together, and while it will necessarily be some time before the fullest details of the greatest naval fight in European waters since Trafalgar can be told, there is sufficient information to show that heavy as the losses sustained by Admiral Sir David Beattys gallant squadron were in throwing down the gauntlet to the whole German High Sea Fleet in its own waters, he did not come off the worse in the terrible encounter which followed.

title: Guaranteed Income for All? Switzerlands Voters Say No Thanks
description: GENEVA  Swiss voters on Sunday overwhelmingly rejected a proposal to guarantee an income to Switzerlands residents, whether or not they are employed, an idea that has also been raised in other countries amid an intensifying debate over wealth disparities and dwindling employment opportunities.

title: Bernie Sanders Vows Fight to Convention as Hillary Clinton Wins a Primary
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  Senator Bernie Sanders defiantly vowed again on Sunday to take his campaign to the Democratic National Convention this summer, even as Hillary Clinton edged closer to clinching the partys presidential nomination and the final primary contests drew near.

title: Russia to Return Israeli Tank Used in 82 Battle With Syrians
description: JERUSALEM  In a sign of growing cooperation, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia has agreed to return to Israel a tank that was seized during a disastrous 1982 battle with Syrian forces in southern Lebanon, an episode that left three Israeli soldiers missing in action and has haunted Israel for more than 30 years.

title: A Carnival of Life Flourishes in Kabuls Field of the Dead
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The childrens gathering point is the grave of one Bibi Jawaher. She has been dead for 27 years, the inscription on her headstone so faded that you have to run your fingers over it to fully make out her name and the year of her death.

title: Matt Harvey Turns in Solid Performance, but Mets Lose
description: MIAMI  It was a classic pitchers duel from start to finish on Sunday afternoon, and while Matt Harvey came out on the wrong end of a 1-0 score against the Miami Marlins Jose Fernandez, he still had a good deal to feel positive about.

title: The Buddy Cops of Rizzoli & Isles Near the Shows Retirement
description: On television, as in life, comfort food comes in all sorts of flavors. Theres the tart apple pie of NCIS, the solid corned beef and cabbage of Blue Bloods, the wacky loco moco of Hawaii Five-0.

title: Chick Coreas 75th Birthday Celebration Will Make Music for Months
description: When the jazz pianist Chick Corea celebrates a milestone birthday, he doesnt hold back. In 2001, when he turned 60, he played a three-week career retrospective at the Blue Note Jazz Club. He did it again at 70, with an even broader array of partners.

title: Review: Labor of Love and The Course of Love, on Finding and Keeping It
description: Im single because I was born that way, Mae West said. Not all of us wear that fact with such flair, and instead spend our time in varying states of anxiety wondering how to change it. Two new books  one by Moira Weigel, a doctoral candidate at Yale, and the other by the essayist, novelist and professional aperu generator Alain de Botton  take strikingly different approaches to analyzing how we seek out and hold on to love.

title: Review: In Le Comte Ory, a Salacious Rossini Comes Through
description: Before the bisexual threesome, the kick line of cross-dressed nuns, the near-naked game of Twister and the yogurt feast, LoftOperas production of Rossinis riotous Le Comte Ory begins with a relative whisper.

title: Heng on Trumps Relationship With North Korea
description: A North Korean propaganda website praised Donald Trump and said he is the right choice for president of the United States.

title: Review: Prize Puts Dance and Drumming in the Spotlight
description: As a prologue to a formal dance piece, a thunderous drum solo is a risky choice. It kicks the show off with a bang, but can the choreography match and maintain that excitement? The achievement of Anna Sperbers Prize is that it largely does.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 6
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Why J. K. Rowling Endorsed Harry Potter and the Cursed Child for the Stage
description: LONDON  It begins with the scene that ended the final book.

title: Someones Home
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Being edited is just one of the things writers have to get used to if they want to be published.

title: NPR Journalist and Translator Killed by Taliban in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An American journalist for NPR was killed on Sunday afternoon along with his Afghan translator in a Taliban ambush in southern Afghanistan, the Afghan military confirmed. NPR also confirmed their deaths on Sunday.

title: New Super PAC Backing Donald Trump Hires Strategist Once Critical of Him
description: A new super PAC supporting Donald J. Trump and backed by one of his close friends has hired the strategist Alex Castellanos to cut advertisements and work on strategy.

title: The Sounds of Penn Station
description: The classical music played at Penn Station is meant to soothe harried travelers. Some commuters consider it part of the stations hustle-and-bustle ambience, while others did not hear it until it was pointed out to them.

title: Penn Station Is Shabby, but at Least It Sounds Nice
description: It is one of the incongruities of life in New York that some of the most appealing music ever written, a Beethoven trio, for example, or a Mozart sonata, is played in one of the most unappealing public spaces ever built  Pennsylvania Station.

title: President Obama and Indias Modi Forge an Unlikely Friendship
description: WASHINGTON  There are few relationships between President Obama and another world leader more unlikely than the one he has with Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India.

title: 15-Year-Old Canadian Takes Loss Hard in French Open Boys Final
description: PARIS  Three times, Felix Auger Aliassime was one point from claiming the boys singles title at the French Open on Sunday. But with a budding career well ahead of schedule, Auger Aliassime will have to wait just a little bit longer for a victory on the biggest stages of the sport.

title: Justice or Conspiracy? Terrorism Trial Divides Somalis in Minneapolis
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The day after his oldest son was convicted of conspiring to join and kill for the Islamic State in Syria, Abdihamid Yusuf just wanted to go home and rest. But bills were stacking up, so on Saturday morning he and his wife visited the jail and then reopened Hooyos Kitchen, the small Somali restaurant where they serve plates of chicken, rice and bananas.

title: Negotiating Tariffs With China as Britain Considers Surveillance Laws
description: Heres what to expect in the week ahead.

title: Bobby Williams Dies at 86; Led Undefeated Notre Dame to a Title in 1949
description: Bobby Williams, a nimble quarterback who led the Fighting Irish of Notre Dame to an undefeated championship season in 1949, died on May 26 at his home in Timonium, Md. He was 86.

title: Aging Japanese Women Find a Resigned Solace in South Korea
description: GYEONGJU, South Korea  She spends hours a day watching the Japanese broadcaster NHK. Her bedside table is stacked with Japanese magazines and figurines in kimonos. The walls bear pictures of Mount Fuji.

title: Donald Trump Adds Well-Known G.O.P. Adviser to Campaign Staff
description: Donald J. Trumps campaign is adding staff members to key areas it has been criticized for neglecting, bringing on Jim Murphy as its new national political director and preparing to beef up its communications team.

title: The Man in the Blue Suit
description: Dear Diary:

title: Virginia at Center of Racially Charged Fight Over the Right of Felons to Vote
description: RICHMOND, Va.  On the night Barack Obama became the nations first black president, Leah Taylor, a fast-food worker and African-American mother of six, stayed up until 2 a.m. watching the election returns. I knew that was history, and I wanted to be a part of it, she said. But she did not vote.

title: Broadways The King and I to Close
description: Lincoln Center Theater unexpectedly announced Sunday that it would close its production of The King and I this month.

title: William McGirt Wins Memorial to Secure First PGA Victory
description: DUBLIN, Ohio  The top three players in the world came into the Memorial Tournament fresh off victories. A lot of good that did them. Rory McIlroy, the worlds No. 2 golfer, backed into a tie for fourth. Top-ranked Jason Day finished tied for 27th, and Jordan Spieth was tied for 57th.

title: Muhammad Ali Remembered, by Those Who Knew Him as Cassius
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Muhammad Ali filled the middle of three screens in the small theater. In footage taken a few years after his 1960 Olympic gold medal performance, he was explaining his decision to sit out the Vietnam War to a group of white male college students.

title: After Rain Delay, Orioles Pounce to Topple the Yankees
description: BALTIMORE  As the Yankees first-base coach, Tony Pena, stood in the dugout Sunday morning, he was asked to consider a hypothetical situation. What if his son, Francisco, came to the plate for the Baltimore Orioles with two outs, the bases loaded and the Yankees clinging to a one-run lead?

title: With Closing of East Village Shop, Little Ukraine Grows Smaller
description: In July 1910, a teenager named Myron Surmach left his village in Ukraine, boarded the ship Atlanta with a third-class ticket and headed across the ocean to an improbably big city called New York. For 21 days, Mr. Surmach sucked on a lemon to stave off seasickness until he reached Ellis Island. There, he told an interviewer decades later, he was shocked to find an American guard welcoming him to the United States in perfect Ukrainian.

title: Andy Murrays Misfortune: Hes the Same Age as Novak Djokovic
description: PARIS  Andy Murray was born May 15, 1987, in Glasgow, a wee lad destined to resurrect Britains fortunes in mens tennis.

title: Cultivating Brand Loyalty in Even the Toughest Customer
description: AMERICANS are both more loyal and more fickle than ever before, judging by the number of customer rewards cards they have and the number they actually use.

title: How the G.O.P. Plans to Restrict de Blasios Control of New York City Schools
description: In his latest swipe at Mayor Bill de Blasio, the State Senate majority leader, John J. Flanagan, introduced a bill on Friday that would extend mayoral control of New York City schools by only one year, while allowing the governor to appoint an education inspector with substantial power to interfere in the management of the schools.

title: In a Reversal, Germanys Military Growth Is Met With Western Relief
description: BERLIN  You know times have changed when the Germans announce they are expanding their army for the first time in 25 years  and no one objects.

title: Greed, Corruption and Danger: A Tarnished Afghan Gem Trade
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The local people called the militias takeover of the giant lapis mine in northeastern Badakhshan Province a white coup  easy and bloodless. Perhaps, but the seizure has become a lesson in how the lack of accountability and rule of law in Afghanistan can turn bounty into ruin.

title: Mike Breen Becomes N.B.A. Finals Play-by-Play Fixture
description: Mike Breen has sneaked up on us  if stealth is possible when youve called Knicks games on radio and TV for a quarter-century and been the lead voice of the N.B.A. on ESPN and ABC for a decade.

title: Natalie Gulbiss Motivation Turns to Motherhood
description: GALLOWAY TOWNSHIP, N.J.  After Natalie Gulbis finished her rounds on Friday and Saturday at the ShopRite L.P.G.A. Classic, dozens of fans lined up near the green to interact with her. As Gulbis walked off the course, she signed autographs, posed for photos and engaged in small talk with anyone who approached.

title: Smaller Chips May Depend on Vacuum Tube Technology
description: PASADENA, Calif.  The future of computing may be in its past.

title: Led Zeppelins Stairway to Heaven to Be Scrutinized in Court in Copyright Case
description: Beyonc is on tour, Drake is setting streaming records and Taylor Swift has split up with her boyfriend. But next week, the most gripping news for the music industry may come out of a federal courtroom in Los Angeles.

title: The Trump Show, a Hit for Now, Faces a Test in the Fall
description: Its time to stop calling Donald J. Trumps presidential operation the Trump campaign. It would be far more accurate to call it Trump Productions Inc.

title: Why the Economic Payoff From Technology Is So Elusive
description: Your smartphone allows you to get almost instantaneous answers to the most obscure questions. It also allows you to waste hours scrolling through Facebook or looking for the latest deals on Amazon.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We were left making these headstones because death is easy here.

title: For N.H.L.s Black Aces, Its an Opportunity in Spades
description: By every measure, 2015-16 was a breakthrough season for the San Jose Sharks prospect Ryan Carpenter.

title: Prevention Magazine Will Become Ad-Free
description: Most magazines these days are trying to attract print advertising dollars. Not Prevention.

title: Branded a Terrorist for Reporting Two Sides of Ukraines War
description: I have had guns pointed at me, slept in a shipping container and walked past the corpses of shelling victims since the separatist insurgency in eastern Ukraine began two years ago. But I had never been blacklisted as a terrorist before.

title: Alis Least Memorable Fight
description: Muhammad Ali, who died Friday, was part of some of the most memorable sporting moments of the 20th century.

title: Songs, Toasts and Tales of the Past at a Broadway Bartenders Very Last Call
description: The post-matinee crowd began streaming into Sardis restaurant on Saturday, just as it had for decades. After passing through the Chianti-red facade, many patrons entered the Little Bar, an alcove-like room to the left of the entrance. Then they settled in for drinks and conversation in the company of a tall man wearing a maroon jacket, a white starched shirt and a black bow tie who had long been a steady presence there.

title: Thomas Schaefer, 85, Ranking Officer Among American Hostages in Iran, Dies
description: Thomas E. Schaefer, a retired Air Force colonel who endured death threats, harsh interrogation and solitary confinement as the ranking military officer among the 52 Americans held hostage for 444 days in Iran in the closing stages of the Carter administration, died on Tuesday in Scottsdale, Ariz. He was 85.

title: Silicon Valley Season 3, Episode 7: Stop, Beta Time
description: Until the last mouse click of To Build a Better Beta, Pied Piper has existed only in the abstract, with endless promise and limitless value. Richards compression platform could be worth billions. It could be the next Facebook. It could change the world. Alternately, it could be utterly worthless, one of the countless failed start-ups that pile up in Silicon Valley like E.T. cartridges in a New Mexico landfill. As Erlich Bachman, the father of such stillborn incubees as Aviato and Nip Alert, says, Shuttering a company in the Valley like a rite of passage, like herpes simplex one. The metaphor gets more disgusting from there.

title: Warriors, Resilient at Home, Cruise Against the Cavaliers
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Steve Kerr, the coach of the Golden State Warriors, is fairly open about the fact that he plays favorites. When it comes to shooting the basketball, Stephen Curry and Klay Thompson are allowed to do whatever they want. They can chuck shots from the bleachers. Bad shots do not exist for them.

title: Ramadan Is Here. What Islams Holiest Month Is About.
description: Hossein Kamaly is a professor at Barnard College who specializes in Islamic studies and Middle Eastern history. In an interview, he explained the basic tenets of Ramadan, the holiest month of the Muslim calendar, which begins on Monday for most of the worlds Muslims. The interview has been edited and condensed.

title: The Right Way to Observe Ramadan
description: ISTANBUL  THE Islamic holy month of Ramadan begins today and with it the long hours of fasting by hundreds of millions of Muslims. The daylong fast during the lunar month in which we Muslims believe that the Quran was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad is one of the five pillars of Islam. It is a way for Muslims to show their devotion to God, and, some say, to understand the suffering of those who have no choice but to go without food.

title: Veep Season 5, Episode 7: Do a Little Dance ...
description: Through nearly five seasons of Veep, weve seen Selina Meyer suffer embarrassments galore and absorb loss after loss, to the point that some may wonder how anyone so gaffe-prone and ineffectual ever wound up in the Oval Office. This weeks episode answers that question: Its because Selina can be vicious. Veep can rarely be called triumphant, but toward the end of this episode, when a dazzlingly attired President Meyer is demolishing her enemies with devastating words and a killer smile  well, for a few moments she actually is the most powerful person in the free world. Shes stunning, in every sense of the word.

title: The Humans and Shuffle Along Take Top Honors at Drama Desk Awards
description: The Humans and Shuffle Along each earned four awards, with The Humans winning for outstanding play and Shuffle Along for outstanding musical, at the Drama Desk Awards on Sunday night.

title: Game of Thrones Season 6, Episode 7: Never Too Late
description: Never too late to come back.

title: Denver Broncos Cornerback Aqib Talib Is Shot in the Leg
description: Denver Broncos cornerback Aqib Talib was shot in the leg at a nightclub in Dallas, a team spokesman said Sunday.

title: Report Accuses Mexico of Crimes Against Humanity in Drug War
description: MEXICO CITY  Two days after Jorge Antonio Parral Rabadn was kidnapped by a criminal gang, the Mexican Army raided the remote ranch where he was a prisoner and killed him. As he instinctively raised his hands in defense, the soldiers fired over and over at point-blank range.

title: Pedro Kuczynski Holds Thin Lead Over Keiko Fujimori in Peru Presidential Election
description: LIMA, Peru  An economist who served as Perus prime minister held a razor-thin lead in the presidential contest on Sunday against the daughter of an imprisoned former president who was seeking to return her family to power.

description: gibberish  \ji-b(-)rish, gi-\  noun

title: No Corrections: June 6, 2016
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Wu Tong on Traversing Musical Boundaries in China
description: As a master sheng player and vocalist, Wu Tong is one of Chinas most successful crossover musicians. In 1991, he and four conservatory classmates founded the band Lunhui, or Again, which in 2000 became the first rock band to play on national television in China. In more recent years, Mr. Wu has traded in his rocker uniform for the less raucous, though no less energetic, world music circuit. He is a founding member of Yo-Yo Mas Silk Road Ensemble, the international music collective, which in April released the album Sing Me Home. In an interview, Mr. Wu, 44, talked about the new album, his evolving relationship with the sheng and what it was like to be a rock musician in China in the 1990s.

title: Pilots Find Pride in Russias Skies
description: After attending an air show at a military training base, Maxim Babenko set out to document the servicemen in Russias Air Force, and to showcase the unseen facets of their military lives.

title: Pilots Find Pride in Russias Skies
description: Maxim Babenko was at a Russian military training base a few months ago, sitting among thousands of spectators at an air show. Looking around, he was impressed by the crowds seemingly unconditional admiration for the pilots. The applause was riotous; dozens of people reached out just to touch the pilots; children posed endless questions to them about how they could one day fly a fighter jet.

title: 2016 Found Poem Favorite | The Sickness Man has Spread
description: We are honoring the top winners of our Seventh Annual Found Poem Student Contest by publishing their work from June 6-17. Youll be able to read the whole collection here as we go.

title: The Albany Pols Who Love Plastic Bags
description: When it comes to behaving badly, the New York State Legislature has been thinking outside the box. There are, it turns out, ways to do the wrong thing that go beyond the usual influence-peddling, bribing, extorting and other common varieties of Albany venality.

title: A Pause That Distresses
description: Fridays employment report was a major disappointment: only 38,000 jobs added, a big step down from the more than 200,000 a month average since January 2013. Special factors, notably the Verizon strike, explain part of the bad news, and in any case job growth is a noisy series, so you shouldnt make too much of one months data. Still, all the evidence points to slowing growth. Its not a recession, at least not yet, but it is definitely a pause in the economys progress.

title: Sanders Fans, I Get Your Pain. But Lets Unite Against Trump.
description: WE had lost. And I was as sure as Ive been about anything else in my life that my party was making an enormous mistake. My candidate had won 23 primaries, about 1,900 delegates and, by one count, the popular vote. My candidate may have actually gotten more votes than the guy we Democrats were about to nominate, who was inexperienced and, I thought, unelectable.

title: Muhammad Ali: Never the White Mans Negro
description: CASSIUS CLAY, born in 1942, was the grandson of a slave; in the United States of his boyhood and young manhood, the role of the black athlete, particularly the black boxer, was a forced self-effacement.

title: To Stop Bad Prosecutors, Call the Feds
description: Prosecutors are the most powerful players in the American criminal justice system. Their decisions  like whom to charge with a crime, and what sentence to seek  have profound consequences.

title: Brazils Gold Medal for Corruption
description: Michel Temer, Brazils interim president, displayed poor judgment on his first day in office last month when he appointed an all-white, all-male cabinet. This understandably angered many in racially diverse Brazil.

title: The Madness of America
description: The candidacy of Donald Trump, the fervor of those who support it, and the fierce opposition of those who dont is making America mad  both angry and insane, as the dual definitions of the word implies.

title: Do Dramas About Slavery Stifle Tales of Black Lives Now?
News Qs | Muhammad Alis Legacy
description: The following lesson activity is based on the obituary Muhammad Ali Dies at 74: Titan of Boxing and the 20th Century.

title: The Transcendent Artistry of a Legendary Dancer, Four Decades In
description: FAME, WROTE Rainer Maria Rilke, in 1902, is, after all, only the sum of all the misunderstandings that gather around a new name. The line appears at the beginning of a short book on Auguste Rodin that a 27-year-old Rilke published when the world-famous sculptor was 63. However much we think we know about Rodin, the young poet argued, were wrong. And yet, Rilke goes on to say, its not even worth taking the time to disabuse us of our errors, for they gathered around the name, not around the work.

title: Bernie Sanderss Chances of Winning Have Faded, but His Rallies Havent
description: DAVIS, Calif.  In a rally here last week, 9,000 people came to hear Senator Bernie Sanders speak, some catching a glimpse from a parking garage roof.

title: In Mississippi Town, Some Fear School Desegregation Ruling May Backfire
description: CLEVELAND, Miss.  The multicultural high school band kicked off a punchy Pomp and Circumstance as the 2016 graduates of Cleveland High School marched across the gymnasium. They were a near-equal mix of black and white students, with the occasional Nguyen, Patel or Rojas sprinkled among them.

title: Student Question | Is Be Yourself Bad Advice?
description: How many times in your life have you been told all you have to do is be yourself? What were the situations in which you received this advice?

title: Rothschild & Company to Acquire Compagnie Financire Martin Maurel
description: LONDON  Rothschild & Company said on Monday it had agreed to acquire Compagnie Financire Martin Maurel in a deal that would unite two long-established family names in French banking.

title: E.L.L. Practice + Prompt | Reflections on the School Year
description: We invite any English-language-learner student 13 years or older to post comments in response to the writing prompts in this post.

title: War Wounds That Time Alone Cant Heal
description: No doubt in the course of your life, you did something, or failed to do something, that left you feeling guilty or ashamed. What if that something was in such violation of your moral compass that you felt unable to forgive yourself, undeserving of happiness, perhaps even unfit to live?

title: Your Monday Briefing: Muhammad Ali, Hillary Clinton, French Open
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Hong Kongs Murder Mystery: Who Is Poisoning the Dogs?
description: Grim reminders of some of Hong Kongs most gruesome murders line Bowen Road: signs posted every few hundred steps that warn, Beware of Dog Poisoning.

title: Cold Brew in the Form of an Ice Pop
description: Cold-brew coffee, emphasis on the cold, is what you get in this new ice pop from Brewla, a company whose other flavors are fruit based. The bar is a lightly sweetened mixture of the coffee and organic milk: Brewla Barista, box of five, $5.99 at Union Market stores in Manhattan and Brooklyn, brewlabars.com.

title: Lifting the Curtain on New Yorks Food Scene
description: A survey of the personalities who make New Yorks food scene tick are collected in this compelling volume by a writer whose beat is not food. What she offers are first-person accounts from more than 50 individuals behind city institutions like Zabars and Peter Luger. You will find Justo Thomas, the fish butcher at Le Bernardin; Jeb Burke, the head chef at Rupert Murdochs News Corporation; and Nino Esposito, an owner of Sette Mezzo. And there are plenty of opinions to savor, like Mr. Espositos point that New Yorkers like to see and be seen by people they know: Food and the City by Ina Yalof (G. P. Putnams Sons, $28).

title: The Bartenders Bar Cart
description: To create a series of bar carts, USM Modular Furniture tapped the expertise of three New York mixologists: Ivy Mix of Leyenda, Jane Danger of Mother of Pearl, and St. John Frizell of Fort Defiance. Using the companys colorful modular Haller shelving, each has come up with a rolling bar cart that can be used indoors or out. For hers, Ms. Danger included a shelf to hold a record player. The height of each cart varies according to the designer. None include a built-in cutting board, something I would want, but the people at USM say it can be added. The carts are worth considering for a very special dad, graduate or newlyweds: Limited Edition Bar Carts, $3,778 to $5,466 at USM Modular, 28 Greene Street (Grand Street), 212-371-1230, usm.com.

title: Morning Agenda: Credit Suisse Boss Faces Revolt
description: CREDIT SUISSE BOSS FACES REVOLT | Credit Suisse, the second-largest bank in Switzerland after UBS, is in open revolt just a year after Tidjane Thiam took over as chief executive and shifted the banks focus to wealth management,Landon Thomas Jr. reports in DealBook. Shares in Credit Suisse are also down 50 percent over the last year.

title: Arrest Made in Killing of Jordanian Intelligence Officers
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Three officers of the Jordanian intelligence service and two other employees of the service were killed on Monday in a Palestinian refugee camp near the capital, Amman, in what the government said was a terrorist attack.

title: New York Today: A Classical Commute
description: Updated, 12:20 a.m.

title: New Opioid Limits Challenge the Most Pain-Prone
description: If youve come to rely on opioids for chronic pain, as a growing proportion of older adults has, you may have noticed that the drugs are becoming more difficult to get.

title: Early Puberty in Girls Raises the Risk of Depression
description: When girls come in for their physical exams, one of the questions I routinely ask is Do you get your period? I try to ask before I expect the answer to be yes, so that if a girl doesnt seem to know about the changes of puberty that lie ahead, I can encourage her to talk about them with her mother, and offer to help answer questions. And I often point out that even those who have not yet embarked on puberty themselves are likely to have classmates who are going through these changes, so, again, its important to let kids know that their questions are welcome, and will be answered accurately.

title: Donald Trump Makes His First Congressional Endorsement
description: Donald J. Trump made his first congressional endorsement this weekend, backing Representative Renee Ellmers in a North Carolina primary race in which she has been opposed by heavily funded adversaries.

title: Congress Returns From Break to Face a Backlog
description: Congress returns this week after a Memorial Day break, with lawmakers needing to get busy on a pileup of legislation in a year shortened by the elections and by national political conventions in July.

title: Donald Trump Questioned About Previous Positions on Libya and Iraq
description: Donald J. Trump found himself on the defensive on Sunday over his claims that he had opposed the intervention in Libya and the war in Iraq.

title: Candidates Prepare for One Last Heave in California
description: Democratic supporters of Hillary Clinton will be hoping that Tuesday, when the California primaries take place, will be the moment she can start looking forward to facing Donald J. Trump with a united front.

title: 1916: Lord Kitchener Lost at Sea
description: LONDON  The Secretary of the Admiralty communicates to the press the following telegram, which he received at 10.30 a.m. today [June 6] from the Commander-in-Chief of the Grand Fleet:

title: Race Appears Over for Bernie Sanders, but California Still Offers Drama
description: The Democratic race may already be over by the time the California polls open. According to The Associated Press, Hillary Clinton has already earned the 2,383 delegates needed to win the nomination. Yet in some ways California is still the most interesting contest between her and Bernie Sanders so far.

title: On One California Night, Triumph and Tragedy
description: In many ways, the personal characteristics of Robert Kennedy are very much like the dominant characteristics of the American people, The New York Times wrote on June 6, 1968, the day he died.

title: Joel McHale Takes On the CFDA Awards: Everyone Should Be Ready
description: The Council of Fashion Designers of America awards, a.k.a. the Oscars of fashion, taking place Monday night at the Hammerstein Ballroom in New York, can feel like Groundhog Day, with the same names nominated over and over again. This year, every nominee for womens wear designer of the year has already won that accolade at least once. And one, Marc Jacobs, has already won a lifetime achievement award.

title: The Cavs That LeBron James Assembled Are Getting Clobbered
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Before excuses are made for LeBron James, before the bulk of the blame for consecutive horror shows at Oracle Arena is heaped on a supporting cast of Cleveland Cavaliers that has turned to dust when removed from a comfy Eastern Conference refuge, it must be reiterated that this was the team the King himself courted.

title: Where Nearly Half of Pupils Are Homeless, School Aims to Be Teacher, Therapist, Even Santa
description: There are supposed to be 27 children in Harold Boyd IVs second-grade classroom, but how many of them will be there on a given day is anyones guess.

title: Only in Europe Can Britain Be Great
description: LONDON  With just days remaining before the referendum on European Union membership, two anxieties are colliding: the fear of job losses if Britain leaves and the fear of high immigration if it remains. News headlines reflect a country that is not at ease with itself, trapped between what a former American secretary of state, Dean Acheson, once described as an imperial past it finds hard to relinquish and a future role it is reluctant to embrace.

title: China Pushes Back Against U.S. Complaints of Industrial Overcapacity
description: BEIJING  The Chinese finance minister jabbed back on Monday at complaints from his American counterpart that Chinas glut of factories making mountains of steel, aluminum and other products was overwhelming foreign markets and makers.

title: The U.S. Is Failing in Infant Mortality, Starting at One Month Old
description: Many more babies die in the United States than you might think. In 2014, more than 23,000 infants died in their first year of life, or about six for every 1,000 born. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, 25 other industrialized nations do better than the United States at keeping babies alive.

title: Newt Gingrichs Criticism on Judge Remarks Surprises Donald Trump
description: Donald J. Trump expressed surprise on Monday that one of his supporters from the Republican Party, Newt Gingrich, had criticized him for his remarks about the heritage of the federal judge overseeing a lawsuit against the defunct Trump University.

title: Uber Rolls Out App Improvements to Meet Driver Demands
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Tensions have long simmered between Uber and its drivers who power the ride-hailing service. Drivers held protests when Uber cut fares with little warning and have filed class-action lawsuits to be recognized as company employees rather than independent contractors.

title: Ukraine Struggles to Shake Off Legacy of Corruption
description: KIEV, Ukraine  The text message to Ukraines minister of economy and trade was as unwelcome as it was unexpected. The sender, a stranger, wrote that he wanted to be the new deputy minister.

title: And Like a Tweet in the Night, Kanye Was Gone
description: Just past 2 a.m. Monday, Kanye West poked his head through the roof of a car heading north on Third Avenue in the East Village and surveyed what he had wrought. On East 11th Street, outside Webster Hall, maybe a couple of thousand young people were clustered  in the street, on the sidewalks, on stoops, on balconies, sitting atop Postal Service trucks  waiting for a just-announced concert that was beginning to seem as if it might not happen. When Mr. West rode by, a few hundred of them spied him and peeled off, surrounding his car, taking pictures, reaching for handshakes.

title: At Ceausescus Villa, Focus Is on Dcor, Not Dictatorship
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  In the 24 years that Nicolae Ceausescu ruled Romania, the mansion where he lived with his wife, Elena, was shrouded in secrecy.

title: ScienceTake | Looking Into a Flys Brain
description: Scientists have developed a new method for peeking into the brain of a freely walking fruit fly  by peeling back its head.

title: Creating a Window Into a Flys Brain
description: Fruit flies are far from human, but not as far as you might think.

title: In Search of Techs Productivity Boost
description: The dominant theme in the technology industry for more than a few years now has been social media and on-demand services. Facebook and Twitter. Uber and Airbnb. And a whole lot of other companies that have come and gone or are still going strong.

title: Expanding the Start Menu
description: Q. Can I change the size of the tiles in the Windows 10 Start menu? I want to make the apps I use the most bigger so I can find them faster.

title: Joachim Gauck, German President, Wont Seek Second Term
description: BERLIN  President Joachim Gauck of Germany announced on Monday that he would not seek a second five-year term for the largely ceremonial office, a declaration that could create more problems for Chancellor Angela Merkel.

title: Obama Is Eager to Hit the Stump for Hillary Clinton and Shred Donald Trump
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, after months of sitting on the sidelines of the rancorous contest to succeed him, is now ready to aggressively campaign for Hillary Clinton, starting with a formal endorsement of her candidacy as early as this week.

title: Not Your Typical Meat and Two
description: Sample Brooklyn with this handsome gift. Nils Wessell, who owns Brooklyn Butcher Blocks in Sunset Park, has teamed up with Michael Zieba of Zieba Knives in Greenpoint and John Ratliff, the charcutier and owner of Ends Meat in Industry City, to assemble a folding knife and some meaty salumi to go with one of his serious cutting boards: Fathers Day Gift Box, $99 including shipping, brooklynbutcherblocks.com and endsmeatnyc.com.

title: After Okinawa Car Crash, U.S. Prohibits Its Sailors in Japan From Drinking
description: TOKYO  The United States Navy imposed a drinking ban on its roughly 19,000 personnel in Japan on Monday, ordering them confined to their bases after a sailor who was thought to have been drinking was arrested on the island of Okinawa in connection with a car accident that left two Japanese civilians injured.

title: Questions Surround Sumner Redstones New Team of Representatives
description: For several decades, Sumner M. Redstone ran his media empire with forceful, fiery and sometimes fear-inducing resolve. Whether he was heatedly pursuing an acquisition or churning through chief executives, there was never much doubt about what he wanted.

title: Louvre and Muse dOrsay Prepare to Reopen as Floodwaters Recede in Paris
description: PARIS  The Louvre and the Muse dOrsay were preparing on Monday to reopen after they moved tens of thousands of artworks to higher floors last week as a precaution against the rising level of the Seine River. Other French cultural institutions, including the historic Chteau de Chambord in the Loire Valley, reopened and were assessing the damage.

description: Mike Grajewski, a former sheet metal worker, owns a Chicago accent so delightfully thick that it veers toward Saturday Night Live parody.

title: If Mark Zuckerberg Can Be Hacked on Twitter, So Can You
description: There are several lessons to be learned from a data breach in which hackers gained access to Mark Zuckerbergs social media accounts, but chief among them is probably this: Quit using the same password for multiple websites.

title: Was There an Ice Age in the Southern Hemisphere?
description: Q. Was there an ice age in the Southern Hemisphere?

title: Supreme Court to Hear Death Penalty Cases
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear two appeals raising questions about the roles race and intellectual disability might play in capital prosecutions.

description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking seven days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: How to Improve on Baseball
description: Lasers dont go far enough.

title: Italys Five Star Movement Leads in Romes Mayoral Election
description: ROME  Italys anti-establishment Five Star Movement moved one step closer to governing Rome on Monday, when returns released from nationwide municipal elections over the weekend took its candidate to a runoff vote in two weeks.

title: Brock Lesnar Returns to the U.F.C. Against Mark Hunt
description: Back in the days when mixed martial arts was still a vaguely disreputable spectacle that had not yet moved toward the sports mainstream, its biggest star was a former professional wrestler, Brock Lesnar. Now after an absence of almost five years, he is returning to the sport, at least for one night.

title: Libor-Rigging at Deutsche Bank May Be Harder to Prove
description: Reports a few years ago that global banks manipulated the London interbank offered rate, or Libor, to reap profits on their investments showed how easy it was to manipulate benchmarks used to set rates for trillions of dollars in mortgages, student loans and other financial products. Tell a few lies about the interest rates, and then watch the profits roll in  sounds like a classic fraud if ever there was one.

title: Did Americans Lose Something on the Path to Modernity?
description: Imagine you are a terrorist leader bent on humbling the United States. What would be the smartest strategy at this moment?

title: Brownies With Caramel: Sweet and Salty in a Committed Relationship
description: Ultimately, theres nothing you can make with chocolate thats better than a brownie, said Renato Poliafito, owner of two Baked bakeries in New York City with his partner and co-founder, Matt Lewis. You can make things that are fancier, or lighter, or creamier, but they wont be better.

title: Death of 3-Month-Old Staten Island Girl Is Ruled a Homicide
description: The death of a 3-month-old girl who was found unconscious by officers in a Staten Island apartment last summer has been ruled a homicide, the police said on Monday.

title: A Doctor on Schedule, Rarely on Time
description: The minute I got on that bus, I knew I was in trouble. The driver sat at the stop just long enough to miss the green light. Then he inched along till he missed the next light and the one after that. He stopped at every stop even though not a soul was waiting.

title: Muhammad Ali: The Champion Who Never Sold Out
description: Muhammad Ali was an ungentrified black man.

title: A Lavash Thats the Perfect Bread for Summer
description: Ripping off a warm piece of the lavash at Joe & Misses Doe, a small East Village restaurant with a devoted neighborhood following, feels like an apt way to honor our move into summer.

title: Janet Yellen Speech Indicates Fed Will Rethink Interest-Rate Plans
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Federal Reserve, mindful of unexpectedly weak job growth last month, has abandoned hope of raising interest rates at its next meeting in June, but Fed officials say they are still thinking seriously about raising rates in July or September.

title: De Blasio Shifts Away From His Re-election Message of One City
description: The central message of Mayor Bill de Blasios re-election pitch appeared clear, even early in his administration: After a winning 2013 campaign that deplored the tale of two cities, the mayors bid for a second term would be founded on his mission to create one city for all New Yorkers.

title: Hotels Aim to Stand Out With Local Art
description: Seeking to appeal to guests desire for new experiences and stand out in a competitive market, hotel brand managers are mining their local art communities for everything from inspiration to installations.

title: Whats on TV Monday
description: The Bureau, ric Rochants spy thriller and one of the most popular shows in France, infiltrates the United States. UnREAL returns with a Peabody Award and an African-American suitor. And Rizzoli & Isles begins its final season.

title: The Greatest? Heres Why.
description: Dont keep your chin up. Dont drop your hands. Dont get pinned in the corner. Muhammad Alis boxing style defied all these conventions. And yet, he was the greatest.

title: What You Should Watch: UnREAL, Angie Tribeca and Wentworth
description: Welcome to Watching, The New York Timess what-to-watch guide. We comb through releases big and small, famous and esoteric, to email readers twice a week with our timely recommendations. Our most recent suggestions also appear below. To receive our guide straight to your inbox, sign up here.

title: 1891: London Omnibus Strike
description: LONDON  The directors of the London General Omnibus Company refused to see a deputation of their men today [June 7]; so in obedience to the manifesto issued by the Bus and Tram Mens Union, the bus drivers from all parts of London made their way early this (Sunday) morning in thousands to the Royal Victoria Hall, Waterloo Bridge Road, to finally give their sanction to strike. Mr. T. Sutherst, the President of the Union, made a stirring speech, at the end of which he called out on strike every omnibus driver, conductor, stableman and horse keeper. If they did their duty, the strike would be at an end by Tuesday.  The New York Herald, European Edition, June 7, 1891

title: Pretrial Detention
description: To the Editor:

title: No Charges for Mother of Boy Who Slipped Into Gorilla Enclosure at Cincinnati Zoo
description: An Ohio prosecutor said Monday that no charges would be brought against Michelle Gregg, the mother of a 3-year-old boy whose foray into an exhibit at the Cincinnati Zoo led to the killing of a gorilla and set off a frenzy of condemnation online.

title: Single-Sex Swimming Pool
description: To the Editor:

title: Just Pay the Overtime
description: To the Editor:

title: Trump, McCain and the Judge
description: To the Editor:

title: Kenya Protests Turn Violent
description: Demonstrations broke out in Kenya after attempts at negotiations between the government and the opposition on how to reform the country's election commission failed, The Associated Press said.

title: Iraqis Who Flee Fighting in Falluja Find Hardship and Hunger
description: AMIRIYAT FALLUJA, Iraq  One of the Iraqi civilians who risked an escape from the sprawling battle for Falluja made it as far as the Euphrates River. He was there for all to see on Sunday morning: His body, tied to the side of a boat, bobbed in the muddy waters next to a rickety bridge that separates Baghdad from the violence of Anbar Province.

title: No More Groundhog Day for One Powerful Producer
description: Scott Rudin, a prolific and powerful producer on Broadway and in Hollywood, has withdrawn from a much-anticipated project to adapt the popular movie Groundhog Day into a stage musical.

title: Payday Lenders Fight Against Regulator Would Be a Long Shot
description: The new payday lending rule, once complete, will force many payday lenders out of business. That means that a legal challenge is certain, and also the courts, which worry about regulations that require bankruptcies, will take it seriously.

title: On Hart Island, Missed Friends and Common Graves
description: To the Editor:

title: A Disappointment for Kanye West Fans
description: Thousands of Kanye West fans gathered outside Webster Hall in the East Village after the rapper announced an impromptu 2 a.m. concert. But it was canceled, and police officers arrived to clear the streets.

title: Hungry Start-Ups Look to I.P.O.s as Venture Capital Dries Up
description: Wheezing unicorns may get a breath of fresh air from initial public offerings.

title: Kenyas Collective Uh-Oh: Another Election Is Coming
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  By 9 a.m. on Monday, clouds of black smoke blotted out the sky. A mountain of tires burned. Roads were blocked. Young men poured into the streets of a slum in Nairobi, gleefully carrying huge, jagged pieces of concrete.

title: Do Gorillas Even Belong in Zoos? Harambes Death Spurs Debate
description: Harambe, the 17-year-old Western lowland gorilla shot dead at the Cincinnati Zoo late last month after a 3-year-old boy fell into his enclosure, may be physically gone, his tissues harvested for research and his sperm extracted to help diversify the captive breeding gene pool.

title: Streaming Carries Drakes Views to a Fifth Week at No. 1
description: Another week, another No. 1 for Drake.

title: Hot 97s Summer Jam 2016
description: Severe weather on Sunday took a toll on the annual event, but what remained was a show that focused more intently on New York hip-hop than in recent years.

title: Muhammad Ali in Vietnam
description: WHEN Muhammad Ali said, I aint got no quarrel with them Vietcong. No Vietcong ever called me nigger, he spoke for many of the black soldiers and Marines who were in Vietnam fighting for an America that continued to oppress and marginalize them. One night in Chu Lai, I heard a black Marine say to a white one, Look, I dont want to hear gook or dink cause I dont know what youll call me tomorrow.

title: No Charges for Mother Over Dead Gorilla
description: An Ohio prosecutor said Monday that there will be no charges brought against a mother whose child fell into a Cincinnati Zoo enclosure, leading to the death of a silverback gorilla.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Light Sentence for Brock Turner in Stanford Rape Case Draws Outrage
description: A recall effort against a California judge was announced on Monday in a sexual assault case at Stanford University that ignited public outrage after the defendant was sentenced to a mere six months in jail and his father complained that his sons life had been ruined for 20 minutes of action fueled by alcohol and promiscuity.

title: Street Style: Governors Ball
description: The festival was cut short by stormy weather, but there was plenty of style in attendance.

title: When Eels Get Aggressive
description: Researchers studied how eels can use targeted, high-voltage volleys to attack their prey.

title: Like a Slimy Taser, Electric Eels Can Leap Out and Zap Their Prey
description: This summers science horror blockbuster is a remake: Return of the Leaping Electric Eel!

title: Peter Shaffer Dies at 90; Playwright Won Tonys for Equus and Amadeus
description: Peter Shaffer, a leading British playwright whose Tony-winning dramas Equus and Amadeus explored the male psyche through the entwined anguish of dual protagonists, died on Monday in County Cork, Ireland. He was 90.

title: New York Attorney General Seeks to Halt Sale of 2 Nursing Homes Amid Inquiries
description: Citing misrepresentations and broken promises, the New York State attorney generals office is seeking to prevent the purchase of two nursing centers by a company that was involved in transactions that put a Manhattan nursing home in the hands of luxury condominium developers.

title: A Day in Milan With Lorenzo Serafini
description: The designer takes T on a walking tour of his favorite places in his home city.

title: Photos of Summer Fashion at Governors Ball
description: The Governors Ball music festival came to Randalls Island this weekend, bringing out the stylish crowds, as well as the music. See photos from the festival above.

title: A Day in Milan  With One of Its Rising Fashion Stars
description: On a recent stormy Monday in Milan, Lorenzo Serafini, the designer of Philosophy di Lorenzo Serafini, set off on foot to spend an afternoon at his favorite local haunts. The crush of work designing the spring/summer 2017 collection was only beginning, and Serafini  tan and unshaven after a week of scuba diving in the Maldives  was still relaxed.

title: A Weekend in Chicago
description: Over Memorial Day weekend, 64 people were shot in Chicago, six fatally. Our team of journalists tracked the violence that has engulfed families and neighborhoods. Note: This video contains profanity.

title: Direct-to-Consumer Lab Tests, No Doctor Visit Required
description: Two years ago, Kristi Wood was tired and achy and could not think clearly, and she had no idea why.

title: Next Feat for Novak Djokovic? Perhaps a Grand Slam
description: PARIS  A day or so before the French Open began and the rain started to fall, Novak Djokovic shot a series of short, amusing commercials with Gustavo Kuerten, the genial, mop-topped, three-time French Open champion from Brazil.

title: Sanders Attacks Trump in California
description: In a final push before Californias presidential primary on Tuesday, Bernie Sanders criticized Donald J. Trumps comments about a federal judge, Gonzalo Curiel.

title: Telfar Partners With Asger Carlsen for the Berlin Biennale
description: The designers family models his 13 most popular T-shirt styles for a portfolio by the legendary photographer.

title: Nina Yashars Staged Living Space in London
description: The Nilufar gallerist takes T on a tour of Squat London, a pop-up exhibition filled with luxurious furnishings.

title: The Glass Menagerie Heads Back to Broadway, With Sally Field
description: Only four years after its last revival, The Glass Menagerie will return to Broadway, starring two-time Academy Award winner Sally Field as Amanda Wingfield.

title: A Traveling Design Shows Very Chic London Iteration
description: London was my dream place to host the show, says Nina Yashar, the grande dame of the Milanese design scene whose gallery, Nilufar, has decamped to London for the fifth iteration of its traveling exhibition Squat. Its the place for talent. So many of my designers are based here  Martino Gamper, Bethan Laura Wood, Michael Anastassiades. Its incredible. Its already popped up in Paris and been to Beirut, but now Nilufars eclectic offerings of historical and contemporary design objects inhabit the first floor apartment in a Victorian terra-cotta building above Erdems store in Mayfair. The sumptuous space, which couldnt be further from the threadbare realities that its title summons, has over the last five months been restored by the interior and architectural designer Shalini Misra. There are gems at every turn, and everything you see is for sale, from the floral configurations of Gio Ponti ceiling lights to the customized Dedar curtains and elegant Matisse sketch that hangs discreetly on the reception room wall  to even the property itself.

title: Courts 02 by Ward Roberts
description: This series took the photographer from New York to Hong Kong to Melbourne.

title: Painterly, and Imperfect, Pictures of Athletic Courts
description: Growing up, connecting with other people was difficult, says the Melbourne-born, Hong Kong-raised and now Brooklyn-based photographer Ward Roberts. Even today, finding the right words is a substantial struggle, he admits. But, playing sport in China or in Australia  or America, Europe, Indonesia  is something that most people understand.

title: An Irreverent New York Designer Heads to Berlin
description: The designer Telfar Clemens creates clothes that are difficult to define. In the 11 years that have passed since he presented his first collection, his designs have been interpretations of basic, gender-neutral garments  an aesthetic Clemens describes on his website as neither conceptual nor accessible  but both in extremis. Or, as the designer along with the brands creative director, Babak Radboy, have termed it: Extremely Normal.

title: Spotify Hires Troy Carter as a Liaison With Artists
description: As the music industrys streaming wars intensify, Spotify is turning to the former manager of Lady Gaga to help compete against players like Apple and Tidal.

title: Investigators Report on How a Prison Escape Happened
description: A year after two murderers escaped from Clinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, N.Y., the state inspector general's office released a report documenting a series of security failings that enabled the prison break.

title: Systemic Lapses Found in Escape of 2 Killers From Dannemora Prison
description: The two murderers who escaped from the Clinton Correctional Facility last year intentionally picked a Friday night when they knew an officer named Ronald Blair was on duty.

title: David Lamb, Author and War Correspondent in Vietnam, Dies at 76
description: David Lamb, a dauntless foreign correspondent for The Los Angeles Times who also wrote critically acclaimed books about the Arab world and Africa, died on Sunday in Alexandria, Va. He was 76.

title: Migrants Willing to Pay Price Not to Change Diet, Study Says
description: When migrants move, they often keep to the cuisine of their homeland even if it costs them more money and even if they have to eat significantly less, a new study has found.

title: European Union Seeks U.N. Approval to Intercept Libya-Bound Arms
description: UNITED NATIONS  A year after it received the United Nations Security Councils approval to try to stop human smuggling out of Libya, Europe is seeking the Councils authorization to intercept illegal arms going into Libya.

title: No Escape From Black Holes? Stephen Hawking Points to a Possible Exit
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  A black hole has no hair.

title: Escape From Falluja
description: Thousands of civilians have fled the Iraqi city of Falluja in the past two weeks, after government forces launched an offensive to retake the city from ISIS control.

title: For His Latest Trick, John Oliver Forgives $15 Million in Medical Debt
description: Would you rather spend 20 minutes reading about the hazards of predatory debt collection, or would you rather spend 20 minutes watching someone forgive millions of dollars in debt, complete with a giveaway that professed to put Oprah Winfreys famous You Get a Car! gimmick to shame?

title: Baltimore Judge, Not Jury, to Decide Freddie Gray Murder Case
description: BALTIMORE  The police officer charged with murder in the death of Freddie Gray chose on Monday to have a bench trial, eliminating a jury from his emotionally charged case and placing the verdict in the hands of the same judge who acquitted another officer two weeks ago.

title: Growing Up Coy Explores the Fallout After a Family Fought for Its Transgender Child
description: Before North Carolina passed its controversial bathroom law, before Caitlyn Jenner transitioned and before Transparent became a hit TV series, a little kid in rural Colorado was told she couldnt use the girls restroom at school anymore.

title: An Obama Nominees Crushed Hopes
description: In early 2014, after decades of government and nonprofit work that reflected a passion for public service, Cassandra Butts got a reward  or so she thought. She was nominated by President Obama to be the next United States ambassador to the Bahamas.

title: Review: In Ordinarily Well, Peter D. Kramer Goes to the Antidepressant Ramparts
description: A bit of advice before reading Peter D. Kramers timely book, Ordinarily Well: The Case for Antidepressants: Skip the preface. Theres too much Peter Kramer in it, and its off-putting. He casts himself as a reluctant and oversensitive hero, one who only waded back into the arena when he had no choice, forced to defend both himself and his most cherished principles.

title: David Carrs Memoir Is to Be Made Into AMC Mini-Series
description: AMC is developing a mini-series based on the memoir of the late New York Times columnist David Carr.

title: Indian Students Lured by Recruiters Asked to Leave University
description: An aggressive campaign to recruit graduate students from India to study at Western Kentucky University has ended badly, with more than one-third of the students asked to leave the program after their first semester, a university official said.

title: Review: At NY Phil Biennial, Interlochen Rises to the Occasion
description: One of the nobler aspects of the NY Phil Biennial, the New York Philharmonics festival of new music, is the involvement of young performers from educational institutions. On Sunday afternoon, high school students of the venerable Interlochen Arts Academy in Michigan, drawn from around the nation and abroad, took the stage of David Geffen Hall with the Young Americans program.

title: Kalashnikov, Maker of AK-47, Looks to Rebrand
description: MOSCOW  A shipment of Kalashnikov rifles, popularly known as AK-47s, was destined for the United States when it was stopped and quickly rerouted to Venezuela. Washington had just slapped Moscow with sanctions over the Ukraine crisis, and the Russian gun maker Kalashnikov Kontsern suddenly found one of its biggest markets off limits.

title: Rolex Names the Protgs in Its Arts Program
description: The Rolex Mentor and Protg Arts Initiative, a program that pairs major figures in seven disciplines with emerging artists, has announced those chosen for the 2016-17 cycle of the program, which began in 2002.

title: Confusion in a Romanian Village as 3 Vasile Cepois Run for Mayor
description: LONDON  The citizens of Draguseni, Romania, were presented with a predicament on Sunday when they had to decide who should lead their village of 2,500: the incumbent mayor, Vasile Cepoi, or one of four challengers  two of whom were also named Vasile Cepoi.

title: Let It Go Go Go! Three Stage Versions of Frozen Are on the Way
description: In 1957, Walt Disney laid out what was then an astonishing plan for an entertainment ecosystem: Animated movies would fuel theme park attractions, which in turn would power merchandise sales, which would create interest in more movies. Today, with Frozen, the plan has evolved further.

title: Democrats Jump on Allies of Donald Trump in Judge Dispute
description: Democratic leaders nationwide sought to exact a political price from Republican officials and candidates on Monday for continuing to support Donald J. Trump after his explosive remarks challenging the objectivity of judges with Mexican or Muslim backgrounds.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing: Hillary Clinton, Cleveland Cavaliers, Kanye West
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: National Amusements Alters Viacom Bylaws to Stymie Sale of Paramount
description: For Viacom, selling a stake in its Paramount film studio has become potentially more difficult  thanks to its controlling shareholder.

title: Political Impasse in Canada Puts Assisted Suicide in Legal Limbo
description: OTTAWA  A court-ordered deadline and a parliamentary showdown have combined to leave most of Canada without any law governing physician-assisted suicide as of Tuesday.

title: Turning Cemeteries Into Wine at a California Diocese
description: HAYWARD, Calif.  For an additional $1,000, a family can have a loved one buried near the chardonnay vines glistening in the sun, or if they prefer, near the pinot noir vines at a cemetery here in an East Bay suburb of San Francisco.

title: One Loss Into Copa Amrica, U.S. Men Know the Stakes Are High
description: CHICAGO  The United States mens national soccer team faces what its coach, Jurgen Klinsmann, flatly declared a must-win game against Costa Rica in the Copa Amrica Centenario on Tuesday night. But if the Americans are feeling the pressure, they are not showing it.

title: Strategist Now Backing Donald Trump Previously Called Him a Danger
description: A veteran Republican strategist now helping lead a super PAC in support of Donald J. Trump argued in a confidential memo last year that it would be dangerous to give Mr. Trump the power to launch a global war.

title: Chinatown Street Food vs. Moms
description: Dear Diary:

title: Regulators Fear $1 Billion Coal Cleanup Bill
description: Regulators are wrangling with bankrupt coal companies to set aside enough money to clean up Appalachias polluted rivers and mountains so that taxpayers are not stuck with the $1 billion bill.

title: The Work of David Gilkey, NPR Journalist Killed in Afghanistan
description: Mr. Gilkey, who was killed Sunday in Afghanistan along with his translator, Zabihullah Tamanna, was an award-winning photographer and videographer with wide experience around the globe. Here is a glimpse at his portfolio.

title: Mets Juan Lagares Has Torn Thumb Ligament but Stays on Active Roster
description: PITTSBURGH  The Mets had news on center fielder Juan Lagares on Monday. Whether it was good or bad was hard to tell.

title: Law Firm Salaries Jump for the First Time in Nearly a Decade
description: In a move sure to bring cheer to junior associates at major law firms, one of the industrys most elite, Cravath, Swaine & Moore, on Monday said it had increased the annual salary for its first-year lawyers to $180,000, from $160,000.

title: Havanna, a Confectioner, Has Argentinas First Local I.P.O. in 6 Years
description: BUENOS AIRES  Havanna, a confectioner from Argentina, raised $11.47 million on Monday in the first local initial public offering by the South American nation in nearly six years.

title: Graft Fighter in Egypt Finds Himself a Defendant in Court
description: CAIRO  Egypts anti-corruption czar thought he was just doing his job when he estimated how much endemic graft had cost his country: About $76 billion, he said, mostly in corrupt land deals. But the estimate, it turned out, was itself a criminal offense.

title: Who Decides Fair Value? In Dells Case, a Judge
description: Here come the lawyers.

title: Russian Sports Ministry Pledges Doping Reforms in Twitter Q. and A.
description: Russias sports ministry is embracing an uncharacteristic openness as it tries to project an atmosphere of reform to the global sports officials and the American authorities who are scrutinizing Russia over allegations of a government-run doping program.

title: Saudis Pressure U.N. to Remove Them From List of Childrens Rights Violators
description: UNITED NATIONS  For two years in a row, the exercise of naming and shaming armies that kill and maim children on the battlefield has been subject to intense political jockeying among the powerful at the United Nations.

title: Donald Trumps Contempt for the Rule of Law
description: Federal judges have repeatedly and emphatically refused to recuse themselves from cases because of their race or ethnicity. These rulings were driven by two realizations: Ethnically based challenges would reduce every judge to a racial category, which would be racist in itself. And such challenges would make judges vulnerable to recusal motions  for reasons of race, ethnicity, gender or religion  in every case that came before them.

title: Panama Papers Point to Tax Evasion
description: It was quite a revelation when leaked documents, made public in April, showed that Mossack Fonseca, a Panamanian law firm, had helped 14,000 clients worldwide create offshore accounts to conceal assets or dodge taxes. On Monday, a report by The Times found that there were at least 2,400 clients based in the United States over the past decade.

title: Hillary Clinton Has Clinched Democratic Nomination, Survey Reports
description: Hillary Clinton became the first woman to capture the presidential nomination of one of the countrys major political parties on Monday night, according to an Associated Press survey of Democratic superdelegates, securing enough of them to overcome a bruising challenge from Senator Bernie Sanders and turn to a brutal five-month campaign against Donald J. Trump.

title: A Biased Judge? Donald Trump Has Claimed It Before
description: The circumstances sound eerily familiar: Donald J. Trump and his legal team had suffered a setback in a major court case. So they leveled an attack on the presiding judge, calling him irredeemably biased and unfair.

title: Leaving Home
description: Hundreds of members of the Missionary Sisters of the Immaculate Heart of Mary have passed through the doors of the residence on East 15th Street in Manhattan since 1948. Now it is on the market.

title: Down to One Resident in 15,600 Square Feet, a Missionary Sisterhoods Home Is for Sale
description: The Missionary Sisters of the Immaculate Heart of Mary have served others across the world for more than a century. They have salved wounds in the slums of India, prayed with prisoners in Brazil, built schools in Cameroon and provided aid to a shaken Haiti.

title: Mid Pleasures and Palaces
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  When is a crossword puzzle not just a crossword puzzle?

title: Review: War, a Deathbed Drama About Identity by Branden Jacobs-Jenkins
description: Identity. Look hard  and then harder  at that word until it wavers, fragments and dissolves before your eyes, and you begin to wonder if it amounts to anything other than an assemblage of diversely shaped letters that might as well be runes. Its enough to give you a headache, isnt it?

title: Review: An Act of God Is Back, With Sean Hayes
description: I know its traditionally said that the Jews are Gods chosen people. But evidence to the contrary is currently on view on Broadway, where An Act of God opened (or rather reopened) on Monday at the Booth Theater.

title: National Briefing
description: A serial killer known as the Grim Sleeper should be sentenced to death in the murders of nine women and a teenage girl over more than two decades in South Los Angeles, a jury decided on Monday. Lonnie Franklin Jr., 63, was convicted of 10 counts of first-degree murder last month for crimes dating back more than 30 years. A defense lawyer had asked jurors to sentence him to life without parole to hasten the healing for members of the victims families. Sentencing was set for Aug. 10. Most of the victims were dumped in alleys and trash bins in the impoverished area where Mr. Franklin lived. He had been called the Grim Sleeper because of a perceived interval in the killings, between 1988 and 2002. The authorities now believe there were killings during that period. (AP)

title: Yankees Bats Heat Up in a Win Over the Angels
description: There has been a new tradition introduced at Yankee Stadium this season, in which the buildings lights flash like strobes after each Yankees home run.

title: Phyllis Curtin, American Soprano Who Championed New Music, Dies at 94
description: Phyllis Curtin, an American soprano celebrated as a champion of new music, died on Sunday at her home in Great Barrington, Mass. She was 94.
