description: From the Christopher Raeburn Collection.

title: 1916: Jellicoe Praises the Grand Fleet
description: LONDON  It is announced officially that Admiral Sir John Jellicoe has addressed the following message to the fleet:

title: A South African Golfer on the Way Up
description: Caught between hitting a driver or a 3-wood, Branden Grace opted for the safer play. Except that the 3-wood proved to be not so safe.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking seven days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: D.J. Doctor Dr Is Waging a Public Battle With Diabetes
description: Andre Brown has always been a tastemaker. Better known as Doctor Dr  the Long Island original, not the West Coast producer and gangster rapper  he has been sharing his musical tastes since the 1980s as a D.J. for the Beastie Boys, a member of the hip-hop group Original Concept and a co-host of Yo! MTV Raps. He and his co-host, Ed Lover, even beat Ice Cube to the barbershop movie genre when they starred in Whos the Man? in 1993.

title: Considering the Future of London Collections Men
description: LONDON  The designer Paul Smith was contemplating whether Britain would leave the European Union as he stood in the basement of his Albemarle Street store on Thursday night, the eve of the spring 2017 season of the London Collections Men shows.

title: What Happened Inside the Orlando Nightclub
description: Accounts of what happened from officials and witnesses.

title: Republican Candidates Have Guide in Rope-a-Dope
description: Republican candidates have a model to emulate as they struggle with growing concerns that Donald J. Trump could drag down their party in November: the late Muhammad Ali and his famous rope-a-dope.

title: Cable Industry Mobilizes Lobbying Army to Block F.C.C. Moves
description: WASHINGTON  In recent weeks, staff members for Bobby Rush, a Democratic congressman from Illinois, have asked fellow lawmakers to sign a letter opposing a Federal Communications Commission proposal to limit how broadband providers can share users personal data.

title: 1966: Purge in Peking Extends to Provinces
description: HONG KONG  Pekings current purge of allegedly unorthodox Communist elements is now sweeping beyond the Chinese capital to include important provincial officials. The area under the heaviest fire at present, according to reports received here, is Southwest China, where several party luminaries are being attacked for bourgeois and revisionist leanings.

title: Notes on Brexit
description: I guess its time to weigh in on an issue I have mostly been avoiding: Britains vote on whether to leave the EU, aka Brexit.

title: Heng on the U.S.s Relationship With India
description: The Indian prime minister, in an address to lawmakers in Washington, talked about the benefits of growing economic and military ties.

title: Dont Take A Hike
description: Im hearing some buzz that the Fed may still be considering a rate hike at its upcoming meeting, or if not then soon. Lets really, really hope this is wrong.

title: Stephanie Hill: Wings, Wigs, Silk Roses and a Little Heavy Artillery
description: In January, I moved from Washington to our facility near Baltimore, where we assemble military launch systems. My office is on the northeast corner of the fifth floor, with views overlooking Martin State Airport. Today, its a joint civil-military facility, but formerly it was the plant airport of the Glenn L. Martin Company, one of the heritage companies that make up Lockheed Martin. The Maryland Air National Guard is a tenant at the airport, and we occasionally see other flyover operations, including the United States Navys Blue Angels.

title: Owner of a Modigliani Portrait Is Adamant the Work Isnt Nazi Loot
description: PARIS  The art dealer and billionaire David Nahmad says he is well aware of the scornful whispers that trail him when he travels to Brazil, to New York. He says he feels the disapproving stares when he enters his synagogue at home in Monaco.

title: Timeline of Orlando Nightclub Attack
description: A gunman killed 49 people and wounded 53 more in an attack at the Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Fla., early Sunday.

title: N.B.A. Suspends Warriors Draymond Green for Flagrant Fouls
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The N.B.A. suspended the Golden State Warriors Draymond Green for Game 5 of the N.B.A. finals on Monday as a result of an accumulation of flagrant fouls over the course of the postseason.

title: Donald Trump Seizes on Orlando Shooting and Repeats Call for Temporary Ban on Muslim Migration
description: WASHINGTON  Donald J. Trump on Sunday sought to capitalize on the mass shooting at a gay club in Orlando, reiterating his controversial call for a temporary ban on Muslim migration to the United States and criticizing Hillary Clinton for what he claimed was her desire to dramatically increase admissions from the Middle East.

title: Mets Manager Terry Collins Hospitalized Before Sundays Game
description: MILWAUKEE  Mets Manager Terry Collins felt ill about an hour before Sundays game in Milwaukee and was taken to a nearby hospital for tests, the Mets assistant general manager John Ricco said. The bench coach Dick Scott, who last managed with Class A South Bend in 1997, took over for Collins.

title: Sibling: Spring 2017
description: Spring 2017 from Sibling

title: Tony Awards Hail Hamilton and Denounce Hate
description: Hamilton, an improbable hip-hop musical about Americas first Treasury secretary, completed its rapturous march across Americas awards landscape on Sunday, picking up Broadways highest honor: the Tony Award for best new musical.

title: After Nightclub Massacre, Obama Expresses Outrage and a Familiar Lament
description: WASHINGTON  The tableau at the White House was chillingly familiar: The somber president, nearing the end of his eight-year term, walked grim-faced to the podium to offer his condolences, promised action in the wake of suffering and pleaded for a new resolve that just might prevent more deaths in a hail of bullets.

title: Orlando Shooting: What We Know and Dont Know
description: A gunman who claimed allegiance to the Islamic State killed 49 people and wounded 53 more when he opened fire in a crowded gay nightclub in Orlando, Fla., early Sunday. It was the worst mass shooting in American history.

title: Conjuring 2 Beats This Years Curse of Summer Sequels
description: Hollywood had a mixed weekend at the box office. The Conjuring 2 was strong. Warcraft was soft. Now You See Me 2 was a shrug.

title: The Scope of the Orlando Carnage
description: These locations are never random. These targets arent accidental. Theyre the very vocabulary in which assailants like the Orlando gunman speak, and he chose a place where theres drinking. And dancing. And where L.G.B.T. people congregate, feeling a sense of welcome, of belonging.

title: Through Creative Ferment, a Power Plant Reborn
description: For its 10th iteration, Torontos Luminato Festival has located all of its ambitious programming in a single place: the disused Hearn Generating Station in the citys Port Lands area.

title: The Luminato Festival Turns a Former Power Plant Into a Creative Engine
description: TORONTO  In just three and a half weeks, workers here built one of the worlds largest cultural performance spaces inside an abandoned power plant. There are stages for theater, dance and music, as well as multiple art galleries and a high-end French restaurant.

title: Review: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater Debuts Two New Works
description: Robert Battle, the artistic director of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater since 2011, gives an excellent curtain speech. But when the company returned to the David H. Koch Theater on Thursday and Friday, he kept uncharacteristically quiet. What spoke instead was the repertory he has updated and upgraded.

title: Last Call at Pulse Nightclub, and Then Shots Rang Out
description: It was nearing last call.

title: Highlights and Analysis of the 2016 Tony Awards
Review: Father Was a Vicious Bully. Then He Became a Woman.
description: On July 7, 2004, Susan Faludi received an email with a one-word subject line: Changes. To describe it as an understatement would itself be an understatement. The note was from Ms. Faludis father, with whom she had barely spoken in 25 years. He was writing to say that he  now she  had just had sex reassignment surgery in Thailand. Steven Faludi had become Stefnie. He was 76.

title: Ukraine Shields Gay Rights Parade From Repeat of Violence
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Gay rights groups in Ukraine celebrated a milestone on Sunday  holding a parade without being chased or attacked by right-wing opponents. But the march, in Kiev, was guarded by police and security forces who sealed off much of the city center and warned participants not to linger afterward.

title: Review: Alien Ants Become Washington Insiders in BrainDead
description: Momentous elections turn on momentous questions. In 2016 the question is clear: What has gotten into peoples heads?

title: Review: A Dark, Haunting Work by Michael Hersch Gets a Premiere
description: Dantes Inferno might seem an unlikely inspiration for an artist trying to escape illness and loss. But the composer Michael Hersch saw hell as a point of departure when writing a breath upwards, which received its New York premiere at Saint Peters Church in Manhattan on Friday evening, presented by Lex54 Concerts.

title: New Chapter for Classic Paris Bookstore: Books Printed on Demand
description: PARIS  Gauthier Charrier, a graphic design student, stepped inside one of Pariss newest bookstores and wondered, Where are all the books?

title: Review: NY Phil Biennials Ambitious Wrap-Up, From Boulez to Bolcom
description: From the start, Alan Gilbert conceived the NY Phil Biennial as a citywide festival, not a New York Philharmonic showcase. Both New York and international ensembles would perform works by composers young and old in spaces small and large. This years ambitious biennial, the second, followed that template, opening May 23 with the JACK Quartet playing premieres in an intimate hall at the 92nd Street Y.

title: The National Tragedy in Orlando
description: To the Editor:

title: A Year After American Pharoahs Triumph, an Exciting Belmont Is a Letdown
description: It was hard during Saturdays Belmont Stakes not to think about American Pharoah, the colt who a year ago delivered a historic performance at the race in becoming just the 12th Triple Crown winner ever and horse racings first in 37 years.

title: Gun Deaths Today Surpass Those In Our Bloodiest War
description: When 50 people were shot and killed early Sunday morningat a gay nightclub in Orlando, the toll from gun murders this year rose to somewhere around 6,000 deaths, which means if the trend continues, this year may end up with the highest gun homicide count since Barack Obama took office in 2009. Add to the homicide number the 550 or so victims of police shootings, roughly the same number of accidental gun deaths and the 21,000+ Americans who use a gun to end their own lives, and the total gun mortality number this year may go above 35,000.

title: Orlando Gunman Used Assault Rifle With Military Roots, Police Say
description: A firearm that the authorities said was used on Sunday in a mass shooting at a nightclub in Orlando, Fla., is a descendant of one of the worlds most widely distributed and familiar infantry weapons, and a type of rifle that has been involved in previous mass shootings in the United States.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 13
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Horseplay
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Although I enjoyed myself immensely FOOLING AROUND with Lynn Lempels puzzle, one question kept bouncing off the insides of my skull: Who is DUNCAN PHYFE, and can someone be iconic if Ive never heard of him?

title: With Manager Terry Collins Ailing, Mets Fall to the Brewers
description: MILWAUKEE  Mets Manager Terry Collins appeared perfectly fine about two and a half hours before Sundays game at Miller Park. Speaking to reporters in his office, Collins reviewed his limited options off the bench: Second baseman Neil Walker (stiff back) and outfielder Michael Conforto (sore wrist) were not starting, and Collins hoped to give shortstop Asdrubal Cabrera his first complete day off this season.

title: Tigers Pitcher Michael Fulmer Drops Yankees Back Under .500
description: The rookie right-hander Michael Fulmer, a former Mets prospect who was sent to the Tigers system last season as part of a trade for Yoenis Cespedes, dominated the crosstown Yankees Sunday in Detroits 4-1 victory at Yankee Stadium.

title: Bernie Sanders Refuses to Concede Nomination to Hillary Clinton
description: Senator Bernie Sanders said on Sunday that he would take our campaign for transforming the Democratic Party into the convention, refusing to concede the presidential nomination to Hillary Clinton though not explicitly saying he would challenge her for it.

title: The Week Ahead: Apple to Woo Developers, and Fed to Hold Monthly Meeting
description: Heres a look at the week ahead:

title: A Victim Looks Back on a Crime With Hope, Not Fear
description: A detective called Tom Ligon last month with the news. There had been an arrest in his case, three years later.

title: Hedge Fund Managers Work to Stanch Loss of Investors
description: Hedge fund titans once ran their firms like elite private clubs, picking who made it past the velvet rope and how much they would pay for access to supercharged performance.

title: Sentencing Memo in Stanford Rape Case
description: A memo prepared by the district attorney's office in Santa Clara County, Calif., describing its sentencing recommendations in the case against Brock Turner, who had been convicted of sexual assault.

title: Brock Turner Sentencing Packet
description: The report from a probation officer in the case against Mr. Turner, the Stanford student who was convicted of three felonies in connection with a sexual assault in January 2015.

title: Court Papers Give Insight Into Stanford Sex Assault
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  Proud parents converged at Stanford Universitys commencement on Sunday to hear Ken Burns, the documentary filmmaker, welcome the elite class of graduates into the wider world.

title: The Colombian Hit Man Who Became a YouTube Star
description: Imagine if the former Mafia boss John Gotti, who went to prison for murder and cultivated the publics fascination with his flamboyant New York lifestyle and menacing charm, had a YouTube channel.

title: Tonys Red Carpet 2016
description: Broadways biggest stars arrived for the 2016 Tony Awards on Sunday night at the Beacon Theater. Here are the arrivals.

title: Photos: The Arrivals at the 2016 Tony Awards Red Carpet
description: Broadways biggest stars arrived for the 2016 Tony Awards on Sunday night at the Beacon Theater. The red carpet was gusty (A wind tunnel, as the Girls actor Andrew Rannells described it), but the mood was solemn in the wake of the mass shooting in Orlando, Fla. The most common accessory was a silver ribbon, worn in memory of the victims.

title: Canadian Neighborhood Rots in the Shadow of an Unborn Bridge to Detroit
description: WINDSOR, Ontario  It is a postapocalyptic streetscape that most Canadians associate with American cities like Detroit: boarded-up houses, burned-out roofs, a mess of scattered shingles, peeling paint and crumbling masonry. In some abandoned homes, the only residents are skunks, raccoons, rats and feral cats.

title: Anemic New York Legislature May Be More Active at End of Session
description: ALBANY  For skeptics of the chronically criticized members of the New York State Legislature, the 2016 legislative session has often seemed in danger of becoming what some Albany watchdogs used to call a Seinfeld session  all about nothing.

title: In the General Mills Cupboard
description: In honor of its 150th anniversary, the worlds sixth-largest food company allowed a peek at some of its artifacts, like the first clay animation models of Poppin Fresh, the Pillsbury Doughboy.

title: When the Lone Ranger and Gracie Allen Pitched Their Sponsors Products
description: MINNEAPOLIS  On a recent episode of his late-night show, Stephen Colbert poured himself a bowl of Lucky Charms cereal and then doused it in Baileys Irish Cream, jokingly referring to the concoction as an Irish continental breakfast.

title: North Dakotans Reconsider a Corporate Farming Ban, and Their Values
description: WING, N.D.  The Wagner family farmstead in central North Dakota could have been lifted from a Grant Wood painting: bales of hay rest on a gently sloping hill, cattle graze near a bright blue pond, green tendrils of durum and sunflowers peek out of the dirt.

title: A Computer Security Start-Up Turns the Tables on Hackers
description: Standing before a crowded room of entrepreneurs and investors at a conference in San Francisco last summer, former Vice President Al Gore described how climate change could be contained, possibly even reversed.

title: Tony Award Winners
description: [ Our complete coverage of the Tony Awards ]

title: Mrs. Sprats Ultimate Demise at Katzs Deli
Warriors Draymond Green Suspended for Game 5 After LeBron James Episode
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The Golden State Warriors were practicing Sunday when they learned that one of their most important pieces would be absent from Game 5 of the N.B.A. finals on Monday.

title: Gawkers General Counsel Takes On a Leadership Role
description: Heather Dietrick, Gawker Medias president and general counsel, has always been close to her 90-year-old grandfather, a prisoner of war during World War II who, she said, has taught me a lot about fielding a lot of situations.

title: Andrew Cuomos Anti-Free Speech Move on B.D.S.
description: IN 1985, Gov. Mario M. Cuomo proposed that New York State divest of its billions of dollars in investments in companies that did business with South Africa to demonstrate, he declared, the abhorrence of our residents to the pernicious system of apartheid. An opponent of Mr. Cuomos plan, the state comptroller, Edward V. Regan, told The New York Times, Were not in the foreign-policy business.

title: Bill Simmons Prepares to Stand Up to Sports Incorporated
description: LOS ANGELES  Corporate media giants always want whats cool and edgy until whats cool and edgy threatens the status quo that keeps the billions flooding in.

title: A London Subway Experiment: Please Dont Walk Up the Escalator
description: LONDON  Perhaps it is all the tourists  18.6 million international visitors to London last year, a record. Perhaps it is the gradual Europeanization of Britain. And perhaps it is just something to do with the blocked traffic on these ancient streets and all the diesel fumes in the air.

title: At Euro, Fights Keep the Focus Off the Field, a Day After an Alarming Melee
description: VILLENEUVE-DASCQ, France  An early flurry of memorable goals at the European Championships has been overshadowed by disturbing scenes of fan violence in multiple cities, leading the police to ask for greater resources, the tournaments organizers to open disciplinary proceedings and the French government on Sunday to ban alcohol sales near stadiums for the duration of the event.

title: A Game of Musical Chairs, Played With Schools, Divides the Upper West Side
description: It started as a fairly simple proposition: There were two schools on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, one overcrowded, the other underused. The citys Education Department proposed to redraw the schools attendance zone so that some blocks assigned to the crowded school would be shifted to the emptier one.

title: As Orlando Grieves, Enduring Questions About Guns and Terror Reverberate
description: Update, June 14 | Read Michael Luos Times article: Orlando Aftermath: Red Flags, Yet Legally Able to Buy a Gun, to get a feel for how individuals suspected of instability, allegiance to terrorists or threatening behavior can buy guns.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I saw bodies on the floor, people on the floor everywhere. It was a chaos, everybody trying to get out.

title: Tickets on Phones? Its a Big Hang-Up for Some Yankee Fans
description: When the Yankees announced that they were overhauling their ticketing system this season  introducing mobile ticketing and no longer accepting print-at-home tickets  they said it was to enhance the fan experience.

title: At Stonewall Inn, a Gay Rights Landmark, a Vigil in Pride and Anger
description: The red brick facade of the Stonewall Inn has served as the backdrop to countless passages in the history of the gay rights movement.

title: A Push to Improve Welfare of Horse Racings Involuntary Heroes
description: Last year at this time, the thoroughbred horse racing community and casual racing fans alike were riding the high of a milestone: American Pharoah had won the Belmont Stakes to become the first horse in 37 years to complete the Triple Crown.

title: Was Orlando Shooter Really Acting for ISIS? For ISIS, Its All the Same
description: PARIS  The revelation that the 29-year-old man who opened fire on Sunday in a gay nightclub had dedicated the killing to the Islamic State has prompted a now-familiar question: Was the killer truly acting under orders from the Islamic State, or just seeking publicity and the groups approval for a personal act of hate?

title: Blue Coat to Sell Itself to Symantec, Abandoning I.P.O. Plans
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Blue Coat Systems seemed poised to begin life as a public company, after selling itself to a private equity firm last year.

title: Orlando Attack Roils Gay Community, Painfully Accustomed to Violence
description: At 3 oclock in the morning on Sunday, Benjamin Newbern, a gay rights activist in northern Alabama, arrived home from a gay pride dance party he had organized, glanced at his cellphone and spotted an unsettling social media post: Prayers for our brothers and sisters at the Pulse nightclub in Orlando.

title: Omar Mateen: From Early Promise to F.B.I. Surveillance
description: FORT PIERCE, Fla.  Omar Mateens life seemed to be on a successful trajectory a decade before he carried out one of the worst cases of mass murder in American history.

title: Lin-Manuel Mirandas Sonnet From the Tony Awards
description: Whether Lin-Manuel Miranda is standing with President Obama in the Rose Garden or accepting a Grammy Award onstage, he is known to give his audience a freestyle rap fit for the occasion.

title: As Yankees Honor the Past on Old-Timers Day, Their Prospects Look Murky
description: One man in pinstripes hit a home run on Sunday at Yankee Stadium: Hideki Matsui, who belted a David Cone pitch into the second deck inside the right-field foul pole on Old-Timers Day. Matsui turned 42 on Sunday, still younger than Bartolo Colon and Ichiro Suzuki. But he is not coming back to save his old team.

title: In 6 Hours, 4 Are Killed in Separate Shootings in New York City
description: Four people were killed in separate shootings across New York City late Saturday and early Sunday, the police said.

title: Mexicos Soccer Coach Climbs Ladder of Success, a Rung at a Time
description: PASADENA, Calif.  The man who has guided Mexico to international soccers longest current unbeaten streak began his coaching career with a small club on Staten Island.

title: Why the Orlando Shooting Was So Deadly
description: The mass shooting at an Orlando nightclub early Sunday was the deadliest in United States history. One out of every three people at the crowded Pulse nightclub was killed or injured.

title: Silicon Valley Season 3, Episode 8: Erlichs Charade
description: Perhaps the quintessential shot of Erlich Bachman pops up near the end of Bachmans Earnings Over-Ride, in the moments after the self-styled tech visionary has finally hit bottom. As the Pied Piper team celebrates 100,000 installs in 10 days and smiting its nemeses at Hooli, Erlich sits alone on the back porch, smoking weed out of a formal glass pipe. Weve seen him inhale through many vessels, so the choice of bong is significant: This is Erlich at his most distinguished and professorial, looking one tweed jacket away from a tenured position at Sarah Lawrence. He is an absurd man who longs to be taken seriously.

title: Walgreens Cuts Ties to Blood-Testing Company Theranos
description: Walgreens said on Sunday that it was terminating its relationship with Theranos, dealing a severe blow to the embattled blood-testing company. Walgreens said it would immediately close all 40 of the Theranos testing centers in its Arizona drugstores, the source of most of Theranoss customers.

title: Penguins Finish Off Sharks to Win Stanley Cup
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  Much of Game 6 of the Stanley Cup finals was part hockey, part speedskating. When it was over on Sunday night, the Pittsburgh Penguins had their second title in eight years and their fourth in franchise history, defeating the San Jose Sharks, 3-1.

title: Veep Season 5, Episode 8: Into the Woods
description: This weeks Veep brings back an old friend, Finnish stateswoman Minna Hakkinen, who in only three episodes  sprinkled across three seasons  has become one of this shows All-Stars. Give credit to British actress/comedian Sally Phillips, with her clipped, deadpan line readings: so humorously humorless. But tip a cap too to the Veep writers, who get why Minna makes such a great foil to Selina Meyer. Shes everything our fictional president is not: rational, good-hearted and comfortable in her own skin. She represents a viable alternative for how a progressive 21st-century leader should be. If Minna Hakkinen existed in the real world, Michael Moore wouldve already made an admiring documentary about her.

title: The Colors of the Puerto Rican Pride Parade
description: The event in New York City had the feeling of a pep rally at times, trying to raise spirits as the the island faces economic struggles.

title: Puerto Rican Pride Shines in Parade Despite the Islands Woes
description: Puerto Rico may be in an economic tailspin, but the 59th annual Puerto Rican Day Parade was a moment to celebrate the islands joys.

title: A Day of Mourning for the Gay Community
description: In support of the victims of the massacre at a gay nightclub in Orlando, Fla., hundreds gathered outside the Stonewall Inn in New York, where a riot in 1969 helped launch the gay rights movement.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | truculence
description: truculence  \tr-ky-ln(t)s also tr-\  noun

title: Game of Thrones Season 6, Episode 8: Im Still Me
description: So it turns out everything with Arya was more or less what it appeared to be last week.

title: The Tonys: A Polished Night of Selling Broadway, With Nods to a Tragedy
description: Faced with broadcasting an all-singing, all-dancing, happy-faced celebration of art and commerce less than 24 hours after the deadliest mass shooting in American history, CBS did about what youd expect. The Tony Awards broadcast on Sunday night began with the host, James Corden, standing on the bare stage of the Beacon Theater, his back to the house, delivering a short and careful tribute to the victims of the massacre at a gay nightclub in Orlando, Fla.

title: 49 Lives Lost to Horror in Orlando: Mostly Young, Gay and Latino
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Louis Omar Ocasio-Capo was 20, worked at a Starbucks in a Target store, and lived to dance. Stanley Almodovar III, a 23-year-old pharmacy technician, had posted a Snapchat video of himself singing and laughing on his way to the Pulse nightclub on Saturday. Eric Ivan Ortiz-Rivera, 36, nicknamed Shaki, had been married to his husband for about a year, worked at a Party City and a Sunglass Hut, and was entranced by interior design.

title: Whats on TV Monday
description: Finally, an explanation for whats going on this politician season in BrainDead, a new sci-fi comedy from Robert and Michelle King of The Good Wife. And Sheridan Smith, the British actress, channels the 1960s pop singer Cilla Black.

title: No Corrections: June 13, 2016
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Social Media Reacts to Orlando Shooting
description: After the shooting at a gay nightclub in Orlando, Fla., people took to social media to share messages of grief, love and hope.

title: Ernie Elss Inner Voice Was Quieted When His Son Was Slow to Speak
description: OAKMONT, Pa.  The little evil voice plagued the Big Easy, as if mocking the nickname that had been bestowed upon Ernie Els because of his fluid swing. On bad days, the voice pounded his mind with negative thoughts. Even on Elss best days, like the Monday playoff in the 1994 United States Open at Oakmont Country Club, the voice cleared its throat on his backswings as he started with a bogey and a triple bogey and found only six fairways before winning on the 20th hole.

title: The Freedom to Be Danny Lyon
description: A late-career retrospective looks at some four decades of work by Danny Lyon, whose photographs  of the civil rights movement, prisons and a motorcycle gang  consider freedom, or its absence.

title: 13 Deadliest Shootings in America
description: The mass shooting in Orlando, Fla., was the worst in U.S. history. Every year, hundreds die in similar episodes. These are some of the deadliest.

title: Police in China Want Rights Lawyer Prosecuted on Subversion Charge
description: BEIJING  The Chinese police have recommended prosecution on a charge of subversion for Zhou Shifeng, a prominent lawyer whose arrest last year formed the focus of a campaign to discredit and dissolve networks of rights-focused defense lawyers who challenged the government, one of his former colleagues said on Monday.

title: The Freedom to Be Danny Lyon
description: Senator Bernie Sanders has had a heck of a year so far in 2016. Millennials clearly respond to him, taking as authentic the stylings of a rumpled, 70-something, radical, balding, Jewish, progressive, born-and-raised New Yorker who moved to the mountains (Vermont) years ago.

title: Found Poem Favorite | End and Beginning
description: We are honoring the top winners of our Seventh Annual Found Poem Student Contest by publishing their work from June 6 to 17. Youll be able to read the whole collection here as we go.

description: To the Editor:

title: Reusable Shopping Bags
description: To the Editor:

title: Issues Raised by the Lawsuits Against Gawker
description: To the Editor:

title: Down and Out and Voteless in Ohio
description: The attempts by Republican lawmakers to suppress the turnout of Democratic-leaning voters in the 2016 election have reached shameless levels in Ohio  a swing state where it turns out that even homeless citizens have been blocked from exercising their right to vote.

title: A Party Agrift
description: This is not a column about Donald Trump.

title: A Challenge to New Yorks Broken Parole Board
description: In 1975, John MacKenzie shot and killed a police officer named Matthew Giglio after a burglary in West Hempstead, N.Y. He was convicted and sentenced to the maximum term available under the law, 25 years to life.

title: Donald Trumps Mormon Problem
description: IN the fight to fend off Donald J. Trumps conquest of the Republican Party, there has been no fiercer faction this year than the Mormons.

title: The World Could End AIDS if It Tried
description: The world has made so much progress in reducing the spread of AIDS and treating people with H.I.V. that the epidemic has receded from the public spotlight. Yet by any measure the disease remains a major threat  1.1 million people died last year from AIDS-related causes, and 2.1 million people were infected with the virus. And while deaths are down over the last five years, the number of new infections has essentially reached a plateau.

title: Orlando Gunman Was Cool and Calm After Massacre, Police Say
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The gunman who went on a shooting rampage in a popular gay nightclub here shot nearly all of his victims in the first stages of the assault, then was utterly cool and calm while he talked by phone to law enforcement officials about further carnage, claimed allegiance to the Islamic State and praised the Boston Marathon bombers, officials said on Monday.

title: Teaching and Learning Resources | The Attack in Orlando
description: Below, we offer some ways to teach and learn about the deadliest mass shooting in U.S. history and the questions it raises.

title: Soccers Zlatan Ibrahimovic Heads Onto the Fashion Field
description: PARIS  Last week, the international soccer star Zlatan Ibrahimovic, captain of the Swedish national team, scheduled a news conference in Paris at precisely 5 p.m., three days before the start of the European Championship in France. Speculation began that the 34-year-old Swedish striker, who last month quit Paris St.-Germain of Ligue 1 after four seasons, was going to announce that he had signed with Manchester United in the English Premier League, a major score in professional soccer. But in Zlatan style, he zigged instead of zagged and faked them all out.

title: Which Labor Market Data Should You Believe?
description: When the unemployment rate falls below 5 percent, it usually means things are going pretty well. It was 4.7 percent in May, a level last seen in November 2007.

title: A Haven for New York Relics Saved From the Trash Heap. In Connecticut.
description: IVORYTON, Conn.  If New York had an attic, it could well be the sprawling complex of old brick buildings on Main Street in this sleepy village, a two-hour drive northeast of the city.

title: Sex Object: A Memoir and Shrill: Notes From a Loud Woman
description: This past April, editors at The Guardian published the results of a study that analyzed more than 70 million reader comments posted on the news site since 1999. Special attention was paid to the 1.4 million that had been blocked or deleted by moderators for violating community standards. Of the 10 authors who saw the most harassment  whose articles were most routinely met with hostile comments ranging from condescending to life-threatening  eight were women; the two men were black. The No. 1 recipient of such passionate expressions of free speech as I hope you perish in a gasoline-explosion-induced car crash was Jessica Valenti.

title: Being Transgender as a Fact of Nature
description: In 1952, George Jorgensen, a Bronx-born G.I., underwent surgical and hormonal treatment in Denmark to become Christine Jorgensen, a nightclub entertainer and advocate for gender identity rights. Ever since, health professionals and lay people alike have debated the origins of gender identity, the wisdom of altering ones biologically determined sex, and whether society should accept the transgender community as a fact of nature.

title: Orlando, Tony Awards, Pittsburgh Penguins: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

description: Updated, 9:30 a.m.

title: Zika Fears and Political Chaos Keeping Rio Olympics Affordable
description: The Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games, from Aug. 5 to 21, are the first to be held in South America, and they come with some baggage. Brazils chaotic and ever-changing political situation, concerns about the Zika virus, security issues: All of these are contributing to trepidation from North Americans, who are reconsidering whether to venture south for the Games.

title: Orlando Shooting Is Likely to Dominate Congressional Agenda
description: The mass killings in Orlando will overtake events in Washington and dominate Congress this week as lawmakers seek answers and possible responses in the wake of the United States deadliest shooting attack.

title: Should Pediatricians Refuse to Treat Patients Who Dont Vaccinate?
description: Parents who dont want to vaccinate their children are a perennial sore subject in my profession. The question bubbled up again this spring at the American Academy of Pediatrics Annual Leadership Forum, where academy leaders vote on issues of concern to pediatricians across the country.

title: Recording What Polar Bears Do
description: Scientists observe polar bears behavior in their natural environment by fitting them with collars that have cameras.

title: Video From a Polar Bears Point of View
description: Scientists would love to know how polar bears spend their time and how much their behavior is changing as a warming planet results in less sea ice during the summer.

title: Oscar Pistorius Is Unfit to Testify at Sentencing, Psychologist Says
description: LONDON  Oscar Pistorius, the double-amputee Olympic runner who shot his girlfriend to death in 2013, is unfit to testify at his sentencing for murder, a defense psychologist said as a hearing opened on Monday in a court in Pretoria, South Africa.

title: Morning Agenda: Hedge Fund Managers Try to Stanch Loss of Investors
description: HEDGE FUND MANAGERS TRY TO STANCH LOSS OF INVESTORS | Hedge fund titans may be used to running their firms like elite clubs, but years of poor performance have forced them to open up admission,Alexandra Stevenson reports in DealBook.

title: Sitora Yusufiy, Ex-Wife of Orlando Suspect, Describes Abusive Marriage
description: BOULDER, Colo.  Sitora Yusufiy thought she was done with her ex-husband, Omar Mateen.

title: Orlando and Trumps America
description: Omar Mateen, the Florida shooter who had pledged allegiance to the Islamic State, just ushered Donald Trump to the White House, Britain out of the European Union, Marine Le Pen to the French presidency, and the world into a downward spiral of escalating violence.

title: What Dead Pigs Cant Teach Us About C.S.I.
description: Forensic scientists have long used dead pigs and other animals as stand-ins for humans to better understand how the body decomposes after death.

title: Art Market Forecast: A Hazy Summer
description: LONDON  The art world traditionally descends on Europe in June, first for Art Basel, widely regarded as the essential fair for collectors, then on to London for the summer auctions.

title: Orlando Shooting Becomes Immediate Talking Point
description: Join us for live updates and analysis.

title: The Downside of Merging Doctors and Hospitals
description: Considering how much we already pay for health care, you have to wonder why doctors, hospitals and insurance providers so often fail to coordinate their patients care.

title: Could a College Degree in Comedy Be Anything Other Than a Joke?
description: Theres a maxim about comedy typically attributed to Lucille Ball, although its one whose essence you hear echoed by almost any professional comedian: People either have comedy or they dont, the saying goes. You cant teach it to them.

title: Not Forgotten: Tough Questions for Both Sides From Tim Russert
description: In the nearly 17 years as the host of Meet the Press, Tim Russert grilled lawmakers from across the political spectrum.

title: Maison Mihara Yasuhiro: Spring 2017
description: Maison Mihara Yasuhiros spring collection.

title: Qatar Convicts Dutch Woman Who Reported Rape but Will Let Her Return Home
description: A 22-year-old Dutch woman detained for three months in Qatar on suspicion of adultery after she reported being drugged and raped was given a one-year suspended sentence on Monday and will be allowed to return home, the Dutch Foreign Ministry said.

title: The Tony Awards Make a Fashion Statement
description: Everything Im wearing tonight, shes chosen  so said James Corden, host of the 2016 Tony Awards, in a burgundy Burberry tuxedo on the red carpet. It was the first of four outfits, including a green crystal-encrusted Dolce & Gabbana number, that the comedian would model throughout the night.

title: Suspect in Shanghai Airport Blast Was Mired in Gambling Debts, Police Say
description: A man accused of setting off primitive explosives at Pudong International Airport in Shanghai, injuring four bystanders, was dogged by gambling debts and had threatened to do something totally crazy before he detonated a bomb made from firecrackers, police investigators said on Monday.

title: Microsoft Buys LinkedIn for $26.2 Billion, Reasserting Its Muscle
description: SEATTLE  Microsoft has made its most ambitious move in years to reassert itself in a technology market it once dominated.

title: Oregon Court Allows a Person to Choose Neither Sex
description: A judge in Oregon has granted a petition allowing a person to legally choose neither sex and be classified as nonbinary: an important development for transgender Americans while civil rights and sexual identity are in the national spotlight, advocates and legal experts said.

title: Video Captures Gunshots at Orlando Nightclub
description: Video shared on social media shows what appear to be the initial shots fired on Sunday at the Orlando nightclub Pulse where 50 people died.

title: Retired Officer Fatally Shoots Man During Robbery Attempt at Queens Bar
description: A man who investigators believe was trying to rob a bar in Queens was fatally shot on Monday by a retired New York City officer who was there, the police said.

title: Trophy Hunting Fees Do Little to Help Threatened Species, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  Advocates of trophy hunting, and even the United States government, have long justified the killing of protected wildlife in Africa by saying that taxes and fees from the hunts help pay for larger conservation efforts.

title: Haze Returns to Mexico City, Where Not Driving Is Hardly an Option
description: MEXICO CITY  Back in the late 1980s, the air got so dirty in Mexico City that birds would emit a final chirp before they tumbled from the trees onto the sidewalk, their small, still bodies a sad testament to some of the worlds worst air pollution.

title: Coach: Spring 2017
description: Coach Spring Collection.

title: Before Orlando, There Was New Orleans
description: SUNDAYs mass murder in Orlando, Fla., was, among other grim superlatives, the worst instance of anti-gay violence in American history. But it was also far from the first. In fact, mass violence and the history of gay liberation go hand in hand.

title: Lincoln Center Report: We Entertain, Educate, Accept Tax Dollars
description: Lincoln Centers organizations spent $785.4 million last season, in large part on the salaries of their 4,547 employees. Their offerings attracted 4.5 million people, a third of whom attended free events. And those ticket buyers from outside the city who said in surveys that visiting Lincoln Center was a very important reason for their trips spent an estimated $669 million elsewhere in New York.

title: Peru Gets Away With a Hand Ball and Eliminates Brazil
description: It is the first thing you learn in peewee soccer: Dont touch the ball with your hand.

title: 1941: France Relegates Jews in Decree
description: VICHY  The status of Jews in France and in French overseas possessions is to be definitely regulated by a decree to take effect immediately. It replaces the provisional law defining the position of Jews in France issued on Oct. 3, 1940, and involves a wide extension of the occupations and callings which Jews are forbidden to pursue. In addition to the fields of journalism, cinema, radio and teaching, the new law prohibits Jews from engaging in banking or brokerage business or any publicity or advertising agents. New York Herald Tribune, June 14, 1941

title: Afghanistan and Pakistan Exchange Heavy Gunfire Along Border
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  Pakistani and Afghan forces exchanged heavy gunfire on Sunday and Monday in an unusually serious escalation of tensions at the border, leaving at least 13 people wounded on the Pakistani side and killing at least one Afghan police officer, according to the police and military officials in both countries.

title: Keeping an iPhone Online When the Signal Is Weak
description: Q. Can you tell me how Wi-Fi Assist works and does it use my iPhone data?

title: The Corrupt Zigzag, an Argentine Dance
description: BUENOS AIRES  Argentina is changing political direction again, in a century-old zigzag from left to right and back. Traumatic though this obsessive ritual is, what is most amazing is that the language almost never changes: The powers that be are corrupt. Throw them out.

title: Study Calls Snub of Obamas Supreme Court Pick Unprecedented
description: WASHINGTON  How unusual is the Republican blockade of the nomination of Judge Merrick B. Garland, President Obamas pick for the Supreme Court? After a comprehensive look at every past Supreme Court vacancy, two law professors have concluded that it is an unprecedented development.

title: How Zika Became a Global Threat
description: Though the Zika virus was firstidentified in 1947,little is known about it today. Few researchers have studied the virus because, until the recent outbreak in Latin America, it was not thought to cause serious illness or birth defects. One of the leading scientific experts on Zika isScott C. Weaver, the director of the Institute for Human Infections and Immunity at the University of Texas Medical Branch in Galveston. In a recent interview, he helped explain how Zika came out of Africa, crossed the Pacific Ocean, came to Brazil and became a dangerous public health threat.

title: Handful of Advisers Behind Microsofts Deal for LinkedIn
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Microsofts $26.2 billion acquisition of LinkedIn is one of the biggest and most prominent technology deals of the year so far.

title: Bill Murray to Receive the Mark Twain Prize for Humor
description: Its not easy to forecast where Bill Murray might turn up next: maybe a new Wes Anderson movie, a Netflix Christmas special, a karaoke bar or a kickball game. But it can be more safely said that this unpredictable comic actor will appear at the Kennedy Center in Washington on Oct. 23, when he is presented with its annual Mark Twain Prize for American Humor.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Puerto Rico Law in Debt Restructuring Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday rejected an effort in Puerto Rico to allow public utilities there to restructure $20 billion in debt, striking down a 2014 Puerto Rico law.

title: Just Bake
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking seven days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Frances Largest Labor Union May Have Overplayed Its Hand
description: PARIS  There is a back story to the strikes that have made life miserable for millions across France in recent weeks, and it isnt about high unemployment, immigration or the other issues confronting the country and its increasingly unpopular president, Franois Hollande.

title: Chinas Call to Young Men: Your Nation Needs Your Sperm
description: If youre a man in China between 20 and 45, the government has a message for you: For the sake of your country, please donate sperm.

title: Jewel-Like Ptes de Fruits From Locally Grown Berries
description: This collection of intense fruit squares, a confection the French call ptes de fruits, is from Casey Hickey, a candymaker and chocolatier based in Charlotte, N.C., who studied in Paris. What makes them shine is the fruit she uses, mostly locally grown berries, along with passion fruit, kalamansi and sour cherries. They come in a clear box, lined up in a vibrant gradation of color: Twenty Degrees Chocolates ptes de fruits, $20 for 12 pieces from mouth.com.

title: Blaming Muslims After Attack, Donald Trump Tosses Pluralism Aside
description: Donald J. Trump left little doubt on Monday that he intends to run on the same proposals on immigration and terrorism that animated his primary campaign, using his first speech after the massacre in Orlando, Fla., to propose sweeping measures against Muslims that pay little heed to American traditions of pluralism.

title: Fortnum & Mason Ventures Across the Ocean
description: Founded in 1707 by Hugh Mason, a grocer, and William Fortnum, a royal footman, the English purveyor Fortnum & Mason is famous for its teas, preserves and cookies. For the first time since 1929, some of its products are being sold in America in an exclusive arrangement with Williams-Sonoma. Among the teas are classics like English Breakfast and newer ones like a delicate green Earl Grey. Jams include raspberry, strawberry and grapefruit, and the standouts in the category of biscuits, which we call cookies, are chocolate-macadamia nut, chocolate-dipped, and pistachio with clotted cream. The companys lavish gift assortments in wicker hampers are also available, and in late fall, there will be Christmas puddings: Fortnum & Mason, Williams-Sonoma stores, williams-sonoma.com.

title: Which Headlines Attract Most Readers?
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights from The New York Times. In this piece, Mark Bulik, a senior editor, writes about recent tests designed to see what kind of headlines attract most readers.

title: 1916: Rush to Name the President
description: NEW YORK  Delegates to the Democratic National Convention which assembles tomorrow [June 14] in St. Louis are pouring into that city today, and, despite the fact that the gathering will simply resolve itself into a Wilson ratification meeting, the indications are that it will be one of the greatest gatherings in the history of the Democratic party. Governor Fielder, of New Jersey, which is President Wilsons home state, arrived in St. Louis this evening, and he voiced the feelings of Democratic national leaders when he said that President Wilson will be renominated and re-elected because he has fully measured up to the requirements of his great office.The New York Herald, European Edition, June 14, 1916

title: The Watermelon as Centerpiece
description: A hefty wedge of watermelon can glow on a summertime table or a picnic at the beach. The candle, from an Australian company that specializes in warm-weather accessories, has a mild watermelon scent, which I didnt mind: Watermelon Candle, $32, Annies Blue Ribbon General Store, 232 Fifth Avenue (President Street), Park Slope, Brooklyn, 718-522-9848, blueribbongeneralstore.com.

title: A Brief History of Attacks at Gay and Lesbian Bars
description: The lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community is no stranger to  violence.

title: 3 New Heirloom Breads From La Brea Bakery
description: La Brea Bakery has started using heirloom wheat called fortuna in three new breads it has brought together as La Brea Bakery Reserve. The breads are struan, made with some emmer and spelt and dusted with sesame seeds; pain de campagne, with a crisp crust and great complexity from rye; and fortuna, somewhat denser and riddled with cracked wheat berries. Dean Folkvord, head of Wheat Montana, the grower near Big Sky, said the grain is cultivated on a high plateau from tall stalks, making it more difficult to harvest: La Brea Bakery Reserve, $8 to $10, amazonfresh.com.

title: The Dual Roles of Money
description: Money is an interesting actor that plays two roles in our lives.

title: Travel Problems
description: This weeks challenges were suggested by Laura Feiveson,an M.I.T.-trained economist at the Federal Reserve and regular Numberplay contributor. Lauras an expert at bringing out unexpected twists in classic puzzles, and Im looking forward to seeing what emerges this week.Lets join Laura with

title: Nakiri, a Japanese Knife Designed for Vegetables
description: I treasure my Japanese nakiri knife. The blade is rectangular, making it like a cross between a chefs knife and a light cleaver, and thinner than a standard chefs knife, all the better for juliennes. And it efficiently scoops up whatever you have cut. The knife is designed for vegetables, and in summer, with fresh zucchini, cucumbers, tomatoes, peppers and herbs, its a must-have for slicing, peeling and chopping. Wsthof, the German knifemaker, has introduced hollow-edge nakiris in two sizes: 5-inch with the standard classic handle, and 7-inch in three styles: classic, gourmet and a curved-handle version called classic ikon (shown): Wsthof nakiri knives, $79.95 to $159.95, cutleryandmore.com.

title: Obama Says Orlando Gunman Was Probably a Homegrown Extremist
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said Monday that while the gunman in the Orlando massacre had declared allegiance to the Islamic State and appeared to have been inspired by extremist information on the internet, there was no clear evidence that he had been part of a wider plot directed by the terrorist group.

title: Microsoft and Apple Making Headlines
description: The technology industry is kicking off this weeks news with a flurry of action.

title: Lebanese Designer Brings Traditional Materials Into Modern Age
description: PARIS  The designer Karen Chekerdjian is known in her native Lebanon for modernist objects made with traditional materials and techniques. Now, two exhibitions in Paris  at the Institut du Monde Arabe and at the private Dutko Gallery  offer a close look at an artist who addresses the divide between art and function, and the wider gap between Western and Arab cultures.

title: Black Pasta, but Not From Squid Ink
description: Pasta colored black with cuttlefish ink is handsome and delicious, but perhaps not for everyone. Now a company that specializes in legume and rice-based products has introduced black bean pasta that tastes mild, looks stunning and is gluten free. Use it for your next cacio e pepe. They call it spaghetti, though it is more angel hair: Explore Cuisine Organic Black Bean Spaghetti, $30 for six 8-ounce packages, explorecuisine.com.

title: Britains Brexit Debate Inflamed by Worries That Turkey Will Join E.U.
description: LONDON  With nine days left before Britain votes on whether to remain in the European Union, the possibility of Turkeys becoming a member of the bloc has inflamed the debate, injecting divisive issues of race, religion and tolerance openly into the campaign.

title: Is Stephen Curry Changing Basketball, or Just Owning It?
description: At the outset of the N.B.A. finals, Adam Silver, the leagues commissioner, paid tribute to Stephen Curry by comparing him to, of all people, Roger Bannister.

title: Apple Developer Conference: A More Open Siri, and Other Upgrades
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When Steven P. Jobs ran Apple, the companys devices were distinguished by their polished software and famous iTunes store. Today, critics and even loyal fans are taking shots at Apples buggy software and Apple Music, its new streaming music service.

title: Comparing Gun Deaths by Country: The U.S. Is in a Different World
description: Gun homicides are a common cause of death in the United States, killing about as many people as car crashes (not counting van, truck, motorcycle or bus accidents).

title: Highlights from the 2016 Tony Awards
description: The musical Hamilton fell one Tony shy of breaking the record number of awards in a show that opened with a message of condolence and hope over the massacre in Orlando, Fla.

title: Talking About the Orlando Gunman
description: Early on June 12, Omar Mateen entered the nightclub Pulse and opened fire, killing 49 and wounding dozens. Family members and others who knew Mr. Mateen are opening up about him.

title: Start-Ups Selling Seats on Private Jets Dont Always Make It
description: Dannel Schwartz was agonizing over his wifes 60th birthday gift when she proposed an idea herself.

title: Tonys Draw Almost 9 Million Viewers to CBS
description: The Tony Awards ceremony had its highest ratings in 15 years on Sunday night, with nearly nine million viewers tuning in to CBS.

title: Donald Trump and Hillary Clintons Speeches: What You Missed
description: Donald J. Trump addressed the massacre in Orlando, Fla., on Monday, one day after the deadliest mass shooting in American history, as part of a broader national security speech in Manchester, N.H., where he  also contrasted himself with Hillary Clinton.

title: Search Is On for King Henry I, Who May Be Buried Under a Parking Lot
description: LONDON  Looking for a dead medieval king? You might want to check under a parking lot.

title: Drake and Beyonc Get New Company on the Chart: Paul Simon
description: Drakes Views is No. 1 for a sixth straight week on the Billboard album chart, as the album continues to post huge streaming numbers even as its CD and download sales plunge.

title: Readers Reactions
description: Zoos

title: Clark Art Institute Announces New Leader, From Dallas Museum
description: The Sterling and Francine Clark Art Institute in the Berkshires has chosen Olivier Meslay, a longtime curator at the Dallas Museum of Art and before that at the Louvre, as its new director, to succeed Michael Conforti, who led the institution for more than 20 years.

title: A Face-Reading Fish
description: The archerfish, two to three inches long, hunts for food by shooting down insects with jets of water. But its real claim to a place in the bizarre behavior hall of fame: The fish can apparently distinguish one human face from another.

title: At the Tonys, Moments to Remember
description: In a Tony Awards night shadowed by the tragedy in Orlando, Fla., prizewinners and other performers worked hard to strike a balance between joy and reflection. Here are some moments to remember:

title: What You Should Watch: BrainDead, Orange Is the New Black and Mr. Robot
description: Welcome to Watching, The New York Timess what-to-watch guide. We comb through releases big and small, famous and esoteric, to email readers twice a week with our timely recommendations. Our most recent suggestions also appear below. To receive our guide straight to your inbox, sign up here.

title: Mens Fashion Shows: J.W. Anderson, Wales Bonner, Pieter
description: A photo diary of the spring/summer 2017 collections, which were presented during London Collections Men on Sunday.

title: Libyan Fund Claims Goldman Sachs Exploited Its Financial Navet
description: LONDON  After years of international isolation under the rule of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, Libya sought to emulate its Middle Eastern neighbors by creating a sovereign wealth fund in 2006 to invest the proceeds from its sale of oil.

title: Monumental Piece of the Old, Old City of Petra
description: Archaeologists have been combing the ancient city of Petra in southern Jordan for at least two centuries. Now, with drones and satellite imagery, they have discovered  new features, including a monumental platform of nearly 30,000 square feet, or roughly half a football field.

title: Samuel K. Wasser, a Scientific Detective Tailing Poachers
description: Samuel K. Wasser, 62, a zoologist at the University of Washington, is a Sherlock Holmes of the wildlife trade. With modern biochemical tools and old-fashioned shoe leather, he sleuths out the merchants behind the market for poached animal products.

title: Finra Names Robert Cook Its Chief Executive
description: The brokerage industrys overseer, the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, on Monday named a former markets regulator, Robert W. Cook, as its president and chief executive officer.

title: In the Studio with Kiko Kostadinov
description: The 26-year-old mens wear designer brings T into his workspace in Tottenham in advance of his London Collections Men debut.

title: Swan Lake, and Its 32 Fouetts
description: Swan Lake rejoined American Ballet Theaters repertory this week  and, with it, the most notorious step in the ballet repertory: the 32 fouett turns! Odile, the dangerous but seductive antiheroine, returns to the stage near the climax of her grand pas de deux with the hero, Prince Siegfried, and revolves on one leg 32 times. Her raised leg, never touching the ground, provides most of the propulsion. After the first 16 bars, the music changes character; she carries on regardless.

title: Person to Know: The Mens Wear Phenom Straight Out of School
description: Its not every day that you get a spot on the London Collections Men schedule straight out of school. Then again, Kiko Kostadinov is far from an average Central Saint Martins student. Though he graduated from the M.A. Fashion course only last month, the 26-year-old mens wear designer already has a collaboration with Stssy under his belt, a NEWGEN Men sponsorship  and a yearlong deal to be exclusively stocked at Dover Street Market.

title: The Muslim Silence on Gay Rights
description: An Afghan-American Muslim walks into a gay club in Florida on Latin night during Pride Month. In my dreams, that is the beginning of another great story of remix, tolerance and coexistence that is possible only in America. In reality, its the start of a nightmare massacre fueled by hatred and perpetrated by a man from a group already scarred by a generation of suspicion and surveillance.

title: Insects Dont Need Noses to Sense a Stench
description: Q. How do insects sense and process odors?

title: Modern Love: The Podcast | Jason Alexander Reads Just One Last Swirl Around the Bowl
description: In this weeks episode, an encore of the second Modern Love podcast, the actor and comedian Jason Alexander (Seinfeld, Pretty Woman) reads Just One Last Swirl Around the Bowl by Dan Barry.

title: In Photos: The Tony Awards After-Parties
description: The winners and losers (and the host) kept the night going at various after-parties.

title: When Lawyers Testify Against a Client
description: There may be no more fertile ground for obtaining damaging information in an investigation than from a lawyer about a client. People tend to be more open with their lawyers, or perhaps worse, try to lie to them to use legal advice to keep from getting caught.

title: Microsofts Deal for LinkedIn Raises Red Flags
description: Satya Nadella, the Microsoft chief executive, may have abandoned his prudent approach.

title: Governor Cuomo and the B.D.S. Movement
description: To the Editor:

title: Oprah Winfrey, Lin-Manuel Miranda and Other Tony Winners Party All Night
description: A year after Anna Wintour staged a fashion intervention on Broadway, a decidedly more glamorous crowd headed Sunday night from the Tony Awards to the various after-parties.

title: Orlando Shooting Reignites Gun Control Debate in Congress
description: WASHINGTON  The Orlando, Fla., massacre reignited on Monday the debate over whether Americans like Omar Mateen who have appeared on the governments terrorist watch lists, or who were otherwise suspected by the authorities of ties to terrorist groups, should be allowed to buy a gun. In Congress, even some supporters of gun rights seemed to be having second thoughts.

title: Modern Love: The Podcast | Lauren Molina Reads A Craigslist Missed Connection Lure
description: Welcome to the first episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, a new weekly series weve been working on with WBUR, Bostons NPR News station. In this weeks episode, Broadway actress and musician Lauren Molina reads A Craigslist Missed Connection Lure by Rosemary Counter.

title: When Poverty and Homelessness Are Criminalized
description: To the Editor:

title: Orlando Gunman Was on Terror Watchlist, F.B.I. Director Says
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. director said on Monday that the gunman in the mass killing in Orlando was on a terrorist watchlist from 2013 to 2014, but that months of intense investigation into his foreign travels, his inflammatory language with co-workers and his possible motivations did not produce enough evidence to arrest him.

title: Soccer Player Ratings: The First Thing Anyone Talks About
description: PARIS  If 11 is soccers dominant number  as in, which 11 players should be on the field?  then 10 is its perpetual pursuit. For after every match at the European Championships, or the Champions League, or the Copa Amrica, as well as a vast majority of league matches played around the world, the most pressing question for fans and participants alike is this:

title: The Secret to Zadies Poached Oysters? Seaweed
description: Marco Canora, the chef at Hearth in the East Village, has been interested for years in the oyster rooms and cellars that used to dominate New York in the 1890s and early 1900s.

title: Reeling After the Orlando Massacre
description: To the Editor:

title: Its Sacred: A Gay Refuge, Turned Into a War Zone
description: I remember my therapists advice when I was a 22-year-old, not yet out-of-the-closet gay man living in Washington  uncertain, unhappy, unready.

title: Brexit Vote Has European Workers in Britain Unsure of Future
description: LONDON  Filipe Graca hovered over an espresso machine at the British food chain Pret A Manger and frothed out a cafe latte for a waiting customer. Until last year, he had struggled to find any kind of a job in his native Portugal. But when he arrived in London, he was able to work almost right away.

title: In the Kitchen with Chef Corey Lee at In Situ
description: SFMoMAs new restaurant opens this week, offering recreations of some of the worlds best dishes.

title: Hamilton Enjoys Best Week Ever at the Broadway Box Office
description: It turns out that winning 11 Tony Awards wasnt the only milestone for Hamilton on Sunday.

title: Review: In Animal Kingdom, a Crime Family That Surfs and Steals
description: When youre basing 10 episodes or more of television on a stand-alone two-hour movie, it might be best to heed the lesson of Fargo: Throw out the whole story and start over.

title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic Wills Sweden Forward Once More
description: ST.-DENIS, France  There was the time Zlatan Ibrahimovic suggested that his own dominance sent an entire country (Denmark) into retirement. There was the time he denied rumors he had purchased a Porsche by saying he actually bought a plane because it was much faster. There was the time he described an opposing team (Chelsea) as 11 babies.

title: Review: Uncle Buck Stars Mike Epps in One More Reboot of the Errant Nanny
description: Even in a year of derivative network-TV ideas  series based on MacGyver, Lethal Weapon and The Exorcist are coming this fall, for starters  ABCs Uncle Buck outdoes itself in doing to death whats been done and redone.

title: Review: Wrecked, on TBS, Finds Comedy in a Desperate Situation
description: If you have long complained that Gilligans Island needed a lot more crotch humor, your voice has finally been heard. Wrecked, the latest effort by TBS to secure a lowbrow-humor beachhead, gives us castaways stranded after a plane crash. These thematic grandchildren of the Gilligan misfits are noticeably raunchier than their forebears. Or, if you prefer, these thematic children of the Lost crowd are noticeably less earnest than John Locke and company.

title: Some of the Worlds Best Dishes  All on One Menu
description: Earlier this month, chef Corey Lee strolled through the ground floor of the newly reopened SFMOMA, past one of Richard Serras swirling, imposing sculptures, and said: Whether we like it or not, food has started to occupy a new role as art. Its a statement that underlies every aspect of Lees new restaurant in the museum, where he will serve not only as chef, but also curator: When it opens tomorrow, In Situ will be a first-of-its kind gallery where diners can order faithfully replicated dishes from restaurants the world over, past and present.

title: Orlando Aftermath: Red Flags, Yet Legally Able to Buy a Gun
description: The gunman in a shooting rampage at a Florida nightclub, identified as Omar Mateen, would seem, in retrospect, to have been the kind of person who should not have been able to buy a gun.

title: Dizzy and Disoriented, With No Cure in Sight
description: It started in 2010 when I smoked pot for the first time since college. It was cheap, gristly weed Id had in my freezer for nearly six years, but four hours after taking one hit I was still so dizzy I couldnt stand up without holding on to the furniture. The next day I was still dizzy, and the next, and the next, but it tapered off gradually until about a month later I was mostly fine.

title: A Nigerian Designer, Inspired by Home
description: For the 26-year-old Nigerian designer Adebayo Oke-Lawal, whose brand Orange Culture held a presentation in a showroom at London Collections Men this weekend, fashion is a very personal business. Were trying to communicate the idea of a new generation of African men, he told T of the intentions behind his gender-fluid mens wear line. As a child growing up, I found I was very lost in trying to figure out who I was as a person. I wanted to create a brand that sort of represented that sphere of men: a man thats vulnerable, a man thats a bit soft, a man thats emotional.

title: Border Clashes Between Ethiopia and Eritrea Heighten Fears of War
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  The Eritrean Embassy in Kenya sent a text message alert Monday morning: The Ethiopians had attacked. Fighting on the border. Situation unfolding.

title: Review: Young Lovers Imprisoned by Technology in The Cell
description: As small, scrappy opera enterprises increasingly pervade the streets of New York, one may soon show up almost on your doorstep. For me, that happened over the weekend, with the roaming Opera Upper Wests production The Cell at the LuLu Lounge in the basement of Cafe Tallulah on, yes, the Upper West Side.

title: Manager Terry Collins Cleared to Return to Mets
description: Mets Manager Terry Collins, who missed his teams game Sunday after feeling ill that morning in Milwaukee, will be back in the dugout Tuesday.

title: Globally, Orlando Attack Strikes Now-Familiar Fault Lines
description: ROME  By Monday morning, the grim, if now familiar, global ritual had begun. Leaders across Europe, Asia and elsewhere sent messages of sympathy and outrage. Editorialists opined against extremism and violence. Symbolic gestures  another special lighting of the Eiffel Tower  were announced. Solidarity hashtags circled the virtual globe.

title: UnREAL Season 2, Episode 2: Everybodys Manipulating Everybody
description: Quinn giveth and Quinn taketh away.

title: Weasels Are Built for the Hunt
description: At birth, the least weasel is as small and light as a paper clip, and the tiny ribs that press visibly against its silvery pink skin give it a segmented look, like that of an insect. A newborn kit is exceptionally underdeveloped, with sealed eyes and ears that wont open for five or six weeks, an age when puppies and kittens are ready to be weaned.

title: Review: In Homegoing, What Slavery Costs One Family
description: Homegoing, the wildly ambitious debut novel by a 26-year-old writer named Yaa Gyasi, tackles some 250 years of history on two continents. Its a novel that seems to have been inspired by such disparate family sagas as Gabriel Garca Mrquezs One Hundred Years of Solitude, Alex Haleys Roots and Thomas Manns Buddenbrooks, a novel that sets itself the daunting task of tracing the legacy of sorrow that slavery has left on eight generations of one family.

title: Review: Makaya McCraven Turns Improvisation Into Jazz Suites With New Jams
description: One of the oldest questions in jazz is whats improvised and whats composed  or, put another way, whats invented and whats reproduced. Makaya McCraven, a young drummer from Chicago, is working at the question from a different angle.

title: Europes Rising Far Right: A Guide to the Most Prominent Parties
description: Amid a migrant crisis and discontent with the European Union, many far-right parties have achieved electoral success. Here are eight of the most noteworthy.

title: London Sings in Honor of Orlando Victims
description: Hundreds of people gathered around Sohos Old Compton Street for a minute of silence to honor victims of the Orlando, Fla., massacre. At the vigil, the London Gay Mens Chorus sang Bridge Over Troubled Water.

title: Novels Bring World War II to Life for a New Generation
description: Historical fiction is having a renaissance, and publishers of young-adult novels say they are seeing special interest in books set during this period.

title: Norman Lear and Aaron Sorkin Help ATX Festival Reach New Heights
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Norman Lear, his signature white canvas hat firmly in place, sat in an emptying theater here on Friday, marveling at the embarrassment of artistic riches his once maligned medium has become.

title: Orlando, Hillary Clinton, Donald Trump: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: AR-15 Rifles Are Beloved, Reviled and a Common Element in Mass Shootings
description: In recent years, the AR-15 has become, simultaneously, one of most beloved and most vilified rifles in the country.

title: Timeline: Benazir Bhutto
description: An interactive timeline of Benazir Bhuttos life and career.

title: Apple to Offer App Developers Access to Siri and iMessage
description: SAN FRANCISCO  With sales sluggish and stiffening competition from rivals like Google and Facebook, Apple announced on Monday coming improvements to the software that runs its devices, including a revamped Music app, an easier login process and better information-sharing across devices.

title: Trump and Clinton on Orlando Shooting
description: Hillary Clintons and Donald J. Trumps responses to the massacre in Orlando, Fla., highlighted their differences on gun control and immigration.

title: Malnutrition and Obesity Coexist in Many Countries, Report Finds
description: Twenty countries are triply cursed: They have serious levels of malnutrition, diet-related anemia and obesity, according to the Global Nutrition Report published on Monday.

title: For Microsoft, LinkedIn Deal Could Be a $26.2 Billion Time Machine
description: Microsofts blockbuster $26.2 billion takeover of LinkedIn might be an attempt to travel through time. Specifically, to the heady heights of yesteryears technology valuations.

title: Microsofts Biggest Deal
description: In its biggest acquisition ever, Microsoft announced that it would buy the social networking site Linkedin for $26.2 billion in cash. LinkedIns share value rose nearly 50 percent on the news.

title: Microsoft Takes Aim at Sony With Cheaper Xbox, Virtual Reality and Cross-Platform Games
description: Microsoft on Monday unveiled a smaller, less expensive Xbox One and plans for a new console that can offer virtual reality games as it seeks to catch up with Sony in video game hardware.

title: What You Need to Know About Apples Software Upgrades
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Apple customers have a lot to digest this summer.

title: A LinkedIn Timeline
description: Since its inception, LinkedIn has been hailed as the professional network, considering itself a Facebook for business.

title: Held Hostage in an Orlando Restroom, and Playing Dead to Stay Alive
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  As the sound of gunfire in the nightclub grew louder, a patron named Orlando and a female friend took cover in a cramped bathroom stall, contorting their bodies on top of the toilet so their feet could not be seen. The gunman burst into the bathroom, went straight to the stall next to them and shot the people inside.

title: Liberal Return Policies for Consumers Can Reduce Retail Workers Pay
description: Earnestine Gay, a longtime worker in the fragrance department at Macys in Herald Square, clearly remembers a bottle of perfume that was returned recently. It was practically empty.

title: New Reality After Orlando Attacks: Dogs, Metal Detectors and Searches at Public Gatherings
description: For Dolly Partons latest tour, the security procedures include not just the usual pat-downs and bag checks at the door, but also two dogs trained to sniff out bombs and firearms wherever the singer performs.

title: Time for a No Buy List on Guns
description: THE massacre in Florida is a horrifying reminder that terrorists dont need airplanes to kill scores of people: All they need are commonplace firearms. Gun-control groups are already issuing calls to do more to keep suspected terrorists from buying guns, while those against stricter gun laws say we shouldnt deny people their constitutional rights on the basis of mere suspicion. They are both correct. But there is a solution.

title: Washington Post Is Latest News Outlet Barred by Trump
description: Donald J. Trump on Monday said his campaign would revoke the press credentials of The Washington Post, effectively prohibiting journalists from one of the nations largest newspapers from joining the traveling press corps of the presumptive Republican nominee.

title: How Joseph Percoco, Cuomos Problem-Solver, Became a Problem
description: ALBANY  Theirs was a relationship built on nearly three decades of unswerving loyalty, absolute trust and near-constant interaction: It was all but impossible to imagine Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo without Joseph Percoco, his closest aide and the enduring mainstay of his life in politics.

title: Officer Testifies About Van Ride Leading to Freddie Grays Death
description: BALTIMORE  The Baltimore police officer whose manslaughter trial in the death of Freddie Gray ended with a hung jury returned to court on Monday  but this time as a witness in the murder trial of a fellow officer who drove the police van in which Mr. Gray suffered the spinal injury that killed him.

title: The Orlando Shooting Victims
description: Forty-nine people were fatally shot when a gunman entered a nightclub in Orlando, Fla., on Sunday. All but one had been identified by Monday evening.

title: One Unspoken Reason Behind the Microsoft-LinkedIn Deal
description: Let me explain why.

title: Jockey Russell Baze, Winner of a Record 12,842 Races, Retires
description: The jockey Russell Baze, who has the most career victories in North American thoroughbred racing history, announced his retirement Monday, effective immediately.

title: In Yankees Farm System, Hope for a Better Yield
description: The Yankees may not know for years whether Blake Rutherford can develop into a power-hitting center fielder, Nick Solak can blossom into a speedy second baseman or Nolan Martinez can become a mainstay of their pitching staff.

title: ISIS Claims Responsibility for Killing of French Police Officer
description: PARIS  A police captain was fatally stabbed and his companion was also killed at their home in a small town northwest of Paris on Monday evening, and within hours the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the murders.

title: After Massacre at Orlando Gay Club, an Array of Opinions About the Motive and Meaning
description: Ted Elliott, a gay college senior from Maine, said he was not jumping to conclusions that the Orlando mass shooting was a hate crime against gay people or an act of terrorism. Mr. Elliott, a self-described liberal, blamed weak gun laws for endless violence.

title: Cuban Defector Yulieski Gourriel Is Declared a Free Agent by M.L.B.
description: Teams needing an impact hitter this summer  and, perhaps, for the next few years  have a new opportunity.

title: Sunset Ride Turns Deadly for 2 on Windy Long Island Sound
description: The wind off the coast of Hammonasset Beach State Park in Connecticut ratcheted up to more than 20 miles an hour by sundown on Sunday, but in the early evening, it felt still enough to a group of four people to head out into Long Island Sound by kayak and paddle board for a dusk ride on the water.
