description: Alan Tony Schatz, 72, who has been cutting meat for 60 years, initially in his fathers shop in the Bronx, is better known by his nickname.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Sisterhood on Wheels: Bushwicks Rugged Roller Derby Girls
description: Blossom Bettles is 12 years old and lives on a tree-lined street in Brooklyn. Her father, who is British, is a photographer; her mother is a meditation and mindfulness teacher from New Zealand. She has a little brother named Sunny. Blossom is petite, with blue eyes and a dimpled smile, and wavy light-brown hair. Her name seems to suit her perfectly, until she straps on skates, dons her gear and becomes Dark Pixie, a fierce competitor in a gritty junior roller derby league in Bushwick.

title: Premier of Ukraine Urges Europe Not to Ease Russia Sanctions
description: The new prime minister of Ukraine appealed to European countries to maintain economic sanctions against Russia, warning that those who might ease pressure would serve as the aggressors accomplices.

title: As Zika Threat Grows in U.S., Testing Lags for a Vulnerable Group
description: As the Zika virus swept north from Brazil into the Caribbean, bringing with it frightening risks for pregnant women and their unborn children, United States health officials decided in February that all expectant women who had visited the countries affected should be tested for the disease.

title: Number of Zika-Positive Puerto Ricans Surprises Health Officials
description: Roughly 1 percent of recent blood donors in Puerto Rico showed signs of active infection with the Zika virus, suggesting that a substantial portion of the islands population will become infected, federal health officials reported on Friday.

title: Russians on Barring of Olympic Team
description: A former Russian Olympic ice skater, Svetlana Zhurova, and Moscow residents criticized the barring of Russias track and field team from the Rio Games.

title: Review: You Know, This Tunnel Feels Really Familiar
description: The discovery of a body, apparently cut in half and straddling an international border, forces bickering cops from neighboring countries to cooperate. Its out there, as premises go, and it doesnt seem as universally appealing as those of, say, Law & Order or CSI. But the Danish-Swedish series The Bridge has proved surprisingly exportable. It inspired an American remake of the same title, which ran for two seasons on FX, and then a British-French series, The Tunnel, whose second season ended recently.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Review: This is New York? An Urban Montage Traffics in the Well Worn
description: To view the hustle and bustle of pedestrian traffic as a kind of dance is a poetic way of looking at city life. It is also a choreographic clich, and Jane Comfort and Companys You Are Here doesnt transcend it.

title: With the Sun Out, a Big Name and a Newcomer Are Tied at the U.S. Open
description: OAKMONT, Pa.  A wave of golfers trudged off the Oakmont Country Club golf course at midmorning Friday, looking weary but happy to have finally finished a round that for many had started 24 hours earlier. Stepping from grass saturated by a deluge the previous day, they stamped their feet on pavement near the clubhouse trying to shed the dampness from their shoes.

title: Angelo Mozilo Will Not Face U.S. Charges for Mortgage Fraud
description: The Justice Departments pursuit of Angelo R. Mozilo, one of Wall Streets most recognizable names tied to the subprime mortgage crisis, is ending with a whimper.

title: Jo Cox, Brexit and the Politics of Hate
description: LONDON  Jo Cox, a Labour member of Britains Parliament, was killed on Thursday in the northern English area she represented by a man wielding a knife and a gun. Initial reports suggested that the suspect, Thomas Mair, was a loner with a history of mental illness. But as more details have emerged, it is becoming clear that he had a commitment to white supremacist and neo-Nazi politics. According to some witnesses, he shouted either Britain first or put Britain first as he stabbed and shot Ms. Cox, who was a vocal defender of immigration and diversity.

title: Review: Hints of Eternity at Trinity Wall Street
description: In Gavin Bryarss The Fifth Century, a haunting work for choir and saxophone quartet that had an eloquent New York premiere at Trinity Wall Street on Thursday evening, the word eternity was clearly audible when intoned by the sopranos at the start of the fourth movement. The syllables of the word were then sung with stately grace before resurfacing later in the section.

title: Review: 2 Murderous Men in 2 Operas About Killing for Politics
description: St. LOUIS  Macbeths weapon of choice is a dagger: long, thin and apt for plunging into a sleeping mans chest. Shalimars is a hunting knife that can gut a cafe guest in broad daylight and looks shockingly like those used in the Islamic States execution videos.

title: Man Inadvertently Broadcasts His Own Killing on Facebook Live
description: Ever since Jack Ruby killed Lee Harvey Oswald on live TV in 1963, broadcasters have worried about accidentally showing an act of violence on camera. With tools like Facebook Live and Periscope available to anyone with a smartphone, the chances of unexpectedly streaming a grisly moment have drastically increased.

title: DSquared2: Spring 2017
description: The spring 2017 collection.

title: Think Less, Think Better
description: A FRIEND of mine has a bad habit of narrating his experiences as they are taking place. I tease him for being a bystander in his own life. To be fair, we all fail to experience life to the fullest. Typically, our minds are too occupied with thoughts to allow complete immersion even in what is right in front of us.

title: Review: Clown  At Least Bozo Never Ate the Kids
description: This glib and repellent exercise in can you top this genre opportunism has a 2013 copyright. Why its distributors, Dimension and Anchor Bay Entertainment, opted to release it on this weekend is anyones guess. It is hardly likely that an executive mused, American culture isnt quite degraded enough; might be a good idea to give it another whack. Or is it?

title: Jo Cox, Donald Trump, Golden State Warriors: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: In Havana, Gay Bars Hold Their Own Against the Internet
description: HAVANA  Just before midnight on a recent Thursday here along the Malecn, the capitals five-mile concrete sea wall boardwalk, Wilder Calderon Pea, 24, a bartender and Airbnb agent, was doing his thunder dance.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Phillipa Soo to Leave Hamilton; Eliza Will Become Amlie

A year after nine members of a historic black church were killed here, politicians and pastors joined with congregations from around the region on Friday to mark the occasion with prayers, tambourines and clapping hands, but also with impassioned, almost desperate calls for action in the face of unceasing gun violence.

title: Marco Rubio, Reversing Plans, Is Leaning Toward Running for Senate Again
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Marco Rubio of Florida is leaning heavily toward running for re-election to the seat he swore he was giving up after six often frustrating years and a failed presidential run, associates said on Friday, a reversal that would upend one of the most competitive races in the country.

title: Review: ChimaTEK Offers Crystal Visions at a Transit Hub
description: With all public art, the real test is making an audience out of those most elusive beings: passers-by. On Thursday night at the Fulton Center, the challenge was even greater  to delay the subway ride home. One transfixed man in the crowd was filming the scene when he received a call. Im going to hit the train in a minute, he told the person on the other end, but Ive gotten caught up with some interpretive dance.

title: A Saudi Imam, 2 Hijackers and Lingering 9/11 Mystery
description: WASHINGTON  Inside an opulent palace in Riyadh late one evening in February 2004, two American investigators interrogated a man they believed might hold answers to one of the lingering mysteries of the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks: What role, if any, did officials in Saudi Arabias government play in the plot?

title: My Fill-In Father
description: FEW days on the calendar are more emotionally fraught for me, more psychologically stacked, than Fathers Day. A proud father, a proud grandfather, Im also a grieving father, having lost my oldest son 12 years ago, and a grieving son, having lost my father in 1981.

title: Friday Night Music: A Song for Brexit
description: But W.S. Gilbert was being ironic

title: A Nuclear Weapon That America Doesnt Need
description: PRESIDENT OBAMA spoke last month in Hiroshima about charting a course to a future free of nuclear weapons. He discussed the persistent effort necessary to eliminate the threat of nuclear war.

title: IEX Group, Critical of Wall St., Gains Approval for Stock Exchange
description: America is getting a new stock exchange from the most prominent critics of high-frequency trading.

title: State Department Draft Dissent Memo on Syria
description: In a draft version of a dissent memo filed with the State Department's senior leadership, dozens of diplomats and other mid-level officials called for military strikes against President Bashar al-Assad of Syria.

title: John Kerry Is Said to Side With Diplomats Critical Memo on Syria
description: WASHINGTON  For a cabinet member whose department had just erupted into open disagreement with the White House, Secretary of State John Kerrys reaction to a critical memo on Syria policy signed by 51 diplomats was remarkably mellow. Its an important statement, he told reporters in Copenhagen on Friday, and I respect the process very, very much.

title: $7 Million in Donations to Go Directly to Orlando Kin and Survivors
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The city announced Friday that the $7 million it collected after the nightclub shooting would be given directly to family members and survivors instead of being distributed through charities and nonprofit groups.

title: The Trump Disaster Chronicle
description: Its natural to wonder how our next president would respond, on a human level, to a disaster like Orlando. The candidates have been pretty clear on policy, but how would he/she relate to a community, and country, in pain?

title: Palestinians Enter Talks With Egypt to Stake Mediterranean Claims
description: UNITED NATIONS  The Middle East peace process is stalemated in part because of disagreement over the appropriate land borders for Israel and a future state of Palestine. Now the Palestinians are taking the first steps toward establishing what their state would claim at sea.

title: Historians, Police and Others Argue What Makes Orlando Massacre Worst
description: Is the massacre in Orlando the worst mass shooting in United States history? News organizations and government officials have said so since Sunday, when a gunman killed 49 people and wounded 53 others at a gay nightclub there.

title: Visium to Sell and Liquidate Funds After Insider Trading Charges
description: Visium Asset Management, a multibillion-dollar hedge fund that is the focus of an insider trading case, will wind itself down.

title: Gunmans Employer Dealt Another in a Series of Black Eyes
description: The past few years have not gone smoothly for G4S, the giant security firm based in Britain that employed the Orlando nightclub killer, Omar Mateen.

title: Five Choices in New York Congressional Primaries
description: Heads up, New York, theres an election coming up. Congressional primaries are on June 28. Here are recommendations in five races  three of them for open seats  that could make a difference locally and even nationally.

title: A Thud of Retribution Reverberates in Russia
description: So the bear will be left to wander the athletic wilderness this August.

title: Monuments for Future Generations
description: President Obamas visits this weekend to Carlsbad Caverns and Yosemite national parks give him a timely opportunity to think about how, in the twilight of his presidency, he can add to what has already been an admirable record of protecting Americas public lands and marine reserves. The parks themselves are in a celebratory moment, the 100th anniversary of the founding of the National Park Service. But given Congresss preference for partisan infighting over environmental stewardship, it is unlikely to approve any additions to the park system. Still, there is much that Mr. Obama can do on his own using the 1906 Antiquities Act, which allows a president to unilaterally protect areas of great natural or historical value as monuments when Congress is unlikely to act.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: When you present politics as a matter of life and death, as a question of national survival, dont be surprised if someone takes you at your word.

title: At U.S. Open, an Upstart-Friendly Course Favors Wisdom, for Now, Over Youth
description: OAKMONT, Pa.  For an old, cantankerous blue blood of a course, Oakmont Country Club has shown a surprising tolerance of youth. It has accommodated a 22-year-old Jack Nicklauss coronation at the 1962 United States Open at the expense of the older, more popular Arnold Palmer; a 26-year-old Johnny Millers crowning in 1973; and a 24-year-old Ernie Elss major title baptism in 1994.

title: Thomas Mair, Suspected in the Jo Cox Killing, Is Charged With Murder
description: BIRSTALL, England  The police in Britain on Saturday charged a 52-year-old man with murdering Jo Cox, the lawmaker whose death shocked Britons and led to a suspension of campaigning in a referendum on whether Britain should leave the European Union.

title: New Yorks Voice at the M.T.A. Gets Louder, as 2 Mayoral Board Picks Are Confirmed
description: The State Senate has confirmed two people recommended by Mayor Bill de Blasio to serve on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority board, strengthening New York Citys voice at the state-run agency that oversees subways and buses.

title: An Unwelcome Tourist Arrives in New Jersey: Clinging Jellyfish
description: When Paul A. X. Bologna heard that a local fisherman had brought a dime-size jellyfish to a New Jersey aquarium, he had a hunch that it might be a Gonionemus vertens, or clinging jellyfish.

title: C.C. Sabathia May Be Friends With LeBron James, but His Heart Remains in the Golden State
description: MINNEAPOLIS  C. C. Sabathia was surprisingly upbeat Friday. His beloved Golden State Warriors had lost to the Cleveland Cavaliers in the N.B.A. finals on Thursday night, but that could not tarnish his sense of accomplishment in having thrown six demanding innings to beat the Minnesota Twins, 4-1.

title: Knock on Wood
description: Administrivial PDF Alert! Due to reasons, the Sunday, June 19 puzzle will look different depending on where you are solving. We recommend using the PDF, or alternatively the web game, for solving this puzzle, as it contains elements that other formats cannot reproduce. [NECESSARY SPOILER ALERT] Specifically, six squares which normally would be black instead each have their four edges colored, alternating between green and red. These colored squares occur at the intersections of 31A/11D, 34A/5D, 46A/26D, 62A/45D, 92A/67D and 98A/75D.

title: Dominic Thiem, the Hardest-Working Man in Tennis
description: HALLE, Germany  As Dominic Thiem has cemented his place this year as a rising star of mens tennis, his quality has been matched with quantity.

title: A Height Rory McIlroy Hopes to Never Reach Again
description: OAKMONT, Pa.  Third-ranked Rory McIlroy, the 2011 United States Open champion, equaled his worst start in eight appearances in the event with a seven-over-par 77.

title: More Guilty Pleas in Fraud Scheme Connected to False 9/11 Claims
description: The photo was featured on the cover of New York Citys tabloids: a man in shorts and sunglasses sitting on a water scooter, a smile on his face, middle fingers extended to the sky.

title: Matt Harvey and the Mets Take a Step Back
description: Two and half months into the season and Matt Harvey remains an enigma. His improvement over past two weeks offered a glimmer of hope that he had solved the problems behind his wretched start. But Friday, in a 5-1 loss to the Atlanta Braves, Harvey lapsed.

title: Colombia Slumps to Victory Over Peru in Copa Amrica Quarterfinal
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  It is, traditionally, one of the weirder features of the Copa Amrica: There is no extra time in case of a 90-minute draw, in the quarterfinal and semifinal knockout rounds. Teams skip the 30-minute overtime and go directly to penalty kicks, unless a tie occurs in the tournaments final.

title: Robert Paine, Ecologist Who Found Keystone Species, Dies at 83
description: Robert Paine, a groundbreaking, hands-on ecologist who found that removing what he called a keystone species from an environment could profoundly affect the fortunes of neighboring species, died on Monday in Seattle. He was 83.

description: The massacre in Orlando, Fla., has intruded on the Ramadan traditions of the citys high school students, who value the holiday as a refuge in their typical teenage lives.

title: Orlando Killings Rob Young New York Muslims of a Cherished Holiday Respite
description: For Muhammad Hannan and other Muslim high school students in New York City, this has been a Ramadan of contrasts and conflicting emotions.

title: Pleading Poverty, Rio Governor Seeks Aid for Olympics
description: Rio de Janeiros governor declared a state of financial emergency Friday and requested federal funds to help fulfill obligations for public services during the Olympics, which start Aug. 5.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: In Whiskey Tango Foxtrot, Tina Fey transports her nerdy workaholic screen persona to the war in Afghanistan. In Sleeping With Other People, Jason Sudeikis and Alison Brie play sexaholics trying to keep it in the friend zone. And if you dont want to brave the lines for Finding Dory, watch Finding Nemo instead.

title: Rested Pitcher Guides Yankees Past Twins for Second Straight Win
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The Minnesota Twins left-hander Pat Dean grew up a Yankees fan in Naugatuck, Conn., the same hometown as 1940s Yankees star Francis Shea, known as Spec. Dean had eagerly anticipated his first career appearance against the Yankees on Friday night at Target Field.

description: For eager newcomers trying to hustle a life in New York City, there are certain time-honored means of staying afloat: foaming lattes as a barista, selling books at the Strand, or shepherding spaniels as a paid dog walker.

title: A Letter About Barack H. Obama Sr.'s Record in College
description: Barack Obama Sr. had hoped to graduate from Harvard University with a Ph.D. in economics, but he struggled there academically in his first year. He graduated with a masters degree. The 1963 letter is one of many documents discovered by an archivist at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Harlem.

title: Suspect in British Lawmakers Killing: My Name Is Death to Traitors
description: LONDON  The man charged with murdering the British lawmaker Jo Cox made his first court appearance on Saturday, telling the court when asked his name, My name is death to traitors, freedom for Britain.

title: A Letter of Reference for Barack H. Obama Sr.
description: Barack Obama Sr.s professors and advisers at the University of Hawaii praised his academic performance. The 1961 letter is one of many at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Harlem that chronicle the life of President Obama's father.

title: Barack Obama Sr.'s Letter of Achievement
description: Barack Obama Sr. excelled in his classes at the University of Hawaii, completing his undergraduate degree in three years. The 1961 letter by the president's father is one of nearly two dozen discovered by an archivist. It offers a portrait of his life in the United States.

title: Appeal for Funds for Living Expenses by Barack Obama Sr.
description: In 1962, Barack Obama Sr. began his graduate studies at Harvard University and requested financial assistance to help him cope with the high cost of living in Cambridge, Mass. The letter is one of nearly two dozen that chronicle his life in the United States.

title: Work Experience of Barack H. Obama Sr.
description: Barack Obama Sr. never finished high school and worked in a variety of jobs before he was admitted to the University of Hawaii in 1959. This document is among many from 1958 to 1964 at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Harlem.

title: A Letter by Obama's Father Seeking Financial Aid
description: Barack Obama Sr. applied to the African-American Institute for financial assistance in 1958. The document is one of several at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Harlem.

description: PARIS  The police raided dozens of sites across Belgium and brought in 40 people for questioning in an operation to interrupt a terrorist plot to attack fans gathering to watch a televised soccer match between the Belgian and Irish national teams, government officials said on Saturday.

description: Environmentalists have defended the Nu, in Yunnan Province, for more than a decade, battling state hydropower firms intent on building dams.

title: Chinas Last Wild River Carries Conflicting Environmental Hopes
description: QIUNATONG, China  Three great rivers rush through parallel canyons in the mountains of southwest China on their way to the coastal plains of Asia. At least 10 dams have been built on two of them, the Mekong and the Yangtze. The third remains wild: the remote, raging Nu, known as the Salween in Myanmar, where it empties into the Andaman Sea.

title: Raghuram Rajan Says Hell Step Down as Head of Indias Central Bank
description: NEW DELHI  The governor of Indias central bank, Raghuram G. Rajan, announced on Saturday that he would step down in September and return to academia, ending a three-year tenure that enhanced Indias standing in international markets but frustrated conservatives and small business owners eager for deep interest rate cuts.

title: 50 Years Later, Still Working for the Airline
description: Peter Ho, 69, is the Vancouver-based regional catering manager for North America at Cathay Pacific Airways.

description: Spring 2017 designs from Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana.

title: Fur Flies in Doggy Door Dispute
description: As you read this episode, dear readers, keep in mind: The Haggler does not set out to annoy anyone. He does not hope that people will shout at him. Honest.

title: Remote? Thats No Way to Describe This Work
description: Back in 2007, during a weekly check-in, my wifes manager delivered some unexpected good news: You dont have to be in the office to do this job, she said. You could work from wherever you want. A fast six months later, we left hot, crowded Austin, Tex., and moved into an apartment on Munjoy Hill in Portland, Me., with a commanding view of Casco Bay only steps away.

title: A Question For the Fed
description: There is a near-consensus at the FOMC that rates must eventually move up. But heres my question: why, exactly? Specifically, which component of aggregate demand do we believe will continue to strengthen in a way that will require monetary tightening to avoid an overheating economy?

title: Marni: Spring 2017
description: The spring 2017 mens collection.

title: Variety: Two by Three
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Another new variety puzzle for us today, courtesy of Richard L. Wainwright, and I thought it was a lot of fun. On the easy side, but I was pleasantly surprised at the give-and-take of trying to guess what the phrases were and which two letters might complete them.

title: Gender Diversity on Corporate Boards
description: To the Editor:

title: Always Agitated. Always Mad: Omar Mateen, According to Those Who Knew Him
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The brother of the bride arrived late for her reception. But soon enough he was mingling at the lakeside pavilion in West Palm Beach, where a diverse gathering of guests dined on chicken tikka masala and goat biryani while admiring the view of the Intracoastal Waterway just beyond the floor-to-ceiling windows.

title: Many What-Ifs in Donald Trumps Plan for Migrants
description: In an address after the Orlando massacre punctuated with dire warnings of impending violence, Donald J. Trump said he would suspend immigration from areas of the world when there is a proven history of terrorism against the United States or its allies. Mr. Trump promised fixes to the immigration system that would be tough and smart and fast.

title: Versace: Spring 2017
description: Versaces spring 2017 mens designs.

title: With Swat of Stephen Curry, LeBron James Jolted a Debate
description: Size still matters when it comes packaged in an unmatched amalgam of skill, strength, speed and smarts while garnished with the hustle of a fringe veteran treating every last play as if his next paycheck depended on it.

title: A Glimpse of Omar Mateen's Past, From School Reports to Job Dismissal
description: As investigators comb through Omar Mateens past to glean an understanding of the young man whose attack on an Orlando nightclub left 49 dead and 53 wounded, a portrait of a complicated childhood and young adulthood is emerging. These documents offer a glimpse into Mr. Mateens life.

title: Michelle Cliff, Who Wrote of Colonialism and Racism, Dies at 69
description: Michelle Cliff, a Jamaican-American writer whose novels, stories and nonfiction essays drew on her multicultural identity to probe the psychic disruptions and historical distortions wrought by colonialism and racism, died on June 12 at her home in Santa Cruz, Calif. She was 69.

title: Desmond Heeley, an Alchemist of Theater Design, Dies at 85
description: Desmond Heeley, a celebrated designer for the theater, the opera and the ballet, whose costumes dressed the likes of Laurence Olivier, Beverly Sills and Margot Fonteyn, and whose sets were used in major productions throughout the world, died on June 10 in Manhattan. He was 85.

title: Lois Duncan, 82, Dies; Author Knew What You Did Last Summer
description: Lois Duncan, whose suspenseful young adult novels inspired the slasher movie I Know What You Did Last Summer and who later wrote about the unsolved murder of her daughter, died on Wednesday at her home in Bradenton, Fla. She was 82.

title: Regardless of Brexit Vote, Experts Say, E.U. Must Rethink Status Quo
description: ROME  Among the well-heeled bureaucrats of the European Union, it is an article of faith that the bloc always emerges stronger from a crisis. The idealistic founders who six decades ago dreamed of stitching warring nations into a peaceful whole knew the path would be bumpy. But always, the union wobbled forward.

title: A Touchy-Feely Approach From Hillary Clinton
description: Just days after the massacre at a gay nightclub in Orlando, and after a long primary campaign in which Republican candidates often seemed preoccupied with war, terrorism and related fears, Hillary Clintons first ad of the general election strikes a gentler and more reassuring tone. It seeks to reintroduce her to voters, ostensibly by highlighting lesser-known aspects of her work on behalf of families and children.

title: Russias Track Team Will Miss the Olympics. American Audiences? Not Likely.
description: Russia, a perpetual powerhouse at the Olympics, sent more than 400 athletes to the last Summer Games, in London in 2012. At the opening ceremony in Rio de Janeiro in seven weeks, the countrys delegation may appear relatively meager during the parade of nations in Maracan Stadium.

title: David Wright, the Forever Met, Recedes Into the Background Again
description: Already, it is easy to think of David Wright in the past tense. His lockers at Citi Field, with helmets of the Giants and Virginia Tech hanging from hooks in the corner, remain intact. Packages and notes pile up on his chair. Wright is a presence around the Mets, but a ghostly one. Again.

title: Im Sorry, No More Ducks
description: A few weeks before she turned 2 last month, my daughter decided she would not be going to bed on her own anymore.

title: Bradford Parkinson
description: Bradford Parkinson is an engineer, inventor and retired Air Force colonel widely recognized as the father of the Global Positioning System, or GPS, now critical for navigation, whether its in the skies, the high seas or just traveling down the highway.

title: A Kiddie Party for Us All, Even Me
description: I KNOW youre under a lot of pressure with your toddlers birthday party only a week away. I get it. Id be just as stressed if I were tasked with baking a vegan Caillou-shaped cake. And I really hate to pile on. But, I  the one single, childless friend youve invited  do have some special requests for the birthday party Im hoping you can accommodate. To make this simple, Ive created a handy list for your reference to ensure youre planning an event I can enjoy. Or at least, almost enjoy.

title: Im Ghanaian-American. Am I Black?
description: THE first time I was ever called a nigger was also the first time I was not called a nigger.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Feminism for a New Era
description: Balancing child-rearing and work outside the home may be more challenging than ever.

title: A Real War Story, in Drawings
description: JUNE 25 marks the 140th anniversary of the Battle of the Little Bighorn, otherwise known as Custers Last Stand, part of the 1876 counterinsurgency campaign we call the Great Sioux War. Given that the United States today is engaged in two deadly counterinsurgency wars, fighting the Taliban in Afghanistan and the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, it is useful to study this history for what it can tell us about an adversary and ourselves. Examining the stunning drawings made in 1881 by Red Horse, a Mnicoujou warrior who fought at the Little Bighorn, provides timeless lessons about war.

title: Why I Was Wrong About Welfare Reform
description: TULSA, Okla.  IN 1996, President Bill Clinton signed a controversial compromise bill for welfare reform, promising to end welfare as we know it.

title: Donald Trumps Place
description: SO now we know.

title: Mr. Ryans Plan to Revert, Regress and Deregulate
description: House Speaker Paul Ryan presented his economic agenda last week, but it does not deal with the countrys problems with jobs, wages, investment, trade, inequality or other pressing economic issues. Rather, its 57 pages boil down to one idea: Roll back hundreds of federal regulations that protect consumers, investors, employees, borrowers, students and the environment.

title: Heading Off the Next Extremist
description: Though the motives of Omar Mateen may never fully be known, the massacre he committed in Orlando has raised an urgent question. How does a democratic society counter self-radicalization and prevent domestic attacks by those who have absorbed the call of terrorist groups to kill innocent civilians?

title: Trump in the Dumps
description: Washington  HE wont pivot. So I have to.

title: Two Dads, Two Kids, One Experiment in Family
description: HERES what Im going to do on Fathers Day, with my kids who are 6 and 3. The younger one will wake at 5:52 (he can never manage the eight minutes that would make all the difference) and rouse his brother, one bunk up. My husband will take them downstairs so I can sleep, but really Ill lie in bed and look at my phone until the need for coffee overwhelms me. My husband will make pancakes if hes feeling ambitious and bowls of cereal if hes not. Special enough, if not a special occasion; this is every Sunday in our house.

title: The Republicans Big Hot Mess
description: IN normal times, a partys leaders and comers grovel for roles in the convention and prime time on its stage.

title: Bribery and Corruption, or Honest Graft?
description: IN a tradition dating to the 1600s, the departing municipal officials of High Wycombe in England are weighed each May to assess whether they have literally gained off the fat of the land, perhaps at public expense. If not, a macebearer cues their constituents to cheer by proclaiming, And no more. In the 1800s, Thomas Nast caricatured the typically portly Boss Tweed as disingenuously protesting he was too thin to have pocketed kickbacks from New York City contractors.

title: Has Political Fear-Mongering Lost Its Appeal?
description: THIS was an important and even revelatory week in American politics, and we should take note of it. Contrary to what Id argue has been the single most firmly held conviction about this campaign by observers left and right, a terrorist attack did not help the Republican candidate in the race for president. Indeed, it seems to have weakened him.

title: Drinking by Numbers
description: Berkeley, Calif.  AT a recent physical, I was surprised by the way the usual questionnaire jolted me with one query in particular: How many drinks do you have a week, on average? There was a time about 10 years ago when Id have said two a week as a baseline; now its more like two a day.

title: Neil Barrett: Spring 2017
description: Mr. Barretts spring 2017 collection.

title: Olympic Officials Back Ban on Russian Track Team From Rio Games
description: One day after an unprecedented ruling that barred Russias track and field team from the Summer Olympics, Olympic officials said Saturday that they agreed with it, ending any hope the team had of gaining entry into the Rio Games.

title: A Common Goal at the Top of the Leaderboard: Winning a First Major
description: OAKMONT, Pa.  It is a compliment that stings, the golf equivalent of being known for a winning personality. Over the last decade, Dustin Johnson, Sergio Garca and Lee Westwood have taken turns wearing the best golfer never to have won a major label.

title: On The Trail: The Week of June 12
description: The shootings in Orlando cast a shadow over the campaign this week and candidates attacked their rivals gun and immigration policies.

title: Shaken by Sex Scandal, Oakland Police to Get New Leader, Again
description: For the fourth time in less than two weeks, the police department in Oakland, Calif., is answering to a different leader.

title: For Many Golfers, Fathers Serve as the Caddies of Life
description: Patrick Wilkes-Krier was warming up on Thursday morning for his United States Open debut next to the defending champion, Jordan Spieth. Suddenly he stopped, leaned his club against his golf bag and, with a few loping strides, appeared at the side of his father, James Krier, who had been wordlessly watching him. Krier nuzzled his fathers neck and gave him a kiss. After a long embrace, he pulled away, retraced his steps and resumed hitting balls.

title: Pal Zileri: Spring 2017
description: The Spring 2017 collection.

title: A War of Brothers in Iraq: I Will Kill Him With My Own Hands
description: FALLUJA, Iraq  In the days leading up to the storming of Falluja by Iraqi forces, Brig. Gen. Hadi Razaij, the leading Sunni police commander in the campaign, sat on a cot in an abandoned house near the front line. He described the resistance that lay ahead: a determined force of hundreds of jihadists that had months to prepare.

title: Chelsea Clinton Gives Birth to a Boy, Aidan
description: Hillary Clinton, who often talks on the campaign trail about being a grandmother, now has twice the reason for doing so as her daughter Chelsea Clinton has given birth to her second child.

title: Karch Kiraly Now Setting Up U.S. Womens Volleyball Team to Succeed
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  It was an unusually warm afternoon in Southern California and an unusual time to get the chills. But the tanned arms and legs of Karch Kiraly  the famous volleyball player, now 55, coaching the United States womens national indoor team in search of its first-ever Olympic gold medal  were covered in goose bumps.

title: U.S. Carriers Sail in Western Pacific, Hoping China Takes Notice
description: BEIJING  In a show of strength before an international courts ruling on Chinas claims in the South China Sea, the United States Navy sent two aircraft carriers and their accompanying ships on training drills in the western Pacific Ocean on Saturday.

title: Mike Emrick, a Hockey Wordsmith, Prepares for a Transition to the Diamond
description: Mike Emricks connection to hockey is so strong  and his play-by-play so vivid  that it may be surprising that he has such a strong love for baseball.

title: Mornings With My Father
description: A joint photography project, and conversations over breakfast, rekindle a relationship severed two decades ago.

title: A Royals Call-Up Is Making a Case to Stay
description: The Kansas City Royals return to Citi Field on Tuesday, facing the Mets in a two-game series at the site of their triumph last fall. The Royals won the World Series in Flushing last Nov. 1 in a 12-inning thriller that Whit Merrifield watched from home in Winston-Salem, N.C.

title: Suddenly, Its the Warriors Who Seem Winded in the N.B.A. Finals
description: It has become a fad among teams to adopt a catchphrase to sum up their approach (while also helping sell T-shirts). As with most things, not all are created equal.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Daniel Suarez, a Mexican Driver, Sets New Course for Nascar
description: Besides learning how to race a stock car in much faster traffic, Daniel Suarez was confronted with another considerable challenge  the English language  after moving to the United States from Mexico in 2012. So he watched movies with subtitles, plus lots of cartoons.

title: Mets Are Hitting the Ball Far, but Not Often Enough
description: As the Mets meander through June and weigh their options for improvement, their offense remains an issue. The Mets have produced the second-fewest hits in the major leagues and sit third-to-last in runs per game, not enough to support their talented pitching staff. But in one telling offensive category, the Mets were the best in baseball entering Saturday.

title: Yankees Climb Back to .500 With Win Over Twins
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Since the start of 2014, the Minnesota Twins right-hander Ricky Nolasco had a 5.49 E.R.A., the highest mark of any starting pitcher in the major leagues with 250 or more innings. That Nolasco held the Yankees scoreless for six innings on a steamy Saturday afternoon counted as a significant surprise.

title: Pulse D.J.s Recall How Joyful Beats Gave Way to Massacre Gunfire
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Hundreds of partyers were bringing their best to the dance floor as the reggaeton beats emanated from the D.J. booth to the main floor at Pulse, where the revelers swayed to the music, which has roots in Jamaican dance hall, Trinidadian soca and Panamanian Spanish reggae.

title: Traffic Intersections
description: Administrivial PDF Alert! Due to reasons, todays puzzle will look different depending on where you are solving. We recommend using the PDF or alternatively the web game for solving this puzzle, as it contains elements that other formats cannot reproduce. [NECESSARY SPOILER ALERT!] Specifically, six squares that normally would be black instead have their four edges colored, alternating between green and red. These colored squares occur at the intersections of 31A/11D, 34A/5D, 46A/26D, 62A/45D, 92A/67D and 98A/75D.

title: Dancing With Defiance in Orlando, but Gay Clubs and Bars Feel Eerie
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  They came for the flashing neon lights, hip-swiveling tunes, cocktails and glitzy drag queens. Some arrived with a sense of purpose and defiance, to show that everything is going to be all right, to remember the loved ones they lost. Others just wanted to move on.

title: De Blasio Keeps Control of Citys Schools, but Only for a Year
description: For the New York City schools and their governance structure, annual cliffhangers seem to be here to stay.

title: Lives Still in Limbo, One Year After Southeast Asia Migrant Crisis
description: BAYEUN, Indonesia  When Mohammed Salim washed ashore on the coast of Aceh Province in Indonesia during the Southeast Asian refugee crisis last year, he was hungry, thirsty, emaciated and exhausted.

title: For Injury-Plagued Roger Federer, Semifinal Loss on the Grass Is Progress
description: HALLE, Germany  On paper, it was Roger Federers least auspicious Wimbledon preparation in years. But on his path to recovery from an injury-plagued start to the season, his semifinal losses at two grass-court events in Germany were marked progress.

title: Portugals Cristiano Ronaldo Cant Mask Frustration in Tie With Austria
description: PARIS  Many different words have been used to describe Cristiano Ronaldos face.

title: As Warriors Prepare for Game 7 Pressure, LeBron James Says He Doesnt Feel Any
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Steve Kerr, the coach of the Golden State Warriors, told his players that they ought to feel pressure.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If I catch him during the battles, I will kill him with my own hands because he is a criminal.

title: Grgory Bourdys Bogeys Are Par for France
description: OAKMONT, Pa.  Grgory Bourdy, the 34-year-old Frenchman who briefly held the lead at the 116th United States Open on Saturday and also threatened to shoot a record-tying 63, knows his homelands golf history.

title: Driven by Campaign Populism, Democrats Unite on Expanding Social Security
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, Hillary Clinton and other Democrats are rallying around proposals to expand Social Security and increase benefits, a sea change after three decades dominated by concern over the programs rising costs.

title: Leaks of Answers Before Egypts National Exams Embarrass Government
description: CAIRO  As Egyptian high school students take their final exams this month, the government is facing a wave of criticism and mockery after copies of at least two test papers  and their answers  were leaked on Facebook.

title: Outlander Season 2, Episode 11: Off With His Head
description: At one point during this weeks episode of Outlander, one of Prince Charless not quite loyal generals says, the truth is often vexing. Its a line that neatly encapsulates the nature of this season, much of which has been about the way lying shapes the course of ones life.

title: Bronx Teenager Is Stabbed to Death Over $2
description: Carl Ducasses family in the Bronx had been planning something big to mark two approaching milestones: his graduation from high school this month, and his 18th birthday in August.

title: U.S. Tells Russia of Strong Concerns About Strikes on Syrian Rebels
description: WASHINGTON  Senior American and Russian defense officials held what the Pentagon described as an extraordinary videoconference on Saturday to discuss Russian airstrikes that days earlier hit a garrison manned by Syrian rebels backed by the United States.

title: Commitment to Class Conflict Drives Leader of French Labor Unrest
description: PARIS  All up and down the boulevard, store windows were smashed  at a Starbucks, a supermarket, a handbag store. Young men clambered on top of bus shelters. Even a childrens hospital was attacked. The police brought out tear gas and a rarely used water cannon.

title: Lionel Messi Dazzles as Argentina Advances to Face United States
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Argentina came to the United States this summer in pursuit of its first major soccer championship in 23 years. Now, the United States stands in the way.

title: Unseen Violation Prompts a Striking Act From Shane Lowry
description: OAKMONT, Pa.  Shane Lowry placed the putter behind his golf ball on the 16th green Saturday to line up a long birdie putt. He then saw the ball move ever so slightly backward. No one else saw the ball change positions.

title: Phoenix Focuses on Rebuilding Downtown, Wooing Silicon Valley
description: PHOENIX  On King of the Hill, the animated sitcom that aired for 13 years on Fox, the character named Peggy Hill once called Phoenix a monument to mans arrogance. Last summer, on a day the temperature broke records at 115 degrees, someone posted a segment on Reddit under the thread Phoenix, Arizona, should not exist.

description: A 5-year-old boy was in fair condition on Saturday after his mother wrested him from a mountain lion that had pounced on the child outside their home near Aspen, Colo., the police said.

title: Apple, Uneasy Over Donald Trump, Wont Support Republican Convention
description: The tech giant Apple will withhold its support from the Republican National Convention in July because of its discomfort with comments by Donald J. Trump, two people briefed on the companys decision said on Saturday.

title: Corrections: June 19, 2016
description: METROPOLITAN

title: Braves Outrun and Outfox the Mets
description: Mets reliever Addison Reed spun a slider into the ground, and even though catcher Rene Rivera dropped to his knees, the ball scooted past him. By the time Rivera found the ball and dived back to home plate, Atlanta Braves center fielder Ender Inciarte had slid in safely.

title: Whats on TV Sunday
description: The Tunnel adapts The Bridge, the Scandinavian thriller, for the Eurostar crowd. Jim Gaffigan skewers himself for a second season with the help of some celebrity friends. And CNN investigates some newly declassified spy missions.

title: What Does It Mean to Be a Black Man? Photos of Fathers and Sons
description: Come to Selfhood, combines portraits of young black men, handwritten texts and photos of their fathers in a retort against societys misconceptions of black masculinity.

title: What Does It Mean to Be a Black Man? Photos of Fathers and Sons
description: To Christian Cody (Slide 13), black masculinity is a liquid; loose and easily manipulated. Hasani Sahlehe (Slide 12) thought that to be a black man he had to be big, strong, athletic, tough. He is not. For Lamar Allen, the comedian Steve Harvey is the exemplar: His ability to admit mistakes, take ownership, his boldness, leadership and willingness to give back to the black community represents black masculinity.

title: At Okinawa Protest, Thousands Call for Removal of U.S. Bases
description: TOKYO  Tens of thousands of people on the Japanese island of Okinawa gathered on Sunday to demand the removal of American military bases in what organizers said was the largest demonstration against the United States presence there in two decades.

title: The New Dads Club
description: When my wife, Courtney, and I were expecting our first child just a few years ago, I was astonished by the almost instantaneous community of expectant and new mothers that greeted her. Despite the fact that wed just moved cross-country and didnt yet know many people, she was flooded with sage advice and a deep sense of community.

title: Orlando, Donald Trump, Golden State Warriors: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: Not Forgotten: Anderson Cooper on His Father
description: Influential people tell us which historical figures they would dine with for our Breaking Bread series.

title: Decades Later, Sickness Among Airmen After a Hydrogen Bomb Accident
description: Alarms sounded on United States Air Force bases in Spain and officers began packing all the low-ranking troops they could grab onto buses for a secret mission. There were cooks, grocery clerks and even musicians from the Air Force band.

title: Which Birth Control App or Website Should You Use?
description: A growing number of websites and apps enable women to obtain birth control without visiting a doctor. Answer these four questions to find out which one best fits your situation.

title: Birth Control via App Finds Footing Under Political Radar
description: A quiet shift is taking place in how women obtain birth control. A growing assortment of new apps and websites now make it possible to get prescription contraceptives without going to the doctor.

title: Hong Kong Bookseller Finds Associates Challenging His Account of Detention
description: HONG KONG  Adopting the mantle of a whistle-blower rarely comes without consequences. Edward J. Snowden is in exile in Russia for leaking secrets of the National Security Agency. Michael Winston, who gained fame for exposing Countrywide Financials mortgage policies, spent years battling lawsuits. Now, in Hong Kong, it is Lam Wing-kees turn to feel the heat.

title: Esquires New Editor, Unveiled at a Chic Party in Milan
description: MILAN  On Friday evening, at the palatial Museo Bagatti Valsecchi, once home to a baronial family, Esquire gave a party. At the center of it was Jay Fielden, the new editor of the Hearst mens publication, which has been around since 1933.

title: Salvatore Ferragamo: Spring 2017
description: The labels spring 2017 collection.

title: 1916: President Orders Troops to Mexican Border
description: NEW YORK  Mr. Wilsons answer to Mexican dictators insolent ultimatum is flat refusal to withdraw American punitive expedition until outrages on Americans have been redressed and the bandits who committed them have been captured and punished. In reply to General Carranzas insolent and imperative demand  which was accompanied by the threat that if the United States failed to comply within seven days war would be declared  President Wilson has issued a call for the mobilization of the National Guard of all the States of the Union, about 150,000 men, for service on the Mexican frontier.

title: The Talk of the Versace Mens Show: Music by Prince
description: MILAN  A black car pulled up outside of 12 Via Ges, Milans via delluomo (or mens street, lined with mens shops) on Saturday, and out stepped a tiny blonde in a spill of ruffles, accompanied by a Jack Russell terrier with its own entourage of staff members.

title: Armed Man Is Fatally Shot by Officers in the Bronx, Police Say
description: A man in the Bronx was fatally shot by New York City police officers early Sunday after he refused to drop a gun he was carrying and pointed it at the officers, the authorities said.

title: Bernie Sanders Die-Hards Gather and Try to Look Past November
description: CHICAGO  Ethan Winnett, a 31-year-old from Waukegan, Ill., said that if Senator Bernie Sanders endorsed Hillary Clinton after his decades as a progressive champion, it would amount to nothing short of a betrayal of all of his principles.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking seven days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: 1891: Searing Heat in New York
description: NEW YORK  The heat for the past few days has been phenomenal even for New York. Yesterday afternoon [June 16] the thermometer stood at 99deg. in the shade, and with much humidity in the atmosphere it seemed almost impossible to live. Several deaths occurred, and a large number of persons were prostrated. Today the thermometer has been close on 100deg., and the atmosphere was still very humid, despite a thunderstorm which occurred last night, when great damage was done in various parts of the State by lightning.

title: Heng on Brexit

title: Review: Raised by Wolves Reimagines an Unusual Childhood

Trailing a musclebound yob she adores (he calls her the Gruffalo), she licks the wall of the house where she thinks he lives and puts her hand through the mail slot, whispering, And Im in. When her sister complains that Germaine sexually harasses everything she comes in contact with, she replies: I cant help it. The world is hot.

Up there, he said, sidestepping a scrap of wood and motioning to a pile of rubble in the distance, was where the temple once stood. To the right, half of a sphinx is still buried in the sand.

title: Review: Natashia Dens Grace, a Tale of Slavery, Its Ghosts and Legacy
description: With her debut novel, Grace, Natashia Den has announced herself beautifully and distinctively. Her emotional range spans several octaves. She writes with her nerves, generating terrific suspense. And her style is so visual it plays tricks on the imagination  did I just watch that scene? Or did I read it?

title: Review: The Cure Revels in Its Contradictions and History
description: They work hard for it, Robert Smith & Company. You understand Dolly Partons show business dictum, It takes a lot of money to look this cheap? Then you understand the generative contradictions of the Cure: It must take a lot of optimism to look that disenchanted. But in a certain corner of the bands work, the opposite holds true, too: It has to take a lot of disenchantment to look that optimistic. And from there you can spin out other noun-adjective combinations, which similarly work in forward or reverse: confidence/shaky. Centrality/marginal. Generosity/self-absorbed. Forethought/nostalgic. Hardness/tender. Severity/sweet.

title: Unfairly Left in the Dark at the U.S. Open While Officials Consider a Rule
description: OAKMONT, Pa.  Because golf is an outdoor sport played on a field of competition that changes from place to place and day to day, its rules are inherently more complex than those of other sports. There are so many factors to weigh, and the golf rule book considers thousands of them, addressing things like what to do if a ball comes to rest on a live snake or a dead snake.

title: Silicon Valley Season 3, Episode 9: What Exactly Is Pied Piper?
description: This seems like an odd question to ponder nearly three full seasons into Silicon Valley, but its worth asking: What exactly is Pied Piper anyway? We know that it offers lossless file compression, which is appealing to anyone who doesnt want their music, movies and photos to bump against the memory limits of their computers, phones and other devices. But a lot of the cutting-edge concepts that make Pied Piper a technological breakthrough  the neural net, the peer-to-peer distribution cloud, the centralized data store  remains abstract and elusive. We trust that it will improve our lives, but how might the app actually work? And how can we be sure that its machine-learning function wont lead to a robot apocalypse, like Skynet in The Terminator?

title: Cavaliers Defeat Warriors to Win Their First N.B.A. Title

It was one of the shows finest half-hours, and so self-contained that even a person watching for the first time could enjoy it. Now we get this years version of Testimony in Kissing Your Sister, an offbeat episode that both summarizes and comments on everything thats happened so far in Season 5. Its a conceptual tour de force  and, more important, its very, very funny.

title: What Do This Seasons Political Books Tell Us About the Election?
description: Is there a useful precedent for this most unpredictable of election seasons? Some have pointed to 1976, when Republicans were split in two and had to settle their differences at the national convention that summer. Others point to the chaos and violence of 1968. But a more pertinent example may be the election of 1936. The country was lifting itself out of the Great Depression, helped by the policies of Franklin Roosevelt, but the climb back to prosperity was long and slow, and a mood of populist unrest began to steal across the land. The followers of the demagogues mostly came from the old lower-middle classes, now in an unprecedented stage of frustration and fear, menaced by humiliation, dispossession and poverty, Arthur Schlesinger Jr. wrote in The Politics of Upheaval, published in 1960. They came from provincial and traditionally nonpolitical groups in the population, jolted from apathy into near-hysteria by the shock of economic collapse. Many also came from the evangelical denominations; years of Bible reading and fundamentalist revivalism had accustomed them to millennial solutions. Outsider candidates became the vehicles of an existential protest, Old America in resentful revolt against both contemporary politics and contemporary economics.

title: A Fight Over Aliens

When she led a group of students to ask the college library to consider phasing out the term, they expected, at best, to make a statement at the campus. But their request triggered a political fight that has drawn in lawmakers engaged in the immigration debate.

title: The G.O.P.s Cynical Gay Ploy

title: Protecting Students From Bad Colleges
description: By failing for decades to regulate for-profit colleges, the federal government encouraged a predatory industry that saddled poor and working-class people with crippling student debt, often in return for useless degrees or no degrees at all. The industry accomplished this by relying on the federal student aid program for virtually all of its revenue. But the Obama administration took steps last week that could keep future students from falling into this trap.

It had tanks, guns, and nukes, but nobody really believed in its ideology anymore; its officials and enforcers were mere careerists, who folded at the first shock.
