description: Dolly Parton is in the middle of her biggest North American tour in 25 years, with dates in more than 60 cities. But she expects to be even busier during the next year. Ms. Parton, 70, one of country musics most enduring entertainers, is developing a TV series based on her life, releasing two albums  including this summers Pure & Simple, with new, original songs  and celebrating 50 years of marriage with her husband, Carl Dean.

title: Why the Sweet Scent of Japanese Honeysuckle Signals Trouble
description: Anyone who has ventured into a New York City woodland in early summer has probably experienced the intoxicating scent of Japanese honeysuckle. Though there are native plants as fragrant in the evening  linden comes to mind  generally speaking, New Yorkers need only follow their noses to the ubiquitous Japanese honeysuckle to find the source. To naturalists, however, the sweet scent of honeysuckle smells like trouble.

title: Whale Conversation, Interrupted
description: Audio, recorded by Orca Lab, of whales communicating with one another until the arrival of oceangoing humans.

title: Tony Blair: Brexits Stunning Coup
description: London  THE decision of British voters in Thursdays referendum to leave the European Union will have vast consequences for Britain, for Europe and for the world. For a day, the British people were the government, and by 52 percent to 48 percent, they took the decision to go.

title: David Camerons Luck Runs Out, Leaving Conservatives in Limbo
description: LONDON  The referendum initiated by Prime Minister David Cameron on Britains membership in the European Union was a gamble too far, even for a leader renowned for his luck. His stunning defeat on Friday not only cost him his job and sent shock waves through Britain, Europe and the world, but also failed at the very thing he risked so much for: to end the fight for the soul of his Conservative Party.

title: Review: Chasing Wildness, and Sometimes Catching It
description: NEW HAVEN  When Wendy Whelan, the former New York City Ballet principal, unveiled Restless Creature in 2013, the best thing about it was her duet with Brian Brooks. The project included four duets by and with four contemporary choreographers who nudged Ms. Whelan in new directions after her nearly 30 years as a ballerina. Mr. Brooks, compact beside Ms. Whelans sinewy length, drew out a dancer we hadnt seen, while not obscuring her cool, crystalline allure. (Perhaps not coincidentally, his work has become increasingly in demand.)

title: Review: A Maudlin Trip Down the Amazon, With a Star in Disguise
description: Opera fans live for the moments when a big-voiced singer fills a soaring melody with raw emotion and thrilling sound. But theres a limit: Daniel Catns opera Florencia en el Amazonas (Florencia in the Amazon) is made up almost entirely of effusive melodic lines.

title: Bound to Challenge
description: In the age of Snapchat and Instagram, Jonna Twigg sees books like the ones she sells as a place for words and images that are private, intimate, intentional.

title: Between Two Covers at Twiggs Bindery: You
description: Not everything belongs in the cloud.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: George Lucas Abandons Plan to Build Art Museum in Chicago
description: CHICAGO  The filmmaker George Lucas has scrapped his plan to bring a museum of narrative art to Chicagos lakefront, stymied by a lawsuit from a small but determined local preservation group.

title: Where Bodies Get Slammed in the Bronx
description: On the first Saturday of each month, those so inclined go to Daros Extreme Fitness in Soundview for the Bronx Wrestling Federations brand of family-oriented ultraviolence.

title: Family-Oriented Mayhem in the Bronx
description: On the first Saturday of every month, residents of the Soundview section of the Bronx know where to go for a dose of body-slamming, eye-gouging, family-oriented mayhem: Daros Extreme Fitness, a gym where people don tights, boots and, often, handmade leather masks to do battle as part of the Bronx Wrestling Federation. Chairs will be swung. Garbage cans will be tossed. Muscles will be flexed. Children will be entertained. And on the right night, Fred R. Conrad, a longtime photographer for The New York Times, will capture it all on film.

title: From Cathedral or Saloon to Guitar
description: A block of charred wood wrapped in rope sat at the entrance of Rick Kellys guitar shop in the West Village. He carted it from the scorched site of the Serbian Orthodox cathedral destroyed in a fire in the Flatiron district last month.

title: How Sue Donoghue, Prospect Park Administrator, Spends Her Sundays
description: Life for Sue Donoghue revolves around Prospect Park. It is her backyard, her oasis and, lately, her workplace. Conveniently, the four-story house where she lives with her family in Park Slope is only a block away from that green space, considered by some to be the masterpiece of the landscape architects Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux. For almost two years, Ms. Donoghue, 51, has served as the official park administrator and the president of the Prospect Park Alliance, a nonprofit that works with the city to manage and maintain the 585-acre park. On Sundays, she spends at least part of the day in the park with her husband, Dmitri Nayduch, who is the director of fixed-income research at Loews Corporation, and their children, Seamus, 17; Ivan, 14; and Bridget, 13.

title: Some Early Signs of Brexit Upheaval
description: FRANKFURT  Only hours after Britain decided to leave the European Union, Emmanuel Lumineau cast his own remain vote  with his feet. Mr. Lumineau said he would move to Paris from London and take about 10 employees at his financial start-up with him.

title: Brexit Aftershocks: More Rifts in Europe, and in Britain, Too
description: LONDON  Britains startling decision to pull out of the European Union set off a cascade of aftershocks on Friday, costing Prime Minister David Cameron his job, plunging the financial markets into turmoil and leaving the countrys future in doubt.

title: Review: When Colors and Disciplines Dont Quite Match
description: Color, Josef Albers wrote in the introduction to his 1963 book, Interaction of Color, is the most relative medium in art. No one, in other words, sees the same hue the same way.

title: Energy Transfer Wins Ruling on Escaping Williams Deal
description: A Delaware judge ruled on Friday that the Dallas pipeline operator Energy Transfer Equity is entitled to terminate its $38 billion merger with the Williams Companies, culminating one of the most contentious cases of buyers remorse in recent memory.

title: In Donald Trumps Campaign, Self-Funding Isnt What It Seems
description: Donald Trump once promised to fund his own presidential campaign. Is the campaign instead funding Mr. Trump?

title: How Brexit Will Affect Travel to Europe
description: In the height of the summer travel season, Britain voted to exit the European Union, scrambling markets as well as the political picture. What happens in the aftermath of Brexit, as it is known, is far from clear, but American travelers heading abroad will see some immediate effects.

title: Review: Get No Kick From the Rockettes in New York Spectacular
description: Parents visiting Manhattan with their families, I implore you: Before arrival, formulate a plan of action in case you and the kids accidentally lose one another amid the dizzying urban whirl.

title: Review: At 53, an Effortless Return to Dance Romeo and Juliet
description: Alessandra Ferri, returning to the role of Juliet at 53, on Thursday, was recognizably the same dancer she was 10, 20, 30 years ago  and unmistakably different. The performance was of Kenneth MacMillans Romeo and Juliet, at the Metropolitan Opera House; the company was American Ballet Theater, with which Ms. Ferri, for over 20 years (1986-2007), enjoyed her greatest triumphs. Though she is an Italian who began her career in London, its here in New York that she has been most loved.

title: Pope Francis Condemns Genocide of Armenians Before Visit to Memorial
description: ROME  Pope Francis waded into turbulent geopolitical waters once again on Friday during his first visit to Armenia when he made an unscripted remark referring to the World War I-era massacre of an estimated 1.5 million Armenians by Ottoman Turks as a genocide.

title: Decision to Close Shuffle Along Is Debated Along Broadway
description: On Tuesday afternoon, more than a dozen members of the ensemble of Shuffle Along gathered at the Midtown Manhattan headquarters of Actors Equity, cradling trophies in the shape of gold stars as they were honored as the best chorus on Broadway.

title: European Union, Donald Trump, Bernie Sanders: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: At River to River, a Poetic, Postmodern Spin on an Old Art Form
description: Every performance risks failure. The Set Up actively courts it. For this series of works, the excellent New York dancer Wally Cardona takes a crash course with a master in an old and complex dance form, almost always from South or Southeast Asia. Then Mr. Cardona and Jennifer Lacey adapt, in their own purposely disorienting postmodern fashion, what he has learned  at best, an approximation  into a show.

title: Among Young Britons, Fear and Despair Over Vote to Leave E.U.
description: LONDON  As the bands played on at the Glastonbury music festival in Somerset, England, Lewis Phillips and his friends drowned their sorrows in song and alcohol.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Hope Hicks: The Woman Who Totally Understands Donald Trump
description: Update, Feb. 28, 2018: Hope Hicks announced that she was resigning as White House communications director. For the latest updates and further coverage, read here.

title: How the Brexit News Made the Front Page
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: Scottish Voices Against British Vote
description: Demonstrators took to the streets of Edinburgh to protest Britains vote to leave the European Union.

title: Hearing Shows Little Is Known on Who Controls Viacom
description: Wednesdays Delaware court hearing on whether Sumner M. Redstones National Amusements appropriately removed five Viacom directors highlights that not only will this matter drag on, but that investors still know very little about the arrangements governing Viacom and CBS.

title: Bernie Worrell, Whose Keyboards Left an Imprint on Funk and Hip-Hop, Dies at 72
description: Bernie Worrell, the keyboardist whose anarchic solos and Moog synthesizer bass lines with Parliament-Funkadelic indelibly changed the sound of funk and hip-hop, died on Friday at his home in Everson, Wash. He was 72.

title: Abbas Retracts Claim That Israeli Rabbis Called for Poisoning Water
description: JERUSALEM  A little more than a day after President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority accused rabbis in Israel of calling for their government to poison the water used by Palestinians, he retracted the allegation in a statement on Saturday, saying it had become evident that it was baseless.

title: In Freddie Gray Trials, Baltimore Judge Sets High Bar for Prosecution
description: BALTIMORE  Barry G. Williams knows how to make a strong case against a police officer. He spent eight years working for the civil rights division of the Justice Department, where he investigated, tried and convicted officers accused of brutality and civil rights violations.

title: Pentagon Set to Lift Ban on Transgender People Serving in U.S. Military
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon next month will announce the repeal of a policy banning transgender people from serving openly in the military, Defense Department officials said on Friday, moving to end what has widely been seen as one of the last barriers to service.

title: Affirmative Action Isnt Just a Legal Issue. Its Also a Historical One.
description: THE Supreme Courts decision this week in Fisher v. University of Texas is a profound relief, and a cause for celebration among those of us in higher education who have long insisted that affirmative action is vital to our schools missions and to society as a whole.

title: Brexit Talk on Social Media Favored the Leave Side
description: Anyone trying to explain Britains decision to exit the European Union must consider the countrys economy, its citizens attitudes toward immigration, its generational divides and the coverage of the debate in the news media.

title: West Virginia Floods Cause 23 Deaths and Vast Wreckage
description: Record flooding in West Virginia killed at least 23 people, stranded thousands, left thousands more without utilities, and washed away houses, roads and vehicles after a band of thunderstorms battered the region on Thursday.

title: Who Blames the Victim?
description: IF you are mugged on a midnight stroll through the park, some people will feel compassion for you, while others will admonish you for being there in the first place. If you are raped by an acquaintance after getting drunk at a party, some will be moved by your misfortune, while others will ask why you put yourself in such a situation.

title: Scottish Protest to Trump Development
description: Donald J. Trump took a break from campaigning to open his newest golf course in Scotland. While he projected success despite economic woes in Britain, opposition has flared up.

title: In Immigration Fight, Asians Work to Be Heard
description: As immigration activists gathered in Lower Manhattan on Friday afternoon, chanting in Spanish to denounce the Supreme Court deadlock that effectively shut down President Obamas program of deportation relief, a group of eight advocates stood quietly in the back.

title: Its Americas Future, and They Want In
description: Its a rainy Thursday morning, a little after 8, on the sidewalk below the United States Supreme Court. A group of immigrant activists and organizers, mostly young, mostly Latino, stands in a circle, playing a pass-the-hot-potato game. Its a little bonding exercise to pass the hours. Its sticky hot and people are soaked, laughing and, without saying it, feeling unbearably tense.

title: Low-Priority Immigrants Still Swept Up in Net of Deportation
description: WASHINGTON  Three agents knocked on the door of a modest duplex in a Wisconsin town just after dawn. The Mexican immigrant living on the ground floor stuck his head out

title: After Brexit Vote, Investors Are Gripped by a Panic Last Seen in 2008
description: LONDON  First came the shock. Then fear seized world markets. As frenzied selling accelerated in Tokyo, Hong Kong and London, unfathomable amounts of wealth vanished in a matter of hours.

title: American Anxieties, Mirrored in Britain
description: Many of the same economic grievances and anxieties that have surfaced in the American electorate this year appear to have played an important role in Britains decision on Thursday to leave the European Union.

title: Many Draft Prospects Have N.H.L. in Their DNA
description: BUFFALO  Matthew Tkachuk stepped off the ice at HarborCenter, where he and other top N.H.L. prospects were conducting a skills clinic for squirt-age players, and recalled his own youth hockey days.

title: Tax Dodging on the High Seas
description: Lets criticize cruise ships.

title: Cuomo Expands H.I.V. Benefits in New York City
description: Thousands of New York City residents who are H.I.V.-positive will become eligible for public assistance for housing, transportation and food under a significant expansion of a state program that some activists had feared was being delayed.

title: Mets End Skid Against Braves and Ponder Reunion with Jose Reyes
description: ATLANTA  A day before Jose Reyes was expected to become a free agent, Mets Manager Terry Collins could not help himself. Asked about Reyes, an All-Star shortstop when he was with the Mets, Collins admitted that there had been discussions about how to use him should he re-sign with the team.

title: Is Brexit the Precursor to a Donald Trump Presidency? Not So Fast
description: WASHINGTON  Britains vote to withdraw from the European Union sent a shudder through the capital on Friday as the forces of economic nationalism and working-class fury forced American political leaders to wonder: Could it happen here?

title: Yankees Beat Twins and Climb Back to .500 As Teixeiras Return Looms
description: Rob Refsnyder has been using Dustin Ackleys first basemans glove for the past few weeks while he breaks in one of his own.

title: Muhammad Alis Final Ride
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  The first rose landed on the windshield of the hearse not long after the procession began on Bardstown Road.

title: Goro Hasegawa, Creator of Othello Board Game, Dies at 83
description: Goro Hasegawa, who is widely credited with creating the board game Othello, which has sold tens of million of copies around the world since its introduction in the 1970s, died on June 20 in Japan. He was 83.

title: Derrick Rose Expects to Be Appreciated a Little Bit More as a Knick
description: Derrick Rose was halfway through a news conference Friday afternoon at Madison Square Garden when he was asked if he could guess why the Chicago Bulls  his hometown team, the franchise that picked him first over all eight years ago  had been so willing to trade him to the Knicks.

title: For Players Who Earn Little, Fall of the Pound Leaves a Big Hole
description: ROEHAMPTON, England  First, the rain fell. Hard. Then, the British pound fell. Harder.

title: As a Swimming Spectacle Grows, So Does the Opportunity
description: OMAHA  Ask Caeleb Dressel what he remembers about the 2012 United States Olympic swimming trials, and hell talk about the spectacle: the tongues of fire on both sides of the pool and the rainbow waterfall from which each new Olympian rose on a platform like a red-white-and-blue apparition. He prefers to forget his performance in the pool: a tie for 145th, out of 167 finishers, in the 50-meter freestyle.

title: Point of Computer Technology
description: Will Shortz Sighting Alert! Will Shortz and Kai Zhang, the table tennis prodigy, will be featured on ESPNs SportCenter on Sunday, June 26 at 10:00 a.m. ET and 11:00 p.m. ET. You can watch a teaser here.

title: Michael Herr, Author of a Vietnam Classic, Dies at 76
description: Michael Herr, who wrote Dispatches, a glaringly intense, personal account of being a correspondent in Vietnam that is widely viewed as one of the most visceral and persuasive depictions of the unearthly experience of war, died on Thursday at a hospital near his home in Delaware County, N.Y. He was 76.

title: City Failed to Test for Lead in Water at Day Care Centers, Audit Says
description: The New York City department charged with overseeing day care centers routinely failed to test the centers water for lead  and for years falsified reports that the tests had been completed, in order for the centers to receive operating permits  according to a sharply worded audit released on Friday by the city comptroller, Scott M. Stringer.

title: Killer in Gang Gets 50 Years to Life, and a Dose of Mercy as Well
description: A deadly run of gang violence that has brought heartbreak to two Harlem families came to an unlikely culmination in a Manhattan courtroom.

title: Kansas Lawmakers Pass Bill in Bid to Stop Court From Closing Schools
description: Kansas lawmakers passed an education funding bill on Friday night in a move they hope will stop the State Supreme Court from carrying out its threat to close public schools by next week.

title: Lawyer Suggests in Accidental Message That Manziel Will Seek Plea Deal
description: A lawyer handling Johnny Manziels domestic violence case expressed doubts about the Heisman Trophy-winning quarterbacks ability to stay clean and said he was given a receipt that indicated Manziel may have spent more than $1,000 at a Dallas drug paraphernalia store just 15 hours after he was involved in a hit-and-run crash, according to a lengthy text message accidentally sent to The Associated Press.

title: Corrections: June 25, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Dare to dream that the dawn is breaking on an independent United Kingdom.

title: Beauty Is Not Welcome Here
description: The Worlds Ugliest Dog contest, held in Petaluma, Calif., attracted frightfully lovable animals (and their owners) from across the country. A wrinkled Chinese crested Chihuahua named Sweepee Rambo won.

title: Here She Is: The Ugliest Dog in the World (2016)
description: In the Worlds Ugliest Dog Contest, where there were more beasts than beauties, it was hard to beat a wrinkled, wispy-haired, bony Chinese crested Chihuahua named Sweepee Rambo.

title: Bending Elbows After Brexit
description: Feelings of shock and anxiety were prevalent during happy hour on Wall Street.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: Charlotte Rampling, in an Oscar-nominated role, plays a wife forced to view her husband in a new light during Andrew Haighs exquisite 45 Years. In Center Stage: On Pointe, modern dance is served with a side of cheese. And Harvey Fierstein and The Advocate receive Trailblazer Honors.

title: Ordinary British People Refused to Be Cowed
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: European Leaders Tell a Dazed Britain to Get Going on Brexit
description: LONDON  With British politics in turmoil, there were already clear indications on Saturday of a tense and bickering divorce from the European Union.

title: Dawn of the Virtual Assistant
description: You dont hear many people bellyaching about the servant problem these days.

title: A Literary Bromance, Now in Its Sixth Decade
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The poet Lawrence Ferlinghetti was sitting at his kitchen table in his North Beach apartment on a drizzly morning, telling a story about Allen Ginsberg, when he hopped up suddenly and bounded out of the room to retrieve his hearing aid.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took Instagram followers from sunrise in Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, to sunset in southern China.

title: A Primer on Private Equity
description: Private equity firms, once known as corporate raiders, are now huge, influential and everywhere in everyday American life. In a series of stories, we chronicle private equitys ascendance, and some of the problems it has caused. (Read the first part )

title: When You Dial 911 and Wall Street Answers
description: A Tennessee woman slipped into a coma and died after an ambulance company took so long to assemble a crew that one worker had time for a cigarette break.

title: Sacai: Spring 2017
description: Chitose Abes spring 2017 collection.

title: What Can Go Wrong When Private Equity Takes Over a Public Service
description: TransCare, an ambulance company owned by a private equity firm, recently went out of business. We obtained internal emails and minutes of executive meetings that lay bare the companys final year and its ultimate demise.

title: Brexit in America: A Warning Shot Against Globalization
description: When the mills that birthed the industrial revolution in cities like Manchester and Birmingham still powered the British economy of the mid-20th century, Robert Stevenson was a frequent visitor to the Midlands.

title: A Little Variety
description: A LITTLE VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: Are Apples Headphone Jacks the New Floppy Drive?
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Trump Packs His Blunt Phrase Book Abroad
description: When Mitt Romney traveled to Europe as a presidential candidate in 2012, he created an uproar when he wondered aloud whether London was sufficiently prepared to host the Summer Olympics. British tabloids derided him as Mitt the Twit and CNN declared: Romneys Trip Begins in Shambles.

title: Kenzo: Spring 2017
description: The labels spring 2017 mens collections.

title: After Brexit, 3 Centuries of Unity in Britain Are in Danger
description: WASHINGTON  When people discuss the stakes of Britains decision to leave the European Union, they often talk about implications for the European project, the continuing post-World War II effort to unify the Continent politically and economically. But within hours of the polls closing on Thursday, it appeared that something much more basic could be at risk: Britain as a multinational state.

title: Who Pays for Air-Conditioning Repairs in Rentals?
description: My partner and I rent a market-rate apartment with a built-in heating and air-conditioning unit, but the air-conditioning component does not work. An air-conditioner repairman told us that the unit is 20 years old, rusted, and will likely start leaking into our apartment and the one below us if it is not replaced. He said replacing it would cost $1,800. The landlord refuses to replace the unit, saying he is not responsible for air-conditioning, only heat. Our apartment will be unbearable this summer without air-conditioning. Who is responsible?

title: Fear of Zika Virus Is Putting a Damper on Destination Weddings
description: Fear, if not the reality of the Zika virus and the mosquitoes that carry it, has not only cast its shadow on the Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro in August, but is upending the carefully laid plans of couples who have long wanted a wedding in an exotic tropical locale.

title: David Camerons Brexit Bust
description: London  FOR a sense of how historically important Thursdays referendum result in Britain is, consider the following. The last time British voters were formally consulted on continued membership of what was then called the Common Market, in 1975, mainstream politicians of the major parties joined forces with experts and establishment figures to persuade Britons that leaving was too great a risk. The In campaign prevailed.

title: Mens Fashion Shows: Comme Des Garons Homme Plus, Junya Watanabe Man, Hood By Air and Berluti
description: A photo diary of the spring/summer 2017 collections which were presented in Paris on Friday.

title: In Search of the Felon-Friendly Workplace
description: ST. LOUIS  Rick Plowmans business, installing suspended ceilings in offices, schools and hotels, could use new blood. But hiring is tough, he tells the man sitting in his office. The 20-somethings he sees havent had the work ethic, havent had the hustle.

title: Explosion at Hotel in Mogadishu
description: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle at the gate of the Somalia hotel. A second explosion was heard inside the hotel as gunmen fought their way in, the police said Saturday.

title: Billionaire Lists Are Battling to Feed a Hunger for Rankings
description: Never before have we had so much information about the worlds billionaires.

title: A Patagonia Gear Developer Whos Saving Lives in the Big Surf
description: Andrew Reinhart, 30, is a surf product developer at Patagonia in Ventura, Calif.

title: China-Led Development Bank Starts With $509 Million in Loans for 4 Projects
description: BEIJING  A new Chinese-led international development bank announced its first four loans on Saturday, pledging to lend $509 million for projects to spread electric power in rural Bangladesh, upgrade living conditions in slums in Indonesia, and improve roads in Pakistan and Tajikistan.

title: At King Arthur Flour, Savoring the Perks of Employee Ownership
description: Last month, a recipe for lemon cake filled with pastry cream and lemon curd spread quickly on Facebook, garnering 6,200 shares and 9,900 likes. Of the 300-plus commenters, some had followed the recipe and were displaying photos of their frosted creations, while others asked baking questions or inquired about dairy- and gluten-free versions of the recipe. Another contingent was just plain hungry. I need a piece of that cake right now, one person wrote.

title: Dior Homme: Spring 2017
description: Kris Van Assches spring 2017 looks for men.

title: Arizona Scraps Use of Sedative for Lethal Injections
description: PHOENIX (AP)  Arizona has eliminated its use of the sedative midazolam as one of the drugs it relies on in carrying out executions.

title: Variety Puzzle: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  In evolutionary biologist Beth Shapiros How to Clone a Mammoth, a scientific road map is presented for de-extinction, a process in which a close relative of an extinct animal is outfitted, through a mix of cloning and selective breeding, with what it needs to survive in todays environment. I have no idea how viable this is, but its an exciting idea.

title: As Novak Djokovic Shines, Boris Becker Basks in a Rediscovered Glory at His Side
description: WIMBLEDON, England  An underwhelming television analyst, Boris Becker has turned out to be quite successful at analyzing what makes Novak Djokovic tick.

title: Artificial Intelligences White Guy Problem
description: ACCORDING to some prominent voices in the tech world, artificial intelligence presents a looming existential threat to humanity: Warnings by luminaries like Elon Musk and Nick Bostrom about the singularity  when machines become smarter than humans  have attracted millions of dollars and spawned a multitude of conferences.

title: The Secret Power Behind Local Elections
description: WHEN the history of elections in 2016 is written, one of the central points is likely to be how little voters knew about the donors who influenced the contests. At the federal level, dark money groups  chiefly social welfare nonprofits and trade associations that arent required to disclose their donors and, thanks to the Supreme Courts Citizens United ruling, can spend unlimited amounts on political advertising  have spent three times more in this election than they did at a comparable point in 2012.

title: Wimbledon: Six Rising Stars Who Could Make a Run on the Grass
description: Beyond the favorites, here are six players who have the skills to succeed at Wimbledon, which begins Monday.

title: Brexit Revolt Casts a Shadow Over Hillary Clintons Cautious Path
description: For Hillary Clinton, Britains emotionally charged uprising against the European Union is the sort of populist victory over establishment politics that she fears in the coming presidential election.

title: Lawyers in a Lurch
description: The Law School Bust (June 19) by Noam Scheiber looked at the increasing cost of law school, which has left some graduates with large debts at a time that employment prospects have dimmed. The law school at Valparaiso University in Indiana, a focus of the article, has offered buyouts to faculty members and plans to reduce its student body by about a third.

title: China Suspends Diplomatic Contact With Taiwan
description: BEIJING  In a sign of growing friction between China and Taiwan, mainland diplomats said Saturday that they had suspended contact with their Taiwanese counterparts because the islands new leader would not endorse the idea of a single Chinese nation.

title: West Virginia Appeals for Help After Deadly and Destructive Floods
description: The governor of West Virginia requested federal assistance on Saturday to help the state deal with the record flooding that has cut a wide path of destruction across a sector of the state and led to the deaths of at least 24 people.

title: At Dads Knee as Cleveland Fell and Fell and Then ...
description: CLEVELAND  About 92 hours had passed since the city secured its first major professional championship in 52 years, and here we were sitting together at Progressive Field, waiting for the Indians game to start and basking in the glow of a scoreboard that read, Cleveland Cavaliers 2016 NBA Champions.

title: A Biblical Ark for the Secular Age
description: An enormous model of Noahs ark is rising in Kentucky. Ken Ham, the man behind it, wants to use the boat to promote his belief in "young earth" creationism.

title: A Young Cancer Survivor Scolds Donald Trump
description: A new digital ad campaign from Priorities USA, a super PAC supporting Hillary Clinton, equates fighting bigotry with stopping the presidential candidacy of Donald J. Trump. Priorities is spending $500,000  a large amount for an online ad  on the first commercial, Dante, which portrays Mr. Trump as biased against the disabled.

title: Kanye Wests Latest Provocation: Lying Naked Next to Taylor Swift in Famous Video
description: In his latest meant-to-shock music video, Kanye West puts himself and his wife, Kim Kardashian West, in a special breed of rarefied company. Splayed out on a huge bed, the couple  or realistic figures in their likenesses  are surrounded by nude depictions of family (Caitlyn Jenner), former flames (Ray J, Amber Rose), friends and colleagues (Rihanna, Chris Brown, Anna Wintour) and some of this eras most polarizing men (Donald J. Trump, George W. Bush, Bill Cosby).

title: Lets See How Sixers Process Plays Out
description: As the Mets pitched their way to a World Series appearance last year, the name Omar Minaya kept coming up. He may have been fired in 2010, but moves he had made were largely responsible for the teams talented young roster.

title: A Born-Again Donald Trump? Believe It, Evangelical Leader Says
description: Has Donald J. Trump become a born-again Christian?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To Preserve a Sport, More Power to the Players

title: After an Eventful Day, the Mets Slip Past the Braves
description: ATLANTA  The Mets sputtering offense was transformed last summer through trades, the return of injured players and the promotion of a top outfield prospect. Before Saturdays 1-0 win in 11 innings over the Atlanta Braves at Turner Field, the Mets made three moves that they hope can again enliven their slumping lineup into one with playoff potential.

title: Gov. Christies Toxic School Plan
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey is using the worst kind of demagogy to distract attention from his sagging poll numbers and burnish his reputation as a Trump-style Republican. Thats the only way to view his deeply irresponsible proposal for stripping New Jerseys poorest communities of desperately needed education aid to fund property tax cuts for well-heeled suburbanites.

title: Ban Animal Use in Military Medical Training
description: For years, People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals has been waging a guerrilla war against the Pentagon over its use of live goats and pigs to train combat medics. Their primary tactic: obtaining footage of training sessions to expose the barbarity of a practice thats cruel and unnecessary.

title: Why Im Choosing to Become an Irish Citizen
description: LONDON  BREAKING up is never easy. But how do you break up with a country?

title: Uzo Aduba
description: Uzoamaka Aduba, known as Uzo, is an Emmy Award-winning actress and classically trained vocalist best known for her role as Suzanne Warren, a.k.a. Crazy Eyes, in the Netflix series Orange Is the New Black.

title: Going Dirty
description: OVER the course of the past two months, Donald J. Trump has assailed Hillary Clinton as a world-class liar, suggested that she had a role in the death of a White House aide while Bill Clinton was president, darkly referenced Mr. Clintons marital affairs and said  in a 41-minute rip of a speech on Tuesday  that Mrs. Clinton had perfected the politics of personal profit and theft. Once again, the nation seems to be marching toward another brutally nasty presidential campaign, with Mr. Trump leading the parade.

title: 20-Something, With Menopause
description: CANCER aged me.

title: A Letter From the Edge of the Abyss
description: FATHER warned in his first letter, which we received in 1993, that no one should learn of the correspondence he had sent  or else, he wrote, I will fall into a bottomless abyss. I would prefer to die under torture than give the names of those who have delivered this letter.

title: Can You Get Over an Addiction?
description: I SHOT heroin and cocaine while attending Columbia in the 1980s, sometimes injecting many times a day and leaving scars that are still visible. I kept using, even after I was suspended from school, after I overdosed and even after I was arrested for dealing, despite knowing that this could reduce my chances of staying out of prison.

title: Hell Is Other Britons
description: ALRESFORD, England  IN summer, the land around Alresford, the rural market town in the south of England where I grew up, blooms in a way that seems almost terrible.

title: Obamas Death Sentence for Young Refugees
description: ON THE GUATEMALAN-MEXICAN BORDER  CRISTBAL, a 16-year-old Honduran refugee fleeing a drug gang that wants to kill him, has never heard of anyone named Barack Obama. Neither can he name the Mexican president, Enrique Pea Nieto.

title: The Security Consequences of Brexit
description: Apart from creating economic turmoil, Britains calamitous vote to leave the European Union could have no less profound foreign policy consequences, weakening the interlocking web of Western institutions and alliances that have helped guarantee international peace and stability for 70 years.

title: Dont Ban Photos of Skinny Models
description: ITS been another big month for talking about womens bodies.

title: The Bad Faith of the White Working Class
description: I THINK I was 11 when, teary-eyed and exhausted, I asked my grandmother whether God loved us. It had been an unusually terrible day for my sister and me. Our mother had called us worthless, threatened us, and then nearly crashed our car during a violent outburst. Things like this happened often in my family and among my friends, but not all on the same day.

title: 14 Young Democrats to Watch
description: A gray-haired party with a shallow bench? Thats the rap. The reality is this group of rising stars.

title: The Supreme Courts Silent Failure on Immigration
description: THE Supreme Court has never won medals for transparency. After a case is argued, it vanishes into a black box, often for months, until an opinion emerges one morning without prior warning. The justices reject thousands of appeals every year without a word of explanation beyond denied.

title: Out of Prison, Pitcher Relishes a Second Chance With the Rangers
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  When Doug Brocail meets with Matt Bush during a game, he finds a pitcher completely at ease with his surroundings. The mound is where Bush finds peace.

title: Was the Orlando Gunman Gay? The Answer Continues to Elude the F.B.I.
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  After news media reports suggested that the man who carried out the massacre at a gay nightclub here may have himself been gay, the company that bills itself as the worlds largest gay hookup site put out what amounted to a distress call, asking members who may have been in contact with the gunman, Omar Mateen, to come forward.

title: Balmain: Spring 2017
description: Olivier Rousteings spring designs for men.

title: Jack Daniels Embraces a Hidden Ingredient: Help From a Slave
description: LYNCHBURG, Tenn.  Every year, about 275,000 people tour the Jack Daniels distillery here, and as they stroll through its brick buildings nestled in a tree-shaded hollow, they hear a story like this: Sometime in the 1850s, when Daniel was a boy, he went to work for a preacher, grocer and distiller named Dan Call. The preacher was a busy man, and when he saw promise in young Jack, he taught him how to run his whiskey still  and the rest is history.

title: Argentina Seeks to Conjure Away Its Tournament Demons
description: It seems remarkable  given its perpetually deep well of talented players, its longstanding global cachet, and the sheer number of international soccer competitions  that Argentina has not won a major soccer tournament since 1993. That is not to say there have not been chances; Argentina has lost major finals the past two summers. The teams next chance comes Sunday, in the final of the Copa Amrica Centenario in East Rutherford, N.J.

title: French Photographers Woe Turns to Joy After a Collective Effort
description: PARIS  It was the first Sunday of the Miami Open in March, and the French photographer Corinne Dubreuil left the media workroom to eat a quick lunch.

title: What to Do About Guns? John Lewis Revives Civil Rights Tactic
description: ATLANTA  The mural of Representative John Lewis, Democrat of Georgia, looms seven stories high over Auburn Avenue, the storied center of black life here during the days of segregation. Above Mr. Lewiss blocky, instantly recognizable head is a single word: HERO.

title: At College World Series, Difficult Ballpark Is Negating a High-Flying Ball
description: OMAHA  Coastal Carolina, known for its elegant, Chaucer-inspired nickname, slugged its way to its first College World Series. The Chanticleers hit 94 home runs, the most in Division I, reflecting the coziness of a renovated home stadium as much as the flatter-seam baseball the N.C.A.A. introduced last season. The ball, which flies farther than the old one, increased scoring nationwide.

title: Britain Rattles Postwar Order and Its Place as Pillar of Stability
description: LONDON  Britains historic vote to leave the European Union is already threatening to unravel a democratic bloc of nations that has coexisted peacefully together for decades. But it is also generating uncertainty about an even bigger issue: Is the post-1945 order imposed on the world by the United States and its allies unraveling, too?

title: Dear Hillary Clinton: Readers Advice on Your V.P.
description: Elizabeth Warren was the clear favorite, followed by the current V.P., Joe Biden, and Sherrod Brown. Several readers urged her to pick a moderate Republican.

title: Yankees Top Twins in Mark Teixeiras Return
description: With one of the few payrolls in baseball exceeding $200 million, patience is nearly a vice to the Yankees.

title: Islamist Militants Storm Hotel in Somalia, Killing at Least 6
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Islamist militants stormed a hotel in central Mogadishu, Somalias capital, on Saturday afternoon, killing at least six people in what has become a well-established tactic to sow terror.

title: Milos Raonic Enlists Two High-Profile Coaches, John McEnroe and Carlos Moya, to Raise His Game
description: At 25, Milos Raonic of Canada has yet to advance past the semifinals of a Grand Slam tournament. But he has surrounded himself with champions. At Wimbledon, where he reached the final four in 2014, he will be taking the super-coach trend this week to a new level by working with two former No. 1 singles players simultaneously: Carlos Moya and John McEnroe.

title: Marijuana Use Rises in Iran, With Little Interference
description: TEHRAN  At the Tehran party there was alcohol, of course, though it was a quiet affair, nothing like the wild, over-the-top events of urban legend. People just sat at a table, sipping drinks and talking as they would in many places across the world. After a while, someone made a phone call, and a few minutes later the doorbell rang and in walked a nondescript-looking man getting on in years.

title: Frank Chapot, Olympic Show Jumper and Mainstay of the Sport, Dies at 84
description: Frank Chapot, a two-time Olympic silver medalist who as competitor and coach was a mainstay of United States show jumping for half a century, died on Monday in Bound Brook, N.J. He was 84.

title: Herms: Spring 2017
description: Vronique Nichanians spring 2017 collection for men.

title: In the Life of Bill Cunningham
description: Mr. Cunningham preferred to be a spectator, not a spectacle, but he got his fair share of attention.

title: Africas Charcoal Economy Is Cooking. The Trees Are Paying.
description: TOLIARA, Madagascar  When Julien Andrianiana started selling charcoal 14 years ago, he was just one of a few dealers around. Most households in Toliara, a coastal city in southwestern Madagascar, still used firewood for cooking.

title: Bill Cunningham on Bill Cunningham
description: This article was first published in 2002. The author, a longtime Times photographer, died on Saturday.

title: Bill Cunningham, Legendary Times Fashion Photographer, Dies at 87
description: Bill Cunningham, who turned fashion photography into his own branch of cultural anthropology on the streets of New York, chronicling an eras ever-changing social scene for The New York Times by training his busily observant lens on what people wore  stylishly, flamboyantly or just plain sensibly  died on Saturday in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: What It Was Like to Be Photographed by Bill Cunningham
description: This article was first published in 2002.

title: An Own Goal by Northern Ireland Gives Wales a Victory
description: PARIS  It is soccers cruel and unusual punishment, a fate as embarrassing as it is emasculating. The own goal  or o.g., as it is often recorded in the match report  is brutal enough during a regular match on a regular day. But in a crucible like Saturdays round of 16 match at the European Championships, it is, quite simply, mortifying.

title: George Will Leaves the G.O.P. Over Donald Trump
description: George F. Will, a conservative columnist and prominent Republican pundit for the past 40 years, said he has left the Republican Party because Donald J. Trump is the partys presumptive presidential nominee.

title: Jose Reyes Returns to the Mets, Baggage and All
description: When Jose Reyes left the Mets after the 2011 season, the parting seemed inevitable. The Mets were in the midst of a tear-down induced by the Bernard L. Madoff scandal, and although Reyes won the National League batting title that season, the principal owner Fred Wilpon had already declared that he would not pay him Carl Crawford money.

title: Sports Page Headlines
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Another debut today! Its nice to see so many new bylines, and all three of this weeks debuts were by women. Since there are far more men making puzzles than women, I consider this to be a good weeks work.

title: New Jersey Boy, 4, Is Fatally Shot by His 6-Year-Old Brother
description: A 4-year-old boy was fatally shot by his 6-year-old brother in East Orange, N.J., on Saturday, the authorities said.

title: Donald Trump, Over 18 Holes in Scotland, Plays 20 Questions
description: BALMEDIE, Scotland  On the 10th hole of his golf resort here, Donald J. Trump  asked if defeating Hillary Clinton in November was more of a par-3 or a par-5  said it would be very easy. And on the 18th, when asked if he had more or fewer candidates on his vice-presidential short list than the par of the hole (a five), Mr. Trump allowed, Im getting calls from a lot of people, and they want it.

title: Share Your Memories of Bill Cunningham
description: Have you ever spotted Bill Cunningham photographing street style? Did he take your photo?

title: Were an Easy Target: Taken In by the Trump Brand
description: The sales pitches seeking to separate Cheryl Lankford from her money began during the recession as she struggled to get back on her feet after the death of her husband, an American soldier serving in Iraq.

title: Pope Francis to Armenians: Seek Peace, but Never Forget Genocide
description: ROME  Pope Francis on Saturday said that the world should never forget the suffering of the more than one million Armenians who were massacred a century ago during the final years of the Ottoman Empire, lest it fall back into the maelstrom of similar horrors.

title: After Draft, Rangers Turn Their Attention to Deals and Free Agency
description: BUFFALO  The Rangers, without a pick in the first two rounds of the N.H.L. entry draft, made six selections on Day 2 and acquired Colorado defenseman Nick Holden.

title: Youth Hockeys Growth in U.S. Reaches First Round of the N.H.L. Draft
description: BUFFALO  Brian Burkes hockey memory is longer than his distinctive white hair, which he wore swept behind his ears at the N.H.L. draft this weekend.

title: For Newly Minted Grand Slam Champions, Bar Is Raised at Wimbledon
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Garbie Muguruza insisted that nothing had changed.

title: Mourning the Death of Bill Cunningham
description: On Saturday afternoon, the legendary fashion photographer Bill Cunningham died in Manhattan at age 87. Shielded from the elements by a simple blue coat and with a camera always in his hand, Mr. Cunningham was a fixture on the streets of New York City and in the front rows of fashions most prestigious shows. Many took to Twitter to mourn the loss of Mr. Cunningham and to honor the man for whom everybody dressed  even Anna Wintour, the editor in chief of Vogue.

title: Bill Cunninghams Wide Range of Fashion Photography
description: With a sharp eye, Mr. Cunningham captured the kooky, the stylish, the adventurous, the cutting edge and everything in between.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its not that this, in and of itself, will completely destroy the international order. But it sets a precedent. It is potentially corrosive.

title: Bill Cunninghams Wide Range of Fashion Photography
description: With a sharp eye, Mr. Cunningham captured the kooky, the stylish, the adventurous, the cutting edge and everything in between.

title: Outlander Season 2, Episode 12: Deal With the Devil
description: At what point does loyalty become a liability?

title: Indias Brexit Took More Than a Referendum
description: MUMBAI, India  It has been almost 70 years since Britain exited India.

title: On the Street, In the Archives
description: The intrepid "On the Street" fashion photographer Bill Cunningham wears more than one hat.

title: Russian Track Athletes File for Olympic Exemption
description: The Russian sports minister, Vitaly Mutko, said up to 67 athletes had applied to the International Association of Athletics Federations, track and fields world governing body, for exemption from the ban on the Russian team at the Rio Olympics.

title: Whats on TV Sunday
description: Cameron Crowe starts in a place of love and familiarity  then loses control  in Roadies. The BET Awards remember Prince. And Game of Thrones devotes more time than ever to its season finale.

title: A Noahs Ark in Kentucky, Dinosaurs Included
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Ky.  In the beginning, Ken Ham made the Creation Museum in northern Kentucky. And he saw that it was good at spreading his belief that the Bible is a book of history, the universe is only 6,000 years old, and evolution is wrong and is leading to our moral downfall.

title: Fractures From Brexit Vote Spread Into Opposition Labour Party
description: LONDON  Britains political crisis intensified on Sunday after its decision to leave the European Union, with the opposition Labour Party splitting into warring camps, Scotlands leader suggesting that its local Parliament might try to block the departure and many Britons wondering if there was a plausible way for the nation to reconsider its drastic choice.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: European Union, Copa America, Donald Trump: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Tough Choices and Hard Lessons for E.U. After Brexit Vote
description: LONDON  The crisis ritual that will play out this week in Europe is all too familiar: Markets will gyrate. National leaders will huddle. A summit meeting in Brussels will extend deep into the night.

title: Lanvin: Spring 2017
description: The labels spring mens looks for 2017.

title: Chinese Activist Chen Yunfei Is to Stand Trial, Lawyer Says
description: BEIJING  A longtime political activist and artist who has been detained for more than a year in China after visiting the grave site of a victim of the violent Tiananmen Square crackdown in 1989 is expected to stand trial on Thursday, according to his lawyer.

title: Donald Trump and R.N.C. Crack Down on Rebelling Delegates
description: The Trump campaign and the Republican National Committee are moving quickly and aggressively to head off the fledgling effort to stage a revolt at their convention next month in Cleveland, hoping to spare the party an embarrassing spectacle that could deeply wound the presumptive nominee.

title: A Pioneering Break Dancer Returns to Battle
description: Rich Colon is 50 years old, an age when thoughts of mortality creep into mens minds and invitations to join AARP start appearing in their mailboxes. Faced with midlife crises, some men buy sports cars, join the Hair Club or start to prowl nightclubs. Mr. Colon has taken a different approach: He is going to St. Petersburg, Russia, for a dance-off on Friday against Storm, a German break dancer, in what is being called the Battle of the Gods.

title: Against Eurotimidity
description: Im on vacation, but want to take a minute to react to this new consensus piece on shoring up the eurozone from Voxeu. The authors really are the best and brightest, economists who have been superb guides to the crisis and in some cases have made material contributions to solving or at least dealing with it. So Id really like to say nice things.

title: Mens Fashion Shows: Dior Homme, Herms and Sacai
description: A photo diary of the spring/summer 2017 collections which were presented in Paris on Saturday.

title: 1891: A Platonic Strike in Paris
description: Paris was agreeably surprised to find yesterday morning that its daily bread had been baked as usual. The declaration of a general strike of the journeymen bakers made the previous evening proved to have been a platonic pronouncement, as the bakehouses from which the wonted amount of bread was not turned out were decidedly in a minority. However, the strike leaders are not yet disheartened. They called a fresh meeting yesterday afternoon at the Bourse du Travail, where about two thousand men gathered towards two oclock. The heat in the hall speedily became tropical, and the majority of the audience doffed their coats and waistcoats.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking seven days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Highlights From New Yorks Gay Pride Parade
A Syrian Refugee Leads Pride Parade
description: Subhi Nahas, a grand marshal in the gay-pride march in New York City, said it was important to give voice to people living and struggling in the Middle East.

title: 1966: 25,000 Participate in Freedom March
description: JACKSON, Miss.  Twenty-five thousand screaming, chanting demonstrators marched on the heavily guarded state capitol today [June 26], climaxing the freedom march that James Meredith began three weeks ago. The Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. called it the greatest demonstration for freedom in the history of Mississippi.

title: Bill Cunningham Looked Past the Runway to Capture Modern Identity
description: This is the age of street style, an era when we talk about the show outside the show: the people who dress to be photographed by the growing hordes of snappers on the sidewalk waiting to capture the ever-more exaggerated fashions necessary to stand out from the peacocking crowd and bestow upon them their 15 minutes, or seconds, of fame. Go to any fashion show and you can see it: a woman or man in a colorful, kooky get-up, swarmed by photographers jostling for the best shot and calling, Look over here! and, Who are you wearing?  lemmings in the land of the look-at-me.

title: Ballot Is Expected to Offer Stark Choice on Economy
description: The contempt that Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump express for each other will continue to play out in vitriolic sound bites. But their profound differences on what to do about the economy and the struggling middle class are far more important.

title: A Lesson From Brexit: On Immigration, Feelings Trump Facts
description: WASHINGTON  The economic fallout from Britains vote to leave the European Union was swift and stark. The pound cratered to its lowest level in three decades. When the London Stock Exchange opened the next morning, its leading share index immediately fell by more than 8 percent, the largest single-day drop since the 2008 financial crisis.

title: A Proud Family
description: Jazz Jennings, 15, a grand marshal in Sunday's pride festivities in New York City, said she was proud to lead her community.

title: Marching With a Cause
description: Cecilia Chung, a grand marshal in the Pride March in New York City, said that, despite some gains, the L.G.B.T. community still had a lot to fight for.

title: Donald Trump Slips Further Behind Hillary Clinton in New Polls

title: Finding Dory Tops Domestic Box Office in Its Second Weekend
description: A something-for-everyone weekend at movie theaters delivered mixed results.

title: Heng on Putins Visit to China
description: Despite Moscows push to strengthen ties with Beijing, Russia-China trade has shrunk sharply.

title: The Merchant of Venice, With Mercy, at Shakespeare & Company
description: Will the quality of mercy prove unstrained enough to embrace a work in which every single character is racist and sexist? That assessment of the dramatis personae in The Merchant of Venice comes from Tina Packer, who is directing the most problematic of the so-called problem plays for Shakespeare & Company in Lenox, Mass. As the founder of this venerable outpost of bardolatory in the Berkshires and for many years its artistic director, Ms. Packer has long been celebrated for her untiringly exploratory approach to the canon.

title: A Pride Parade of Joy and Pain
description: New York City held its annual gay pride parade on Sunday. The mood was both celebratory and mournful, coming just weeks after the shooting at a gay club in Orlando, Fla.

title: Brexit Surprised Hedge Fund Managers Used to Picking Winners
description: Even some of the smartest guys in the room got this one wrong.

title: Thom Browne: Spring 2017
description: Mr. Brownes spring 2017 mens collection.

title: Chuck Schumer: 'Lets Hear It for Pride!'
description: Senator Chuck Schumer, Democrat of New York, shouted with a megaphone during the pride in New York City on Sunday.

title: C.I.A. Arms for Syrian Rebels Supplied Black Market, Officials Say
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Weapons shipped into Jordan by the Central Intelligence Agency and Saudi Arabia intended for Syrian rebels have been systematically stolen by Jordanian intelligence operatives and sold to arms merchants on the black market, according to American and Jordanian officials.

title: Bill Cunningham Looked for Subjects. And They Looked for Him.
description: Bill Cunningham worked as discreetly as he could. My whole thing is to be invisible, he wrote in 2002. You get more natural pictures that way, too. But while he looked for subjects, his subjects also looked for him. After his death on Saturday at age 87, we asked New York Times readers to share their sightings  and personal photos  of Mr. Cunningham on the streets of New York City and beyond. The responses have been edited for clarity and length.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of June 25
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Intel Tells Stories That Go Beyond Chips
description: MAYBE you associate Intel with the processor that makes your laptop work. On one hand, thats a triumph of branding: For a slogan from a company that doesnt actually sell directly to consumers, Intel Inside is a familiar idea.

title: Twins Defeat Yankees With a Barrage of Home Runs
description: As the first round of boos rained from the stands at Yankee Stadium on Sunday afternoon, Nathan Eovaldi shuffled around behind the pitchers mound trying to regain his equilibrium. In a quick succession of swings  first by Brian Dozier, then by Trevor Plouffe  Eovaldis outing had imploded. With back-to-back home runs in the sixth inning, the woebegone Twins had broken open a previously one-run game.

title: La MaMa to Release Expanded Version of Digital Archive
description: Their names read like a whos who of the past half-centurys downtown performance scene. Among them: the playwright Sam Shepard, the composer Meredith Monk and the transgender actress and Warhol superstar Candy Darling. Early works by these artists and dozens more are coming to light Monday when La MaMa, the East Village performance space synonymous with the downtown avant-garde, releases an expanded version of its digital collections website.

title: In Chasing a Legend, Katie Ledecky Discovers a Buoyant Ally
description: OMAHA  To those who have watched her swim circles around the competition, Katie Ledecky appears to have no peers in the pool. Ledecky, however, knows better.

title: Private Equity Investment in Urban Areas
description: While most private equity firms havent focused on housing in urban communities, there are some exceptions.

title: Capturing the Eye-Catching Everyday
description: Bill Cunningham focused his camera on what people wore to telegraph their place in the world. Here are some of his best photographs of street style in New York.

title: Two Defending Champions, but Two Outlooks, at Wimbledon
description: WIMBLEDON, England  The not-so-United Kingdom clearly has bigger concerns than a mere tennis tournament, with the focus on the countrys leaving the European Union and on Englands remaining in soccers European Championships.

title: Mets Go Quietly Again. First-Place Nationals Are Waiting.
description: ATLANTA  A teams place in the standings can drift from week to week, especially in the fickle and forgiving National League East. Seven days ago, the Mets trailed the division-leading Washington Nationals by five and a half games. The offense was concerning, and more injuries would pile up.

title: New York Celebrates Gay Pride Parade
description: Sights, sounds and interviews with participants from New York City's Pride March, which ran through Manhattan on Sunday.

title: Volkswagen Faces Long Road Ahead, Even After a Civil Settlement
description: Even as the warring parties in Volkswagens emissions cheating scandal prepare to offer a peace proposal this week, the German automakers travails are far from over.

title: Review: Moves Versatile Enough for Philip Glass and James Brown
description: Since its founding in 1970, Philadanco has earned a reputation for versatility. During any one program, the members of this repertory dance troupe from Philadelphia are expected to shift among many styles. The breadth is always impressive, which makes it all the more disappointing that the aesthetic caliber of the choreography tends to get stuck in a much narrower range, seldom extending very high.

title: Review: In Katdashians! Break the Musical!, Cats Talk Like Kardashians
description: With apologies to Robert F. Kennedy and George Bernard Shaw:

title: Brexit Casts Uncertainty on Art Market
description: As the worlds leading auction houses prepared for their big-ticket contemporary sales in London this week, the question was on everybodys mind: What will the shock and confusion following Britains vote to leave the European Union  not to mention the plunging world financial markets  mean for the art market?

title: Perdue Aims to Make Chickens Happier and More Comfortable
description: SEAFORD, Del.  Sunlight floods the floor at one end of the chicken house here at Ash-O-Ley Acres, and spry little Cornish game hens flap their wings and chase one another.

title: Carefree Existences
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Sometimes a puzzle theme can bring up other things for a solver. Todays theme by Kevan Choset reminded me of this hilarious Hyperbole and a Half post about the sound one of her dogs made while stressed out about a move of house.

title: Cleveland Cavaliers Join Obamas To-Do List. He Loves This Part of the Job.
description: WASHINGTON  Nearly a year sometimes passes between a team winning a championship and its celebratory visit to the White House, but LeBron James and his fellow Cleveland Cavaliers will probably not have to wait that long.

title: Board Elections to the Motion Picture Academy Have Rare Sizzle
description: LOS ANGELES  In the sleepy past of, say, four or five years ago, elections to the governing board of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences were not a hot topic of conversation here  even on a slow afternoon at the Palm.

title: Battered by Storms, West Virginia Struggles to Recover
description: CHARLESTON, W.Va.  Cole Chapman and his wife, Silvia Gabriel Fields, were having coffee on their deck when a nearby creek suddenly burst its banks, sending them and their two children sprinting to their pickup truck for safety.

title: Review: In An Abbreviated Life, Ariel Leve Escapes Her Mommie Dearest
description: There comes a moment in young adulthood when many of us decide that one or both of our parents are crazy. But then we compare notes with friends, share stories with colleagues and discover, much to our astonishment, that crazy is relative, and the bell curve in this case is plump, and that our mothers or fathers, whom we once considered uniquely deranged, are really only averagely so.

title: Two Tony-Winning Hamilton Stars Step Out With New Albums
description: One of the thrills of Hamilton is in watching the flexibility of its performers as they effortlessly bounce between musical styles  its a testament to the versatility of the talents they brought in the door with them. Musical theater has its own native grammar, but this show and its stars hammer away at it with every song, rebuilding it in their own image.

title: Having Won, Some Brexit Campaigners Begin Backpedaling
description: LONDON  Freed from the shackles of the European Union, Britains economy would prosper and its security would increase. Britain would take back control of immigration, reducing the number of arrivals. And it would be able to spend about 350 million pounds, or about $470 million, a week more on health care instead of sending the money to Brussels.

title: Bill Would Require Relatives Consent for Schools to Use Cadavers
description: Ever since grave robbers haunted American cemeteries and medical students paid for fresh corpses, New York State law has appropriated unclaimed bodies on behalf of medical schools that teach anatomical dissection.

title: Central Banks Worry About Engaging World Markets After Brexit
description: As global markets reel after an establishment-rattling vote by Britain to sever ties with Europe, investors are again expecting central banks to ride to the rescue.

title: Clashes Draw Support for Teachers Protest in Mexico
description: NOCHIXTLN, Mexico  The battle over education here has suddenly turned literal.

title: Study Links 6.5 Million Deaths Each Year to Air Pollution
description: A sobering report released on Monday by the International Energy Agency says air pollution has become a major public health crisis leading to around 6.5 million deaths each year, with many of its root causes and cures found in the energy industry.

title: Bottles That Could Make Every Drop of Shampoo Count
description: Getting to the bottom of a shampoo bottle is never fun. Some of us let the bottle sit upside down. Some of us add water, hoping the remaining shampoo will glide out more easily. And some of us just give up and toss the old bottle.

title: Review: Urban Nightmares as Puppets in The Paper Hat Game
description: As any veteran urbanite can tell you, cities heave and swell, bend and buckle; they can go eerily placid and then rise up again to slap you down, just as a restless ocean does.

title: Buy Yourself an Interview
description: LOS ANGELES  If Charlie Rose wont interview you, Ben Mankiewicz might  for a price.

title: Great Britain or Little England? Brexit Vote Revives an Old Tension
description: LONDON  When Britons voted in a referendum last week, they faced a deceptively simple question: Did they or did they not wish to remain in the European Union? When they stunned the world by saying no, their sentiments were far more tangled.

title: Second (Avenue) Thoughts
description: Dear Diary:

title: New Jersey Woman Charged After Her Son, 6, Fatally Shoots His Brother, 4
description: A New Jersey mother was charged with endangering the welfare of a child after her 6-year-old son fatally shot his 4-year-old brother while playing with a gun, the authorities said.

title: 10 Injured During White Nationalist Protest in Sacramento
description: A rally by a white nationalist group at Californias State Capitol in Sacramento became violent on Sunday when protesters clashed with the group, leaving at least 10 people hurt, two of them critically, fire officials said.

title: Speak Up or Stay Hidden? Undocumented Immigrants Cautious After Court Ruling
description: PHOENIX  Karina Ruiz and other protesters blocked a busy road here last week hours after the Supreme Court denied relief from deportation for millions of undocumented parents, including her father.

title: Congressional Hopefuls Face Off in New York Primaries
description: Come November, the New York State congressional delegation is certain to look different, with several incumbents retiring, and those remaining forced to deal with the effect of Donald J. Trump, the presumptive Republican presidential nominee, on the ballot.

title: This Is Just the Start of the Brexits Economic Disaster
description: LONDON  A few weeks before Britons voted on whether to remain part of the European Union, Michael Gove, one of the leaders of the Leave campaign, was asked why he should be trusted over the overwhelming number of economists and international authorities who opposed Brexit. People in this country have had enough of experts, he replied.

title: Tutors See Stereotypes and Gender Bias in SAT. Testers See None of the Above.
description: In an annual ritual, hundreds of thousands of students took the SAT this spring as they made their first steps toward applying to college. But they were not the only ones being tested.

title: A Drone Start-Up Explores Underwater
description: GLENBROOK, Nev.  A vast, largely unexplored world is being opened by hobbyists piloting robotic submarines capable of traveling hundreds of feet below the surface of lakes, rivers and oceans.

title: Jim Hickman, Slugger for Expansion Mets and All-Star with Cubs, Dies at 79
description: Jim Hickman, who supplied batting punch for the Mets during their futile early years and then became an All-Star for the Chicago Cubs, died on Saturday in Jackson, Tenn. He was 79.

title: Israel and Turkey Agree to Resume Full Diplomatic Ties
description: JERUSALEM  Israel and Turkey agreed on Sunday to resume full diplomatic relations, ending a bitter, six-year rift between the once-close regional allies, according to Israeli and Turkish officials.

title: At Cannes, the Ad Industry Confronts the Rise of Facebook
description: CANNES, France  The invasion has begun.

title: Election in Spain Gives Conservatives More Seats but No Mandate
description: MADRID  The conservative Popular Party of Mariano Rajoy, Spains caretaker prime minister, won the most votes in Spains repeat national elections on Sunday, as the Socialists held off a challenge from the Podemos Party to remain the largest left-wing formation.

title: Hillary Clinton Surprises by Attending Pride Parade in New York
description: It is difficult to surprise at New York Citys pride parade  that pulsing kaleidoscope of pink unicorn horns and rainbow undergarments, bejeweled miniature dogs and glitter-specked revelers who seemed to have misplaced their shoes.

title: School Is Still in Session. That Doesnt Mean Students Are in Class.
description: There is school in New York City until Tuesday, but many of the school systems one million students are not letting that get in their way.

title: After Brexit, a Splitting Hangover for the City of London
description: LONDON  Luke Hickmore had an aperitif Thursday night, watched the early results on Britains vote to leave the European Union and went to bed. He didnt sleep long.

title: How Housings New Players Spiraled Into Banks Old Mistakes
description: When the housing crisis sent the American economy to the brink of disaster in 2008, millions of people lost their homes. The banking system had failed homeowners and their families.

title: Private Equity and Housing
description: The Times focused on three of the biggest private equity firms operating in the housing industry to better understand their impact on homeowners and renters.

title: Demand for Himalayan Viagra Fungus Heats Up, Maybe Too Much
description: BAGDANDA, Nepal  From a pasture high in the Himalayas, Tulsingh Rokaya, 55, a shepherd, watched for years as the number of itinerant harvesters swelled.

title: Oh, Hello on Broadway Brings Kibitzers to Broadway
description: Sure, Hamilton may have a Pulitzer Prize, 11 Tony Awards and an international following. But does it have two Upper West Siders of a certain age kvetching for an audiences entertainment and pranking celebrity guests with inordinate amounts of tuna fish?

title: Collecting Fees Whether You Stay or Go
description: When Nationstar becomes your mortgage bill collector, it can make money at every step, regardless of whether you remain in the home or are foreclosed on and kicked out. Making money on foreclosures creates potential conflicts of interest.

title: With Brexit, Washingtons Direct Line to the Continent Suddenly Frays
description: American officials struggling to reimagine their strategy after Britains decision to divorce the European Union say the most urgent challenge will be to find a way to replace their most reliable, sympathetic partner in the hallways of European capitals. It will not be easy.

title: To Wimbledon Wild Card, Life Feels Lifted From a Hollywood Script
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Wimbledon, a movie released 12 years ago, was a romantic comedy about a British tennis player on the verge of retirement who finds love, and then unlikely success at the tournament.

title: The Implications of the Brexit Vote, Stress Tests and Puerto Rico
description: ECONOMY

title: Nervous and Contrite, Jose Reyes Returns to New York
description: Jose Reyes put his head down as he left the on-deck circle, strode toward home plate and dug in his spikes in the batters box. As he did, many in the capacity crowd at MCU Park in Coney Island rose to their feet and welcomed him with a familiar chant.

title: Panama Celebrates Expanded Canals Successful First Passage
description: A Chinese-owned container ship, Cosco Shipping Panama, on Sunday became the first commercial vessel to successfully cross the Panama Canals newly expanded locks, a historic achievement that Panama hopes will keep the canal as relevant in this century as it was in the last.

title: No Corrections: June 27, 2016
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: You think all you have to do is show them where they did you wrong, and basically justice will prevail. That wasnt the case.

title: John Santucci, Prosecutor in High-Profile Cases in New York, Dies at 85
description: John J. Santucci, who as the Queens district attorney from 1977 to 1991 became a lightning rod of controversy in high-profile cases involving a fatal racial attack, a municipal corruption scandal and allegations of lethal police brutality, died on Sunday in Mineola, N.Y. He was 85.

title: Gerald Walpin, Watchdog Fired Over AmeriCorps Inquiry, Dies at 84
description: Gerald Walpin, a former inspector general for the Corporation for National and Community Service whose 2009 firing by President Obama was harshly criticized by Republicans, died on Friday after being struck by a vehicle while crossing the street in Manhattan. He was 84.

title: Ryan Lochte, 12 Olympic Champion, Misses Rio Cut in 400 I.M.
description: OMAHA  Ryan Lochte was off to a rough start at the United States Olympic trials even before he climbed on the blocks Sunday night for the second step in his defense of his Olympic gold medal in the 400-meter individual medley.

title: Silicon Valley Season 3 Finale: An Empire Built on Quicksand
description: In Silicon Valley, the ups and downs of Pied Pipers fortunes are part of its comedic formula: Week after week, and sometimes within the space of a single episode, the company can go from the belles of the balls to the brink of tech-bubble oblivion. That gnawing tension brings the best out of the characters, too, turning Richard into a quivering, inarticulate ball of anxiety, and goosing Erlich into the bong-fueled pontification necessary to save his helpless incubees. There are times when you watch it with your eyes half-covered, like a horror movie, because the specter of failure pursues Pied Piper as relentlessly as a slasher villain in a hockey mask.

title: Pride Marches On, With Jubilation and Solemn Tributes to Victims of Massacre
description: There were scores of men and women, some uninhibited by cares or much clothing, dancing to pulsing beats on a sunny Sunday afternoon along Fifth Avenue. Revving motorcycle engines and honking horns drowned out the cheers of the swelling crowds that lined a two-mile route that started in Midtown Manhattan and reached down to the West Village.

title: Yankees Are Said to Enter Deal With StubHub
description: Bedeviled by dwindling attendance and criticism from fans about their ticketing policies, the Yankees are entering into a partnership with StubHub, a longtime nemesis, to take over the Yankees Ticket Exchange from Ticketmaster, according to a person familiar with the negotiations.

title: Brexit Worries British Cultural Institutions Facing Loss of Aid
description: LONDON  British cultural organizations and prominent figures in theater, dance and film reacted with dismay after Britain voted to leave the European Union. But as with many British industries and institutions, uncertainty prevails over what withdrawal will mean.

title: In American Markets, Panic Begins to Subside
description: The market panic that initially met Britains vote to leave the European Union showed signs of subsiding on Monday.

title: Lionel Messi and Argentina Miss Again as Chile Wins Copa Amrica
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Lionel Messi had the collar of his shirt pulled up to his nose. With his eyes peeking out just over the fabric, he watched a nightmare unfold.

title: Game of Thrones Season 6 Finale: Setting Up the Endgame
description: Over 10 weeks in the sixth season of Game of Thrones, it has become a clich to note that the powerful women have come to the fore. But there was one character whose trajectory seemed to be the exception to the feminist revolution remaking this story.

title: R. Michael Brown, Defender of Notable New York City Interiors, Dies at 78
description: R.
